module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | A time range, set in seconds, between two points in the call.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbsoluteTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data AbsoluteTimeRange
AbsoluteTimeRange' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | A value that indicates the beginning of the time range in seconds. To
--   set absolute time range, you must specify a start time and an end
--   time. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
[$sel:startTime:AbsoluteTimeRange'] :: AbsoluteTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A value that indicates the end of the time range in milliseconds. To
--   set absolute time range, you must specify a start time and an end
--   time. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
[$sel:endTime:AbsoluteTimeRange'] :: AbsoluteTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A time range from the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set to the
--   last 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
[$sel:last:AbsoluteTimeRange'] :: AbsoluteTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A time range from the beginning of the call to the value that you've
--   specified. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set
--   to the first 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
[$sel:first:AbsoluteTimeRange'] :: AbsoluteTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.JobExecutionSettings

-- | Provides information about when a transcription job should be
--   executed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionSettings
JobExecutionSettings' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> JobExecutionSettings

-- | Indicates whether a job should be queued by Amazon Transcribe when the
--   concurrent execution limit is exceeded. When the
--   <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field is true, jobs are queued and
--   executed when the number of executing jobs falls below the concurrent
--   execution limit. If the field is false, Amazon Transcribe returns a
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt> exception.
--   
--   Note that job queuing is enabled by default for call analytics jobs.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
[$sel:allowDeferredExecution:JobExecutionSettings'] :: JobExecutionSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3
--   bucket that contains the input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this
--   role to read queued media files. If you have specified an output S3
--   bucket for the transcription results, this role should have access to
--   the output bucket as well.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
[$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:JobExecutionSettings'] :: JobExecutionSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowDeferredExecution:JobExecutionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSettings_allowDeferredExecution</a> - Indicates whether
--   a job should be queued by Amazon Transcribe when the concurrent
--   execution limit is exceeded. When the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt>
--   field is true, jobs are queued and executed when the number of
--   executing jobs falls below the concurrent execution limit. If the
--   field is false, Amazon Transcribe returns a
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt> exception.
--   
--   Note that job queuing is enabled by default for call analytics jobs.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:JobExecutionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSettings_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3 bucket that contains
--   the input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this role to read queued
--   media files. If you have specified an output S3 bucket for the
--   transcription results, this role should have access to the output
--   bucket as well.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
newJobExecutionSettings :: JobExecutionSettings

-- | Indicates whether a job should be queued by Amazon Transcribe when the
--   concurrent execution limit is exceeded. When the
--   <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field is true, jobs are queued and
--   executed when the number of executing jobs falls below the concurrent
--   execution limit. If the field is false, Amazon Transcribe returns a
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt> exception.
--   
--   Note that job queuing is enabled by default for call analytics jobs.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
jobExecutionSettings_allowDeferredExecution :: Lens' JobExecutionSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3
--   bucket that contains the input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this
--   role to read queued media files. If you have specified an output S3
--   bucket for the transcription results, this role should have access to
--   the output bucket as well.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
jobExecutionSettings_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' JobExecutionSettings (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSummary

-- | Provides summary information about a call analytics job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallAnalyticsJobSummary</a> smart constructor.
data CallAnalyticsJobSummary
CallAnalyticsJobSummary' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CallAnalyticsJobSummary

-- | The language of the transcript in the source audio file.
[$sel:languageCode:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The status of the call analytics job.
[$sel:callAnalyticsJobStatus:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
[$sel:completionTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job began processing.
[$sel:startTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
[$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | If the <tt>CallAnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
[$sel:failureReason:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CallAnalyticsJobSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSummary_languageCode</a> - The language of the
--   transcript in the source audio file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobStatus:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSummary_callAnalyticsJobStatus</a> - The status of
--   the call analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSummary_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the call analytics job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSummary_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSummary_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the job began processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSummary_callAnalyticsJobName</a> - The name of the
--   call analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSummary_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>CallAnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a description of
--   the error.
newCallAnalyticsJobSummary :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary

-- | The language of the transcript in the source audio file.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_languageCode :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The status of the call analytics job.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_callAnalyticsJobStatus :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics job was created.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_creationTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_completionTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job began processing.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_startTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_callAnalyticsJobName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | If the <tt>CallAnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_failureReason :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSummary.CallAnalyticsJobSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSummary.CallAnalyticsJobSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSummary.CallAnalyticsJobSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSummary.CallAnalyticsJobSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSummary.CallAnalyticsJobSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSummary.CallAnalyticsJobSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSummary.CallAnalyticsJobSummary


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Media

-- | Describes the input media file in a transcription request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedia</a> smart constructor.
data Media
Media' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Media

-- | The S3 object location of the input media file. The URI must be in the
--   same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form
--   is:
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:mediaFileUri:Media'] :: Media -> Maybe Text

-- | The S3 object location for your redacted output media file. This is
--   only supported for call analytics jobs.
[$sel:redactedMediaFileUri:Media'] :: Media -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Media</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFileUri:Media'</a>, <a>media_mediaFileUri</a> - The S3
--   object location of the input media file. The URI must be in the same
--   region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form is:
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactedMediaFileUri:Media'</a>,
--   <a>media_redactedMediaFileUri</a> - The S3 object location for your
--   redacted output media file. This is only supported for call analytics
--   jobs.
newMedia :: Media

-- | The S3 object location of the input media file. The URI must be in the
--   same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form
--   is:
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
media_mediaFileUri :: Lens' Media (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 object location for your redacted output media file. This is
--   only supported for call analytics jobs.
media_redactedMediaFileUri :: Lens' Media (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Media.Media
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Media.Media

--   the medical transcript.

--   S3 bucket you created to store the medical transcript.
newMedicalTranscript :: MedicalTranscript

--   S3 bucket you created to store the medical transcript.

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | Optional settings for the StartMedicalTranscriptionJob operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscriptionSetting</a> smart constructor.
data MedicalTranscriptionSetting
MedicalTranscriptionSetting' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | Determines whether alternative transcripts are generated along with
--   the transcript that has the highest confidence. If you set
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
[$sel:showAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Bool

-- | Instructs Amazon Transcribe Medical to process each audio channel
--   separately and then merge the transcription output of each channel
--   into a single transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical also produces a transcription of each item
--   detected on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of
--   the item and alternative transcriptions of item. The alternative
--   transcriptions also come with confidence scores provided by Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>
[$sel:channelIdentification:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Bool

-- | The maximum number of alternatives that you tell the service to
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
[$sel:maxAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Natural

-- | Determines whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to
--   identify different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition
--   labels individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels in the <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
[$sel:showSpeakerLabels:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the vocabulary to use when processing a medical
--   transcription job.
[$sel:vocabularyName:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If
--   there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple
--   speakers are identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
[$sel:maxSpeakerLabels:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionSetting</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:showAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_showAlternatives</a> - Determines
--   whether alternative transcripts are generated along with the
--   transcript that has the highest confidence. If you set
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelIdentification:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_channelIdentification</a> - Instructs
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical to process each audio channel separately and
--   then merge the transcription output of each channel into a single
--   transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical also produces a transcription of each item
--   detected on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of
--   the item and alternative transcriptions of item. The alternative
--   transcriptions also come with confidence scores provided by Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_maxAlternatives</a> - The maximum
--   number of alternatives that you tell the service to return. If you
--   specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:showSpeakerLabels:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_showSpeakerLabels</a> - Determines
--   whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to identify
--   different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition labels
--   individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels in the <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_vocabularyName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary to use when processing a medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSpeakerLabels:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_maxSpeakerLabels</a> - The maximum
--   number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If there are more
--   speakers in the audio than this number, multiple speakers are
--   identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
newMedicalTranscriptionSetting :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | Determines whether alternative transcripts are generated along with
--   the transcript that has the highest confidence. If you set
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_showAlternatives :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Bool)

-- | Instructs Amazon Transcribe Medical to process each audio channel
--   separately and then merge the transcription output of each channel
--   into a single transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical also produces a transcription of each item
--   detected on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of
--   the item and alternative transcriptions of item. The alternative
--   transcriptions also come with confidence scores provided by Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>
medicalTranscriptionSetting_channelIdentification :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Bool)

-- | The maximum number of alternatives that you tell the service to
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_maxAlternatives :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Natural)

-- | Determines whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to
--   identify different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition
--   labels individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels in the <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_showSpeakerLabels :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the vocabulary to use when processing a medical
--   transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_vocabularyName :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If
--   there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple
--   speakers are identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_maxSpeakerLabels :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting.MedicalTranscriptionSetting
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting.MedicalTranscriptionSetting
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting.MedicalTranscriptionSetting
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting.MedicalTranscriptionSetting
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting.MedicalTranscriptionSetting
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting.MedicalTranscriptionSetting
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting.MedicalTranscriptionSetting
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionSetting.MedicalTranscriptionSetting

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.LanguageModel

-- | The structure used to describe a custom language model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLanguageModel</a> smart constructor.
data LanguageModel
LanguageModel' :: Maybe CLMLanguageCode -> Maybe InputDataConfig -> Maybe ModelStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BaseModelName -> LanguageModel

-- | The language code you used to create your custom language model.
[$sel:languageCode:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe CLMLanguageCode

-- | The data access role and Amazon S3 prefixes for the input files used
--   to train the custom language model.
[$sel:inputDataConfig:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe InputDataConfig

-- | The creation status of a custom language model. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is ready for use.
[$sel:modelStatus:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe ModelStatus

-- | The reason why the custom language model couldn't be created.
[$sel:failureReason:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the custom language model was created.
[$sel:createTime:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Whether the base model used for the custom language model is up to
--   date. If this field is <tt>true</tt> then you are running the most
--   up-to-date version of the base model in your custom language model.
[$sel:upgradeAvailability:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe Bool

-- | The most recent time the custom language model was modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the custom language model.
[$sel:modelName:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model used to
--   create the custom language model.
[$sel:baseModelName:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe BaseModelName

-- | Create a value of <a>LanguageModel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_languageCode</a> - The language code you used to
--   create your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_inputDataConfig</a> - The data access role and Amazon
--   S3 prefixes for the input files used to train the custom language
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelStatus:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_modelStatus</a> - The creation status of a custom
--   language model. When the status is <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is
--   ready for use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_failureReason</a> - The reason why the custom
--   language model couldn't be created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTime:LanguageModel'</a>, <a>languageModel_createTime</a>
--   - The time the custom language model was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:upgradeAvailability:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_upgradeAvailability</a> - Whether the base model used
--   for the custom language model is up to date. If this field is
--   <tt>true</tt> then you are running the most up-to-date version of the
--   base model in your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_lastModifiedTime</a> - The most recent time the
--   custom language model was modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelName:LanguageModel'</a>, <a>languageModel_modelName</a> -
--   The name of the custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseModelName:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_baseModelName</a> - The Amazon Transcribe standard
--   language model, or base model used to create the custom language
--   model.
newLanguageModel :: LanguageModel

-- | The language code you used to create your custom language model.
languageModel_languageCode :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe CLMLanguageCode)

-- | The data access role and Amazon S3 prefixes for the input files used
--   to train the custom language model.
languageModel_inputDataConfig :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe InputDataConfig)

-- | The creation status of a custom language model. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is ready for use.
languageModel_modelStatus :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe ModelStatus)

-- | The reason why the custom language model couldn't be created.
languageModel_failureReason :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the custom language model was created.
languageModel_createTime :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Whether the base model used for the custom language model is up to
--   date. If this field is <tt>true</tt> then you are running the most
--   up-to-date version of the base model in your custom language model.
languageModel_upgradeAvailability :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Bool)

-- | The most recent time the custom language model was modified.
languageModel_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the custom language model.
languageModel_modelName :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model used to
--   create the custom language model.
languageModel_baseModelName :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe BaseModelName)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.LanguageModel.LanguageModel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.LanguageModel.LanguageModel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.LanguageModel.LanguageModel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.LanguageModel.LanguageModel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.LanguageModel.LanguageModel
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.LanguageModel.LanguageModel
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.LanguageModel.LanguageModel

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ChannelDefinition

-- | For a call analytics job, an object that indicates the audio channel
--   that belongs to the agent and the audio channel that belongs to the
--   customer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelDefinition
ChannelDefinition' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> ChannelDefinition

-- | A value that indicates the audio channel.
[$sel:channelId:ChannelDefinition'] :: ChannelDefinition -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates whether the person speaking on the audio channel is the
--   agent or customer.
[$sel:participantRole:ChannelDefinition'] :: ChannelDefinition -> Maybe ParticipantRole

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelDefinition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelId:ChannelDefinition'</a>,

--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:ChannelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>channelDefinition_participantRole</a> - Indicates whether the
--   person speaking on the audio channel is the agent or customer.
newChannelDefinition :: ChannelDefinition

-- | A value that indicates the audio channel.
channelDefinition_channelId :: Lens' ChannelDefinition (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates whether the person speaking on the audio channel is the
--   agent or customer.
channelDefinition_participantRole :: Lens' ChannelDefinition (Maybe ParticipantRole)

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction

-- | Settings for content redaction within a transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContentRedaction</a> smart constructor.
data ContentRedaction
ContentRedaction' :: RedactionType -> RedactionOutput -> ContentRedaction

-- | Request parameter that defines the entities to be redacted. The only
--   accepted value is <tt>PII</tt>.
[$sel:redactionType:ContentRedaction'] :: ContentRedaction -> RedactionType

-- | The output transcript file stored in either the default S3 bucket or
--   in a bucket you specify.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe outputs only the
--   redacted transcript.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted_and_unredacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe
--   outputs both the redacted and unredacted transcripts.
[$sel:redactionOutput:ContentRedaction'] :: ContentRedaction -> RedactionOutput

-- | Create a value of <a>ContentRedaction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactionType:ContentRedaction'</a>,
--   <a>contentRedaction_redactionType</a> - Request parameter that defines
--   the entities to be redacted. The only accepted value is <tt>PII</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactionOutput:ContentRedaction'</a>,
--   <a>contentRedaction_redactionOutput</a> - The output transcript file
--   stored in either the default S3 bucket or in a bucket you specify.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe outputs only the
--   redacted transcript.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted_and_unredacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe
--   outputs both the redacted and unredacted transcripts.
newContentRedaction :: RedactionType -> RedactionOutput -> ContentRedaction

-- | Request parameter that defines the entities to be redacted. The only
--   accepted value is <tt>PII</tt>.
contentRedaction_redactionType :: Lens' ContentRedaction RedactionType

-- | The output transcript file stored in either the default S3 bucket or
--   in a bucket you specify.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe outputs only the
--   redacted transcript.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted_and_unredacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe
--   outputs both the redacted and unredacted transcripts.
contentRedaction_redactionOutput :: Lens' ContentRedaction RedactionOutput
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction.ContentRedaction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction.ContentRedaction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction.ContentRedaction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction.ContentRedaction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction.ContentRedaction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction.ContentRedaction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction.ContentRedaction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.ContentRedaction.ContentRedaction


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where you would like to apply a filter. For example, you can
--   specify the first half of the call. You can also specify the period of
--   time between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the
--   call. Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you
--   can apply relative time ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRelativeTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data RelativeTimeRange
RelativeTimeRange' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> RelativeTimeRange

-- | A value that indicates the percentage of the beginning of the time
--   range. To set a relative time range, you must specify a start
--   percentage and an end percentage. For example, if you specify the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
[$sel:startPercentage:RelativeTimeRange'] :: RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A value that indicates the percentage of the end of the time range. To
--   set a relative time range, you must specify a start percentage and an
--   end percentage. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
[$sel:endPercentage:RelativeTimeRange'] :: RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A range that takes the portion of the call from the time in
--   milliseconds set by the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is
--   set for the last 120,000 milliseconds of the call.
[$sel:last:RelativeTimeRange'] :: RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A range that takes the portion of the call up to the time in
--   milliseconds set by the value that you've specified. For example, if
--   you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is set for the first
--   120,000 milliseconds of the call.
[$sel:first:RelativeTimeRange'] :: RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>RelativeTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startPercentage:RelativeTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>relativeTimeRange_startPercentage</a> - A value that indicates the
--   percentage of the beginning of the time range. To set a relative time
--   range, you must specify a start percentage and an end percentage. For
--   example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endPercentage:RelativeTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>relativeTimeRange_endPercentage</a> - A value that indicates the
--   percentage of the end of the time range. To set a relative time range,
--   you must specify a start percentage and an end percentage. For
--   example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
--   
--   <a>$sel:last:RelativeTimeRange'</a>, <a>relativeTimeRange_last</a> - A
--   range that takes the portion of the call from the time in milliseconds
--   set by the value that you've specified to the end of the call. For
--   example, if you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is set for the
--   last 120,000 milliseconds of the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:first:RelativeTimeRange'</a>, <a>relativeTimeRange_first</a> -
--   A range that takes the portion of the call up to the time in
--   milliseconds set by the value that you've specified. For example, if
--   you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is set for the first
--   120,000 milliseconds of the call.
newRelativeTimeRange :: RelativeTimeRange

-- | A value that indicates the percentage of the beginning of the time
--   range. To set a relative time range, you must specify a start
--   percentage and an end percentage. For example, if you specify the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
relativeTimeRange_startPercentage :: Lens' RelativeTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A value that indicates the percentage of the end of the time range. To
--   set a relative time range, you must specify a start percentage and an
--   end percentage. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
relativeTimeRange_endPercentage :: Lens' RelativeTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A range that takes the portion of the call from the time in
--   milliseconds set by the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is
--   set for the last 120,000 milliseconds of the call.
relativeTimeRange_last :: Lens' RelativeTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A range that takes the portion of the call up to the time in
--   milliseconds set by the value that you've specified. For example, if
--   you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is set for the first
--   120,000 milliseconds of the call.
relativeTimeRange_first :: Lens' RelativeTimeRange (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange.RelativeTimeRange
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange.RelativeTimeRange
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange.RelativeTimeRange
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange.RelativeTimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange.RelativeTimeRange
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange.RelativeTimeRange
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange.RelativeTimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.RelativeTimeRange.RelativeTimeRange


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter

-- | An object that enables you to configure your category to be applied to
--   call analytics jobs where either the customer or agent was
--   interrupted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNonTalkTimeFilter</a> smart constructor.
data NonTalkTimeFilter
NonTalkTimeFilter' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> NonTalkTimeFilter

-- | The duration of the period when neither the customer nor agent was
--   talking.
[$sel:threshold:NonTalkTimeFilter'] :: NonTalkTimeFilter -> Maybe Natural

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where there was silence. For example, you can specify the first
--   half of the call. You can also specify the period of time between
--   halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the call. Because
--   the length of conversation can vary between calls, you can apply
--   relative time ranges across all calls.
[$sel:relativeTimeRange:NonTalkTimeFilter'] :: NonTalkTimeFilter -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period when people were
--   talking.
[$sel:negate:NonTalkTimeFilter'] :: NonTalkTimeFilter -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object you can use to specify a time range (in milliseconds) for
--   when no one is talking. For example, you could specify a time period
--   between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the 45,000 millisecond mark.
--   You could also specify the time period as the first 15,000
--   milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
[$sel:absoluteTimeRange:NonTalkTimeFilter'] :: NonTalkTimeFilter -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>NonTalkTimeFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:NonTalkTimeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nonTalkTimeFilter_threshold</a> - The duration of the period when
--   neither the customer nor agent was talking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:NonTalkTimeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nonTalkTimeFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - An object that allows
--   percentages to specify the proportion of the call where there was
--   silence. For example, you can specify the first half of the call. You
--   can also specify the period of time between halfway through to
--   three-quarters of the way through the call. Because the length of
--   conversation can vary between calls, you can apply relative time
--   ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:NonTalkTimeFilter'</a>, <a>nonTalkTimeFilter_negate</a>
--   - Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period when people were
--   talking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:NonTalkTimeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nonTalkTimeFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - An object you can use to
--   specify a time range (in milliseconds) for when no one is talking. For
--   example, you could specify a time period between the 30,000
--   millisecond mark and the 45,000 millisecond mark. You could also
--   specify the time period as the first 15,000 milliseconds or the last
--   15,000 milliseconds.
newNonTalkTimeFilter :: NonTalkTimeFilter

-- | The duration of the period when neither the customer nor agent was
--   talking.
nonTalkTimeFilter_threshold :: Lens' NonTalkTimeFilter (Maybe Natural)

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where there was silence. For example, you can specify the first
--   half of the call. You can also specify the period of time between
--   halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the call. Because
--   the length of conversation can vary between calls, you can apply
--   relative time ranges across all calls.
nonTalkTimeFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' NonTalkTimeFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period when people were
--   talking.
nonTalkTimeFilter_negate :: Lens' NonTalkTimeFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object you can use to specify a time range (in milliseconds) for
--   when no one is talking. For example, you could specify a time period
--   between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the 45,000 millisecond mark.
--   You could also specify the time period as the first 15,000
--   milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
nonTalkTimeFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' NonTalkTimeFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter.NonTalkTimeFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter.NonTalkTimeFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter.NonTalkTimeFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter.NonTalkTimeFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter.NonTalkTimeFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter.NonTalkTimeFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter.NonTalkTimeFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.NonTalkTimeFilter.NonTalkTimeFilter


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter

-- | An object that enables you to configure your category to be applied to
--   call analytics jobs where either the customer or agent was
--   interrupted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInterruptionFilter</a> smart constructor.
data InterruptionFilter
InterruptionFilter' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> InterruptionFilter

-- | The duration of the interruption.
[$sel:threshold:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe Natural

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where there was a interruption. For example, you can specify the
--   first half of the call. You can also specify the period of time
--   between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the call.
--   Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you can
--   apply relative time ranges across all calls.
[$sel:relativeTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period where there was no
--   interruption.
[$sel:negate:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe Bool

-- | Indicates whether the caller or customer was interrupting.
[$sel:participantRole:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe ParticipantRole

-- | An object you can use to specify a time range (in milliseconds) for
--   when you'd want to find the interruption. For example, you could
--   search for an interruption between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the
--   45,000 millisecond mark. You could also specify the time period as the
--   first 15,000 milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
[$sel:absoluteTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>InterruptionFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_threshold</a> - The duration of the
--   interruption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - An object that allows
--   percentages to specify the proportion of the call where there was a
--   interruption. For example, you can specify the first half of the call.
--   You can also specify the period of time between halfway through to
--   three-quarters of the way through the call. Because the length of
--   conversation can vary between calls, you can apply relative time
--   ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_negate</a> - Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a
--   time period where there was no interruption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_participantRole</a> - Indicates whether the
--   caller or customer was interrupting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - An object you can use to
--   specify a time range (in milliseconds) for when you'd want to find the
--   interruption. For example, you could search for an interruption
--   between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the 45,000 millisecond mark.
--   You could also specify the time period as the first 15,000
--   milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
newInterruptionFilter :: InterruptionFilter

-- | The duration of the interruption.
interruptionFilter_threshold :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe Natural)

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where there was a interruption. For example, you can specify the
--   first half of the call. You can also specify the period of time
--   between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the call.
--   Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you can
--   apply relative time ranges across all calls.
interruptionFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period where there was no
--   interruption.
interruptionFilter_negate :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | Indicates whether the caller or customer was interrupting.
interruptionFilter_participantRole :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | An object you can use to specify a time range (in milliseconds) for
--   when you'd want to find the interruption. For example, you could
--   search for an interruption between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the
--   45,000 millisecond mark. You could also specify the time period as the
--   first 15,000 milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
interruptionFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter.InterruptionFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter.InterruptionFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter.InterruptionFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter.InterruptionFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter.InterruptionFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter.InterruptionFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter.InterruptionFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.InterruptionFilter.InterruptionFilter

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter

-- | An object that enables you to specify a particular customer or agent
--   sentiment. If at least 50 percent of the conversation turns (the
--   back-and-forth between two speakers) in a specified time period match
--   the specified sentiment, Amazon Transcribe will consider the sentiment
--   a match.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSentimentFilter</a> smart constructor.
data SentimentFilter
SentimentFilter' :: Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> NonEmpty SentimentValue -> SentimentFilter

-- | The time range, set in percentages, that correspond to proportion of
--   the call.
[$sel:relativeTimeRange:SentimentFilter'] :: SentimentFilter -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for sentiments that weren't specified in
--   the request.
[$sel:negate:SentimentFilter'] :: SentimentFilter -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that determines whether the sentiment belongs to the customer
--   or the agent.
[$sel:participantRole:SentimentFilter'] :: SentimentFilter -> Maybe ParticipantRole

-- | The time range, measured in seconds, of the sentiment.
[$sel:absoluteTimeRange:SentimentFilter'] :: SentimentFilter -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | An array that enables you to specify sentiments for the customer or
--   agent. You can specify one or more values.
[$sel:sentiments:SentimentFilter'] :: SentimentFilter -> NonEmpty SentimentValue

-- | Create a value of <a>SentimentFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:SentimentFilter'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - The time range, set in
--   percentages, that correspond to proportion of the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:SentimentFilter'</a>, <a>sentimentFilter_negate</a> -
--   Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for sentiments that weren't specified in
--   the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:SentimentFilter'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentFilter_participantRole</a> - A value that determines
--   whether the sentiment belongs to the customer or the agent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:SentimentFilter'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - The time range, measured in
--   seconds, of the sentiment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentiments:SentimentFilter'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentFilter_sentiments</a> - An array that enables you to
--   specify sentiments for the customer or agent. You can specify one or
--   more values.
newSentimentFilter :: NonEmpty SentimentValue -> SentimentFilter

-- | The time range, set in percentages, that correspond to proportion of
--   the call.
sentimentFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' SentimentFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for sentiments that weren't specified in
--   the request.
sentimentFilter_negate :: Lens' SentimentFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that determines whether the sentiment belongs to the customer
--   or the agent.
sentimentFilter_participantRole :: Lens' SentimentFilter (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | The time range, measured in seconds, of the sentiment.
sentimentFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' SentimentFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)

-- | An array that enables you to specify sentiments for the customer or
--   agent. You can specify one or more values.
sentimentFilter_sentiments :: Lens' SentimentFilter (NonEmpty SentimentValue)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter.SentimentFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter.SentimentFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter.SentimentFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter.SentimentFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter.SentimentFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter.SentimentFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter.SentimentFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SentimentFilter.SentimentFilter

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Subtitles

-- | Generate subtitles for your batch transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubtitles</a> smart constructor.
data Subtitles
Subtitles' :: Maybe [SubtitleFormat] -> Subtitles

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SubtitlesOutput

-- | Specify the output format for your subtitle file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubtitlesOutput</a> smart constructor.
data SubtitlesOutput
SubtitlesOutput' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [SubtitleFormat] -> SubtitlesOutput

-- | Choose the output location for your subtitle file. This location must
--   be an S3 bucket.
[$sel:subtitleFileUris:SubtitlesOutput'] :: SubtitlesOutput -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specify the output format for your subtitle file; if you select both
--   SRT and VTT formats, two output files are genereated.
[$sel:formats:SubtitlesOutput'] :: SubtitlesOutput -> Maybe [SubtitleFormat]

-- | Create a value of <a>SubtitlesOutput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subtitleFileUris:SubtitlesOutput'</a>,
--   <a>subtitlesOutput_subtitleFileUris</a> - Choose the output location
--   for your subtitle file. This location must be an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:formats:SubtitlesOutput'</a>, <a>subtitlesOutput_formats</a> -
--   Specify the output format for your subtitle file; if you select both
--   SRT and VTT formats, two output files are genereated.
newSubtitlesOutput :: SubtitlesOutput

-- | Choose the output location for your subtitle file. This location must
--   be an S3 bucket.
subtitlesOutput_subtitleFileUris :: Lens' SubtitlesOutput (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specify the output format for your subtitle file; if you select both
--   SRT and VTT formats, two output files are genereated.
subtitlesOutput_formats :: Lens' SubtitlesOutput (Maybe [SubtitleFormat])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SubtitlesOutput.SubtitlesOutput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SubtitlesOutput.SubtitlesOutput
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SubtitlesOutput.SubtitlesOutput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SubtitlesOutput.SubtitlesOutput

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.SubtitlesOutput.SubtitlesOutput


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag

-- | A key:value pair that adds metadata to a resource used by Amazon
--   Transcribe. For example, a tag with the key:value pair
--   Department:Sales might be added to a resource to indicate its use
--   by your organization's sales department.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The first part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a
--   given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the key
--   is 'Department'.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The second part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a
--   given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the
--   value is 'Sales'.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The first part of a key:value
--   pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For example,
--   in the tag Department:Sales, the key is 'Department'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The second part of a
--   key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For
--   example, in the tag Department:Sales, the value is 'Sales'.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The first part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a
--   given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the key
--   is 'Department'.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The second part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a
--   given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the
--   value is 'Sales'.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Transcript

-- | Identifies the location of a transcription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTranscript</a> smart constructor.
data Transcript
Transcript' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Transcript

-- | The S3 object location of the transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the transcript. If you specified an S3 bucket
--   in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the job, this
--   is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the transcript in
--   Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides secure access
--   to that location.
[$sel:transcriptFileUri:Transcript'] :: Transcript -> Maybe Text

-- | The S3 object location of the redacted transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the redacted transcript. If you specified an S3
--   bucket in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the
--   job, this is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the
--   transcript in Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides
--   secure access to that location.
[$sel:redactedTranscriptFileUri:Transcript'] :: Transcript -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Transcript</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptFileUri:Transcript'</a>,
--   <a>transcript_transcriptFileUri</a> - The S3 object location of the
--   transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the transcript. If you specified an S3 bucket
--   in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the job, this
--   is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the transcript in
--   Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides secure access
--   to that location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactedTranscriptFileUri:Transcript'</a>,
--   <a>transcript_redactedTranscriptFileUri</a> - The S3 object location
--   of the redacted transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the redacted transcript. If you specified an S3
--   bucket in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the
--   job, this is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the
--   transcript in Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides
--   secure access to that location.
newTranscript :: Transcript

-- | The S3 object location of the transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the transcript. If you specified an S3 bucket
--   in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the job, this
--   is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the transcript in
--   Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides secure access
--   to that location.
transcript_transcriptFileUri :: Lens' Transcript (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 object location of the redacted transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the redacted transcript. If you specified an S3
--   bucket in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the
--   job, this is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the
--   transcript in Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides
--   secure access to that location.
transcript_redactedTranscriptFileUri :: Lens' Transcript (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Transcript.Transcript
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Transcript.Transcript
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Transcript.Transcript
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Transcript.Transcript
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Transcript.Transcript
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Transcript.Transcript
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Transcript.Transcript
