instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilterType.TranscriptFilterType


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter

-- | Matches the output of the transcription to either the specific phrases
--   that you specify, or the intent of the phrases that you specify.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTranscriptFilter</a> smart constructor.
data TranscriptFilter
TranscriptFilter' :: Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> TranscriptFilterType -> NonEmpty Text -> TranscriptFilter

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where you would like to apply a filter. For example, you can
--   specify the first half of the call. You can also specify the period of
--   time between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the
--   call. Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you
--   can apply relative time ranges across all calls.
[$sel:relativeTimeRange:TranscriptFilter'] :: TranscriptFilter -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange

-- | If <tt>TRUE</tt>, the rule that you specify is applied to everything
--   except for the phrases that you specify.
[$sel:negate:TranscriptFilter'] :: TranscriptFilter -> Maybe Bool

-- | Determines whether the customer or the agent is speaking the phrases
--   that you've specified.
[$sel:participantRole:TranscriptFilter'] :: TranscriptFilter -> Maybe ParticipantRole

-- | A time range, set in seconds, between two points in the call.
[$sel:absoluteTimeRange:TranscriptFilter'] :: TranscriptFilter -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | Matches the phrase to the transcription output in a word for word
--   fashion. For example, if you specify the phrase "I want to speak to
--   the manager." Amazon Transcribe attempts to match that specific phrase
--   to the transcription.
[$sel:transcriptFilterType:TranscriptFilter'] :: TranscriptFilter -> TranscriptFilterType

-- | The phrases that you're specifying for the transcript filter to match.
[$sel:targets:TranscriptFilter'] :: TranscriptFilter -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TranscriptFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:TranscriptFilter'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - An object that allows
--   percentages to specify the proportion of the call where you would like
--   to apply a filter. For example, you can specify the first half of the
--   call. You can also specify the period of time between halfway through
--   to three-quarters of the way through the call. Because the length of
--   conversation can vary between calls, you can apply relative time
--   ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:TranscriptFilter'</a>, <a>transcriptFilter_negate</a> -
--   If <tt>TRUE</tt>, the rule that you specify is applied to everything
--   except for the phrases that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:TranscriptFilter'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptFilter_participantRole</a> - Determines whether the
--   customer or the agent is speaking the phrases that you've specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:TranscriptFilter'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - A time range, set in
--   seconds, between two points in the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptFilterType:TranscriptFilter'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptFilter_transcriptFilterType</a> - Matches the phrase to
--   the transcription output in a word for word fashion. For example, if
--   you specify the phrase "I want to speak to the manager." Amazon
--   Transcribe attempts to match that specific phrase to the
--   transcription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:TranscriptFilter'</a>, <a>transcriptFilter_targets</a>
--   - The phrases that you're specifying for the transcript filter to
--   match.
newTranscriptFilter :: TranscriptFilterType -> NonEmpty Text -> TranscriptFilter

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where you would like to apply a filter. For example, you can
--   specify the first half of the call. You can also specify the period of
--   time between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the
--   call. Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you
--   can apply relative time ranges across all calls.
transcriptFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | If <tt>TRUE</tt>, the rule that you specify is applied to everything
--   except for the phrases that you specify.
transcriptFilter_negate :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | Determines whether the customer or the agent is speaking the phrases
--   that you've specified.
transcriptFilter_participantRole :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | A time range, set in seconds, between two points in the call.
transcriptFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)

-- | Matches the phrase to the transcription output in a word for word
--   fashion. For example, if you specify the phrase "I want to speak to
--   the manager." Amazon Transcribe attempts to match that specific phrase
--   to the transcription.
transcriptFilter_transcriptFilterType :: Lens' TranscriptFilter TranscriptFilterType

-- | The phrases that you're specifying for the transcript filter to match.
transcriptFilter_targets :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (NonEmpty Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter.TranscriptFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter.TranscriptFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter.TranscriptFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter.TranscriptFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter.TranscriptFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter.TranscriptFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter.TranscriptFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptFilter.TranscriptFilter


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule

-- | A condition in the call between the customer and the agent that you
--   want to filter for.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRule</a> smart constructor.
data Rule
Rule' :: Maybe SentimentFilter -> Maybe InterruptionFilter -> Maybe TranscriptFilter -> Maybe NonTalkTimeFilter -> Rule

-- | A condition that is applied to a particular customer sentiment.
[$sel:sentimentFilter:Rule'] :: Rule -> Maybe SentimentFilter

-- | A condition for a time period when either the customer or agent was
--   interrupting the other person.
[$sel:interruptionFilter:Rule'] :: Rule -> Maybe InterruptionFilter

-- | A condition that catches particular words or phrases based on a exact
--   match. For example, if you set the phrase "I want to speak to the
--   manager", only that exact phrase will be returned.
[$sel:transcriptFilter:Rule'] :: Rule -> Maybe TranscriptFilter

-- | A condition for a time period when neither the customer nor the agent
--   was talking.
[$sel:nonTalkTimeFilter:Rule'] :: Rule -> Maybe NonTalkTimeFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>Rule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentimentFilter:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_sentimentFilter</a> - A
--   condition that is applied to a particular customer sentiment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:interruptionFilter:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_interruptionFilter</a> -
--   A condition for a time period when either the customer or agent was
--   interrupting the other person.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptFilter:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_transcriptFilter</a> - A
--   condition that catches particular words or phrases based on a exact
--   match. For example, if you set the phrase "I want to speak to the
--   manager", only that exact phrase will be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonTalkTimeFilter:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_nonTalkTimeFilter</a> - A
--   condition for a time period when neither the customer nor the agent
--   was talking.
newRule :: Rule

-- | A condition that is applied to a particular customer sentiment.
rule_sentimentFilter :: Lens' Rule (Maybe SentimentFilter)

-- | A condition for a time period when either the customer or agent was
--   interrupting the other person.
rule_interruptionFilter :: Lens' Rule (Maybe InterruptionFilter)

-- | A condition that catches particular words or phrases based on a exact
--   match. For example, if you set the phrase "I want to speak to the
--   manager", only that exact phrase will be returned.
rule_transcriptFilter :: Lens' Rule (Maybe TranscriptFilter)

-- | A condition for a time period when neither the customer nor the agent
--   was talking.
rule_nonTalkTimeFilter :: Lens' Rule (Maybe NonTalkTimeFilter)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule.Rule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule.Rule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule.Rule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule.Rule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule.Rule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule.Rule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule.Rule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Rule.Rule


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CategoryProperties

-- | An object that contains the rules and additional information about a
--   call analytics category.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCategoryProperties</a> smart constructor.
data CategoryProperties
CategoryProperties' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (NonEmpty Rule) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> CategoryProperties

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics category was most
--   recently updated.
[$sel:lastUpdateTime:CategoryProperties'] :: CategoryProperties -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The rules used to create a call analytics category.
[$sel:rules:CategoryProperties'] :: CategoryProperties -> Maybe (NonEmpty Rule)

-- | The name of the call analytics category.
[$sel:categoryName:CategoryProperties'] :: CategoryProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics category was created.
[$sel:createTime:CategoryProperties'] :: CategoryProperties -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CategoryProperties</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateTime:CategoryProperties'</a>,
--   <a>categoryProperties_lastUpdateTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the call analytics category was most recently updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:CategoryProperties'</a>, <a>categoryProperties_rules</a>
--   - The rules used to create a call analytics category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:categoryName:CategoryProperties'</a>,
--   <a>categoryProperties_categoryName</a> - The name of the call
--   analytics category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTime:CategoryProperties'</a>,
--   <a>categoryProperties_createTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   call analytics category was created.
newCategoryProperties :: CategoryProperties

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics category was most
--   recently updated.
categoryProperties_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The rules used to create a call analytics category.
categoryProperties_rules :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe (NonEmpty Rule))

-- | The name of the call analytics category.
categoryProperties_categoryName :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics category was created.
categoryProperties_createTime :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CategoryProperties.CategoryProperties
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CategoryProperties.CategoryProperties
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CategoryProperties.CategoryProperties
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CategoryProperties.CategoryProperties
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CategoryProperties.CategoryProperties
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CategoryProperties.CategoryProperties
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CategoryProperties.CategoryProperties

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJobSummary

-- | Provides a summary of information about a transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTranscriptionJobSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TranscriptionJobSummary
TranscriptionJobSummary' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe OutputLocationType -> Maybe ModelSettings -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> TranscriptionJobSummary

-- | The language code for the input speech.
[$sel:languageCode:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The content redaction settings of the transcription job.
[$sel:contentRedaction:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe ContentRedaction

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
[$sel:completionTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Whether automatic language identification was enabled for a
--   transcription job.
[$sel:identifyLanguage:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the transcription job.
[$sel:transcriptionJobName:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the transcription job. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt>, use the <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> operation to
--   get the results of the transcription.
[$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
[$sel:startTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Indicates the location of the output of the transcription job.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>CUSTOMER_BUCKET</tt> then the location is the S3
--   bucket specified in the <tt>outputBucketName</tt> field when the
--   transcription job was started with the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>SERVICE_BUCKET</tt> then the output is stored by
--   Amazon Transcribe and can be retrieved using the URI in the
--   <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> response's <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field.
[$sel:outputLocationType:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe OutputLocationType
[$sel:modelSettings:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe ModelSettings

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language it identified in the source audio. A higher score indicates
--   that Amazon Transcribe is more confident in the language it
--   identified.
[$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Double

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
[$sel:failureReason:TranscriptionJobSummary'] :: TranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TranscriptionJobSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_languageCode</a> - The language code for
--   the input speech.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_contentRedaction</a> - The content
--   redaction settings of the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifyLanguage:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_identifyLanguage</a> - Whether automatic
--   language identification was enabled for a transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobName:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobName</a> - The name of the
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobStatus</a> - The status of
--   the transcription job. When the status is <tt>COMPLETED</tt>, use the
--   <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> operation to get the results of the
--   transcription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocationType:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType</a> - Indicates the
--   location of the output of the transcription job.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>CUSTOMER_BUCKET</tt> then the location is the S3
--   bucket specified in the <tt>outputBucketName</tt> field when the
--   transcription job was started with the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>SERVICE_BUCKET</tt> then the output is stored by
--   Amazon Transcribe and can be retrieved using the URI in the
--   <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> response's <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelSettings:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_modelSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_identifiedLanguageScore</a> - A value
--   between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the language
--   it identified in the source audio. A higher score indicates that
--   Amazon Transcribe is more confident in the language it identified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
newTranscriptionJobSummary :: TranscriptionJobSummary

-- | The language code for the input speech.
transcriptionJobSummary_languageCode :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The content redaction settings of the transcription job.
transcriptionJobSummary_contentRedaction :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
transcriptionJobSummary_creationTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
transcriptionJobSummary_completionTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Whether automatic language identification was enabled for a
--   transcription job.
transcriptionJobSummary_identifyLanguage :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the transcription job.
transcriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobName :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the transcription job. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt>, use the <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> operation to
--   get the results of the transcription.
transcriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
transcriptionJobSummary_startTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates the location of the output of the transcription job.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>CUSTOMER_BUCKET</tt> then the location is the S3
--   bucket specified in the <tt>outputBucketName</tt> field when the
--   transcription job was started with the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>SERVICE_BUCKET</tt> then the output is stored by
--   Amazon Transcribe and can be retrieved using the URI in the
--   <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> response's <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field.
transcriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe OutputLocationType)

-- | Undocumented member.
transcriptionJobSummary_modelSettings :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe ModelSettings)

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language it identified in the source audio. A higher score indicates
--   that Amazon Transcribe is more confident in the language it
--   identified.
transcriptionJobSummary_identifiedLanguageScore :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Double)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
transcriptionJobSummary_failureReason :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJobSummary.TranscriptionJobSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJobSummary.TranscriptionJobSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJobSummary.TranscriptionJobSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJobSummary.TranscriptionJobSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJobSummary.TranscriptionJobSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJobSummary.TranscriptionJobSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJobSummary.TranscriptionJobSummary


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type
newtype Type
Type' :: Text -> Type
[fromType] :: Type -> Text
pattern Type_CONVERSATION :: Type
pattern Type_DICTATION :: Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type

instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Type.Type


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary

-- | Provides summary information about a transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscriptionJobSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary
MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe OutputLocationType -> Maybe Specialty -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Type -> Maybe Text -> MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary

-- | The language of the transcript in the source audio file.
[$sel:languageCode:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | A timestamp that shows when the medical transcription job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
[$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Shows the type of information you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the transcription job to identify
--   personal health information (PHI).
[$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType

-- | The status of the medical transcription job.
[$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job began processing.
[$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Indicates the location of the transcription job's output. This field
--   must be the path of an S3 bucket; if you don't already have an S3
--   bucket, one is created based on the path you add.
[$sel:outputLocationType:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe OutputLocationType

-- | The medical specialty of the transcription job. Refer to
--   <a>Transcribing a medical conversation</a>for a list of supported
--   specialties.
[$sel:specialty:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Specialty

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
[$sel:failureReason:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The speech of the clinician in the input audio.
[$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Type

-- | The name of a medical transcription job.
[$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_languageCode</a> - The language of
--   the transcript in the source audio file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that
--   shows when the medical transcription job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_completionTime</a> - A timestamp
--   that shows when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_contentIdentificationType</a> -
--   Shows the type of information you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the transcription job to identify
--   personal health information (PHI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobStatus</a> - The
--   status of the medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_startTime</a> - A timestamp that
--   shows when the job began processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocationType:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType</a> - Indicates
--   the location of the transcription job's output. This field must be the
--   path of an S3 bucket; if you don't already have an S3 bucket, one is
--   created based on the path you add.
--   
--   <a>$sel:specialty:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_specialty</a> - The medical
--   specialty of the transcription job. Refer to <a>Transcribing a medical
--   conversation</a>for a list of supported specialties.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_type</a> - The speech of the
--   clinician in the input audio.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_medicalTranscriptionJobName</a> -
--   The name of a medical transcription job.
newMedicalTranscriptionJobSummary :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary

-- | The language of the transcript in the source audio file.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_languageCode :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the medical transcription job was created.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_creationTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_completionTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Shows the type of information you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the transcription job to identify
--   personal health information (PHI).
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_contentIdentificationType :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType)

-- | The status of the medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job began processing.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_startTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates the location of the transcription job's output. This field
--   must be the path of an S3 bucket; if you don't already have an S3
--   bucket, one is created based on the path you add.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe OutputLocationType)

-- | The medical specialty of the transcription job. Refer to
--   <a>Transcribing a medical conversation</a>for a list of supported
--   specialties.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_specialty :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Specialty)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_failureReason :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The speech of the clinician in the input audio.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_type :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Type)

-- | The name of a medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_medicalTranscriptionJobName :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary.MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | The data structure that contains the information for a medical
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.
data MedicalTranscriptionJob
MedicalTranscriptionJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Media -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe MedicalTranscript -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Specialty -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Type -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> MedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | The language code for the language spoken in the source audio file. US
--   English (en-US) is the only supported language for medical
--   transcriptions. Any other value you enter for language code results in
--   a <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
[$sel:languageCode:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The format of the input media file.
[$sel:mediaFormat:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MediaFormat

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX
[$sel:media:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Media

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
[$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that contains the <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>. The
--   <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt> contains the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>.
[$sel:transcript:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MedicalTranscript

-- | Shows the type of content that you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the job to identify personal health
--   information (PHI) in the transcription output.
[$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType

-- | The completion status of a medical transcription job.
[$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
[$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The medical specialty of any clinicians providing a dictation or
--   having a conversation. Refer to <a>Transcribing a medical
--   conversation</a>for a list of supported specialties.
[$sel:specialty:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Specialty

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this
--   field contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field contains one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>- The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>- The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>- The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>- The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>- The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <a>Guidelines and Quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Transcribe Medical Guide</i></li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>-
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services General Reference</i></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:failureReason:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A key:value pair assigned to a given medical transcription job.
[$sel:tags:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the source audio containing medical
--   information.
--   
--   If you don't specify the sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines it for you. If you choose to specify the sample rate, it
--   must match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most
--   cases, you should leave the <tt>MedicalMediaSampleHertz</tt> blank and
--   let Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
[$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Natural

-- | The type of speech in the transcription job. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> is
--   generally used for patient-physician dialogues. <tt>DICTATION</tt> is
--   the setting for physicians speaking their notes after seeing a
--   patient. For more information, see <a>What is Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical?</a>.
[$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Type

-- | The name for a given medical transcription job.
[$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Object that contains object.
[$sel:settings:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code for
--   the language spoken in the source audio file. US English (en-US) is
--   the only supported language for medical transcriptions. Any other
--   value you enter for language code results in a
--   <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input
--   media file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_media</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcript:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_transcript</a> - An object that contains
--   the <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>. The <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>
--   contains the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_contentIdentificationType</a> - Shows the
--   type of content that you've configured Amazon Transcribe Medical to
--   identify in a transcription job. If the value is <tt>PHI</tt>, you've
--   configured the job to identify personal health information (PHI) in
--   the transcription output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus</a> - The completion
--   status of a medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:specialty:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_specialty</a> - The medical specialty of
--   any clinicians providing a dictation or having a conversation. Refer
--   to <a>Transcribing a medical conversation</a>for a list of supported
--   specialties.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field contains one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>- The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>- The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>- The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>- The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>- The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <a>Guidelines and Quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Transcribe Medical Guide</i></li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>-
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services General Reference</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_tags</a> - A key:value pair assigned to a
--   given medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate,
--   in Hertz, of the source audio containing medical information.
--   
--   If you don't specify the sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines it for you. If you choose to specify the sample rate, it
--   must match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most
--   cases, you should leave the <tt>MedicalMediaSampleHertz</tt> blank and
--   let Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_type</a> - The type of speech in the
--   transcription job. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> is generally used for
--   patient-physician dialogues. <tt>DICTATION</tt> is the setting for
--   physicians speaking their notes after seeing a patient. For more
--   information, see <a>What is Amazon Transcribe Medical?</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName</a> - The name
--   for a given medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_settings</a> - Object that contains object.
newMedicalTranscriptionJob :: MedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | The language code for the language spoken in the source audio file. US
--   English (en-US) is the only supported language for medical
--   transcriptions. Any other value you enter for language code results in
--   a <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
medicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The format of the input media file.
medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
medicalTranscriptionJob_creationTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
medicalTranscriptionJob_media :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Media)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
medicalTranscriptionJob_completionTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that contains the <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>. The
--   <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt> contains the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>.
medicalTranscriptionJob_transcript :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalTranscript)

-- | Shows the type of content that you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the job to identify personal health
--   information (PHI) in the transcription output.
medicalTranscriptionJob_contentIdentificationType :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType)

-- | The completion status of a medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
medicalTranscriptionJob_startTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The medical specialty of any clinicians providing a dictation or
--   having a conversation. Refer to <a>Transcribing a medical
--   conversation</a>for a list of supported specialties.
medicalTranscriptionJob_specialty :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Specialty)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this
--   field contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field contains one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>- The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>- The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>- The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>- The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>- The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <a>Guidelines and Quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Transcribe Medical Guide</i></li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>-
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services General Reference</i></li>
--   </ul>
medicalTranscriptionJob_failureReason :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A key:value pair assigned to a given medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_tags :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the source audio containing medical
--   information.
--   
--   If you don't specify the sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines it for you. If you choose to specify the sample rate, it
--   must match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most
--   cases, you should leave the <tt>MedicalMediaSampleHertz</tt> blank and
--   let Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | The type of speech in the transcription job. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> is
--   generally used for patient-physician dialogues. <tt>DICTATION</tt> is
--   the setting for physicians speaking their notes after seeing a
--   patient. For more information, see <a>What is Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical?</a>.
medicalTranscriptionJob_type :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Type)

-- | The name for a given medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Object that contains object.
medicalTranscriptionJob_settings :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJob.MedicalTranscriptionJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJob.MedicalTranscriptionJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJob.MedicalTranscriptionJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJob.MedicalTranscriptionJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJob.MedicalTranscriptionJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJob.MedicalTranscriptionJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.MedicalTranscriptionJob.MedicalTranscriptionJob


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterInfo

-- | Provides information about a vocabulary filter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVocabularyFilterInfo</a> smart constructor.
data VocabularyFilterInfo
VocabularyFilterInfo' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> VocabularyFilterInfo

-- | The language code of the words in the vocabulary filter.
[$sel:languageCode:VocabularyFilterInfo'] :: VocabularyFilterInfo -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter. The name must be unique in the
--   account that holds the filter.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterName:VocabularyFilterInfo'] :: VocabularyFilterInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was last updated.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:VocabularyFilterInfo'] :: VocabularyFilterInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>VocabularyFilterInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VocabularyFilterInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyFilterInfo_languageCode</a> - The language code of the
--   words in the vocabulary filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:VocabularyFilterInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyFilterInfo_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary filter. The name must be unique in the account that holds
--   the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:VocabularyFilterInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyFilterInfo_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time that
--   the vocabulary was last updated.
newVocabularyFilterInfo :: VocabularyFilterInfo

-- | The language code of the words in the vocabulary filter.
vocabularyFilterInfo_languageCode :: Lens' VocabularyFilterInfo (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter. The name must be unique in the
--   account that holds the filter.
vocabularyFilterInfo_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' VocabularyFilterInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was last updated.
vocabularyFilterInfo_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' VocabularyFilterInfo (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterInfo.VocabularyFilterInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterInfo.VocabularyFilterInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterInfo.VocabularyFilterInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterInfo.VocabularyFilterInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterInfo.VocabularyFilterInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterInfo.VocabularyFilterInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterInfo.VocabularyFilterInfo


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterMethod
newtype VocabularyFilterMethod
VocabularyFilterMethod' :: Text -> VocabularyFilterMethod
[fromVocabularyFilterMethod] :: VocabularyFilterMethod -> Text
pattern VocabularyFilterMethod_Mask :: VocabularyFilterMethod
pattern VocabularyFilterMethod_Remove :: VocabularyFilterMethod
pattern VocabularyFilterMethod_Tag :: VocabularyFilterMethod
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterMethod.VocabularyFilterMethod
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterMethod.VocabularyFilterMethod

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyFilterMethod.VocabularyFilterMethod
