module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings

-- | Provides optional settings for the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Settings
Settings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Settings

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to use when transcribing the audio.
--   The filter that you specify must have the same language code as the
--   transcription job.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterName:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>mask</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript and
--   replace it with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to
--   <tt>remove</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript without
--   using placeholder text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the
--   transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set
--   the filter method to <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary
--   filter are not masked or removed.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterMethod:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod

-- | Determines whether the transcription contains alternative
--   transcriptions. If you set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to
--   true, you must also set the maximum number of alternatives to return
--   in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field.
[$sel:showAlternatives:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Instructs Amazon Transcribe to process each audio channel separately
--   and then merge the transcription output of each channel into a single
--   transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe also produces a transcription of each item detected
--   on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of the item
--   and alternative transcriptions of the item including the confidence
--   that Amazon Transcribe has in the transcription.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
[$sel:channelIdentification:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of alternative transcriptions that the service should
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
[$sel:maxAlternatives:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Determines whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to
--   identify different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition
--   labels individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
[$sel:showSpeakerLabels:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the transcription job.
[$sel:vocabularyName:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If
--   there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple
--   speakers are identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
[$sel:maxSpeakerLabels:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Settings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The name of the vocabulary
--   filter to use when transcribing the audio. The filter that you specify
--   must have the same language code as the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterMethod:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_vocabularyFilterMethod</a> - Set to <tt>mask</tt> to
--   remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it with three
--   asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to <tt>remove</tt> to
--   remove filtered text from the transcript without using placeholder
--   text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the transcription output
--   that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set the filter method to
--   <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary filter are not masked
--   or removed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:showAlternatives:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_showAlternatives</a> - Determines whether the
--   transcription contains alternative transcriptions. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelIdentification:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_channelIdentification</a> - Instructs Amazon Transcribe to
--   process each audio channel separately and then merge the transcription
--   output of each channel into a single transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe also produces a transcription of each item detected
--   on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of the item
--   and alternative transcriptions of the item including the confidence
--   that Amazon Transcribe has in the transcription.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxAlternatives:Settings'</a>, <a>settings_maxAlternatives</a>
--   - The number of alternative transcriptions that the service should
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:showSpeakerLabels:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_showSpeakerLabels</a> - Determines whether the
--   transcription job uses speaker recognition to identify different
--   speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition labels individual
--   speakers in the audio file. If you set the <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt>
--   field to true, you must also set the maximum number of speaker labels
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:Settings'</a>, <a>settings_vocabularyName</a> -
--   The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSpeakerLabels:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_maxSpeakerLabels</a> - The maximum number of speakers to
--   identify in the input audio. If there are more speakers in the audio
--   than this number, multiple speakers are identified as a single
--   speaker. If you specify the <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
newSettings :: Settings

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to use when transcribing the audio.
--   The filter that you specify must have the same language code as the
--   transcription job.
settings_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <tt>mask</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript and
--   replace it with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to
--   <tt>remove</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript without
--   using placeholder text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the
--   transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set
--   the filter method to <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary
--   filter are not masked or removed.
settings_vocabularyFilterMethod :: Lens' Settings (Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod)

-- | Determines whether the transcription contains alternative
--   transcriptions. If you set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to
--   true, you must also set the maximum number of alternatives to return
--   in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field.
settings_showAlternatives :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Instructs Amazon Transcribe to process each audio channel separately
--   and then merge the transcription output of each channel into a single
--   transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe also produces a transcription of each item detected
--   on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of the item
--   and alternative transcriptions of the item including the confidence
--   that Amazon Transcribe has in the transcription.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
settings_channelIdentification :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of alternative transcriptions that the service should
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
settings_maxAlternatives :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Determines whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to
--   identify different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition
--   labels individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
settings_showSpeakerLabels :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the transcription job.
settings_vocabularyName :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If
--   there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple
--   speakers are identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
settings_maxSpeakerLabels :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings.Settings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings.Settings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings.Settings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings.Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings.Settings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings.Settings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings.Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.Settings.Settings


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJob

-- | Describes an asynchronous transcription job that was created with the
--   <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.
data TranscriptionJob
TranscriptionJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Media -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Transcript -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ModelSettings -> Maybe Double -> Maybe SubtitlesOutput -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe JobExecutionSettings -> Maybe Settings -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode) -> TranscriptionJob

-- | The language code for the input speech.
[$sel:languageCode:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The format of the input media file.
[$sel:mediaFormat:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe MediaFormat

-- | An object that describes content redaction settings for the
--   transcription job.
[$sel:contentRedaction:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe ContentRedaction

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that describes the input media for the transcription job.
[$sel:media:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe Media

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job completed.
[$sel:completionTime:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that describes the output of the transcription job.
[$sel:transcript:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe Transcript

-- | A value that shows if automatic language identification was enabled
--   for a transcription job.
[$sel:identifyLanguage:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the transcription job.
[$sel:transcriptionJobName:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the transcription job.
[$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
[$sel:startTime:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object containing the details of your custom language model.
[$sel:modelSettings:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe ModelSettings

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language that it identified in the source audio. Larger values
--   indicate that Amazon Transcribe has higher confidence in the language
--   it identified.
[$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe Double

-- | Generate subtitles for your batch transcription job.
[$sel:subtitles:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe SubtitlesOutput

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this
--   field contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt> - The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><pre>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</pre></li>
--   <li>The media format of the audio file doesn't match the format
--   specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request. Check the
--   media format of your media file and make sure that the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt> - The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt> - The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt> - The size of your
--   audio file is larger than Amazon Transcribe can process. For more
--   information, see <a>Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Transcribe Developer
--   Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>
--   - Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:failureReason:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A key:value pair assigned to a given transcription job.
[$sel:tags:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
[$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe Natural

-- | Provides information about how a transcription job is executed.
[$sel:jobExecutionSettings:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe JobExecutionSettings

-- | Optional settings for the transcription job. Use these settings to
--   turn on speaker recognition, to set the maximum number of speakers
--   that should be identified and to specify a custom vocabulary to use
--   when processing the transcription job.
[$sel:settings:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe Settings

-- | An object that shows the optional array of languages inputted for
--   transcription jobs with automatic language identification enabled.
[$sel:languageOptions:TranscriptionJob'] :: TranscriptionJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode)

-- | Create a value of <a>TranscriptionJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code for the input
--   speech.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input media
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_contentRedaction</a> - An object that describes
--   content redaction settings for the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:TranscriptionJob'</a>, <a>transcriptionJob_media</a> -
--   An object that describes the input media for the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the job completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcript:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_transcript</a> - An object that describes the
--   output of the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifyLanguage:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_identifyLanguage</a> - A value that shows if
--   automatic language identification was enabled for a transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobName:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_transcriptionJobName</a> - The name of the
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus</a> - The status of the
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelSettings:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_modelSettings</a> - An object containing the
--   details of your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_identifiedLanguageScore</a> - A value between zero
--   and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the language that it
--   identified in the source audio. Larger values indicate that Amazon
--   Transcribe has higher confidence in the language it identified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subtitles:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_subtitles</a> - Generate subtitles for your batch
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt> - The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><pre>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</pre></li>
--   <li>The media format of the audio file doesn't match the format
--   specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request. Check the
--   media format of your media file and make sure that the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt> - The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt> - The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt> - The size of your
--   audio file is larger than Amazon Transcribe can process. For more
--   information, see <a>Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Transcribe Developer
--   Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>
--   - Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TranscriptionJob'</a>, <a>transcriptionJob_tags</a> - A
--   key:value pair assigned to a given transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate, in
--   Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionSettings:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_jobExecutionSettings</a> - Provides information
--   about how a transcription job is executed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_settings</a> - Optional settings for the
--   transcription job. Use these settings to turn on speaker recognition,
--   to set the maximum number of speakers that should be identified and to
--   specify a custom vocabulary to use when processing the transcription
--   job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageOptions:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_languageOptions</a> - An object that shows the
--   optional array of languages inputted for transcription jobs with
--   automatic language identification enabled.
newTranscriptionJob :: TranscriptionJob

-- | The language code for the input speech.
transcriptionJob_languageCode :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The format of the input media file.
transcriptionJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | An object that describes content redaction settings for the
--   transcription job.
transcriptionJob_contentRedaction :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
transcriptionJob_creationTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the input media for the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_media :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Media)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job completed.
transcriptionJob_completionTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the output of the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_transcript :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Transcript)

-- | A value that shows if automatic language identification was enabled
--   for a transcription job.
transcriptionJob_identifyLanguage :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_transcriptionJobName :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
transcriptionJob_startTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object containing the details of your custom language model.
transcriptionJob_modelSettings :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe ModelSettings)

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language that it identified in the source audio. Larger values
--   indicate that Amazon Transcribe has higher confidence in the language
--   it identified.
transcriptionJob_identifiedLanguageScore :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Double)

-- | Generate subtitles for your batch transcription job.
transcriptionJob_subtitles :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe SubtitlesOutput)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this
--   field contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt> - The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><pre>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</pre></li>
--   <li>The media format of the audio file doesn't match the format
--   specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request. Check the
--   media format of your media file and make sure that the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt> - The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt> - The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt> - The size of your
--   audio file is larger than Amazon Transcribe can process. For more
--   information, see <a>Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Transcribe Developer
--   Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>
--   - Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
transcriptionJob_failureReason :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A key:value pair assigned to a given transcription job.
transcriptionJob_tags :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
transcriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | Provides information about how a transcription job is executed.
transcriptionJob_jobExecutionSettings :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe JobExecutionSettings)

-- | Optional settings for the transcription job. Use these settings to
--   turn on speaker recognition, to set the maximum number of speakers
--   that should be identified and to specify a custom vocabulary to use
--   when processing the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_settings :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Settings)

-- | An object that shows the optional array of languages inputted for
--   transcription jobs with automatic language identification enabled.
transcriptionJob_languageOptions :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJob.TranscriptionJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJob.TranscriptionJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJob.TranscriptionJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJob.TranscriptionJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJob.TranscriptionJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJob.TranscriptionJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.TranscriptionJob.TranscriptionJob


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJobSettings

-- | Provides optional settings for the <tt>CallAnalyticsJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallAnalyticsJobSettings</a> smart constructor.
data CallAnalyticsJobSettings
CallAnalyticsJobSettings' :: Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode) -> CallAnalyticsJobSettings
[$sel:contentRedaction:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe ContentRedaction

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to use when running a call analytics
--   job. The filter that you specify must have the same language code as
--   the analytics job.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to mask to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it
--   with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to
--   <tt>remove</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript without
--   using placeholder text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the
--   transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set
--   the filter method to <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary
--   filter are not masked or removed.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterMethod:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod

-- | The structure used to describe a custom language model.
[$sel:languageModelName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the call analytics
--   job.
[$sel:vocabularyName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When you run a call analytics job, you can specify the language spoken
--   in the audio, or you can have Amazon Transcribe identify the language
--   for you.
--   
--   To specify a language, specify an array with one language code. If you
--   don't know the language, you can leave this field blank and Amazon
--   Transcribe will use machine learning to identify the language for you.
--   To improve the ability of Amazon Transcribe to correctly identify the
--   language, you can provide an array of the languages that can be
--   present in the audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
[$sel:languageOptions:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode)

-- | Create a value of <a>CallAnalyticsJobSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_contentRedaction</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary filter to use when running a call analytics job. The filter
--   that you specify must have the same language code as the analytics
--   job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterMethod:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterMethod</a> - Set to mask
--   to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it with three
--   asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to <tt>remove</tt> to
--   remove filtered text from the transcript without using placeholder
--   text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the transcription output
--   that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set the filter method to
--   <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary filter are not masked
--   or removed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageModelName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageModelName</a> - The structure used
--   to describe a custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyName</a> - The name of a
--   vocabulary to use when processing the call analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageOptions:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageOptions</a> - When you run a call
--   analytics job, you can specify the language spoken in the audio, or
--   you can have Amazon Transcribe identify the language for you.
--   
--   To specify a language, specify an array with one language code. If you
--   don't know the language, you can leave this field blank and Amazon
--   Transcribe will use machine learning to identify the language for you.
--   To improve the ability of Amazon Transcribe to correctly identify the
--   language, you can provide an array of the languages that can be
--   present in the audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
newCallAnalyticsJobSettings :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings

-- | Undocumented member.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_contentRedaction :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to use when running a call analytics
--   job. The filter that you specify must have the same language code as
--   the analytics job.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to mask to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it
--   with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to
--   <tt>remove</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript without
--   using placeholder text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the
--   transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set
--   the filter method to <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary
--   filter are not masked or removed.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterMethod :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod)

-- | The structure used to describe a custom language model.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageModelName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the call analytics
--   job.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

--   in the audio, or you can have Amazon Transcribe identify the language
--   for you.
--   
--   To specify a language, specify an array with one language code. If you
--   don't know the language, you can leave this field blank and Amazon
--   Transcribe will use machine learning to identify the language for you.
--   To improve the ability of Amazon Transcribe to correctly identify the
--   language, you can provide an array of the languages that can be
--   present in the audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageOptions :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode))

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJob

-- | Describes an asynchronous analytics job that was created with the
--   <tt>StartAnalyticsJob</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallAnalyticsJob</a> smart constructor.
data CallAnalyticsJob
CallAnalyticsJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Media -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Transcript -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition) -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> CallAnalyticsJob

-- | If you know the language spoken between the customer and the agent,
--   specify a language code for this field.
--   
--   If you don't know the language, you can leave this field blank, and
--   Amazon Transcribe will use machine learning to automatically identify
--   the language. To improve the accuracy of language identification, you
--   can provide an array containing the possible language codes for the
--   language spoken in your audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
[$sel:languageCode:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The format of the input audio file. Note: for call analytics jobs,
--   only the following media formats are supported: MP3, MP4, WAV, FLAC,
--   OGG, and WebM.
[$sel:mediaFormat:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe MediaFormat

-- | The status of the analytics job.
[$sel:callAnalyticsJobStatus:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe POSIX
[$sel:media:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Media

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job was completed.
[$sel:completionTime:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe POSIX
[$sel:transcript:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Transcript

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job started processing.
[$sel:startTime:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Shows numeric values to indicate the channel assigned to the agent's
--   audio and the channel assigned to the customer's audio.
[$sel:channelDefinitions:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition)

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language that it identified in the source audio. This value appears
--   only when you don't provide a single language code. Larger values
--   indicate that Amazon Transcribe has higher confidence in the language
--   that it identified
[$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Double

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
[$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Text

-- | If the <tt>AnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>: The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>: The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>: The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>: The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>: The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <i>Guidelines and Quotas</i> in the Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>:
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas in the <a>Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:failureReason:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio.
[$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) that you use to get access to the
--   analytics job.
[$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides information about the settings used to run a transcription
--   job.
[$sel:settings:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>CallAnalyticsJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_languageCode</a> - If you know the language spoken
--   between the customer and the agent, specify a language code for this
--   field.
--   
--   If you don't know the language, you can leave this field blank, and
--   Amazon Transcribe will use machine learning to automatically identify
--   the language. To improve the accuracy of language identification, you
--   can provide an array containing the possible language codes for the
--   language spoken in your audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input audio
--   file. Note: for call analytics jobs, only the following media formats
--   are supported: MP3, MP4, WAV, FLAC, OGG, and WebM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobStatus:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobStatus</a> - The status of the
--   analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   analytics job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>, <a>callAnalyticsJob_media</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the analytics job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcript:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_transcript</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   analytics job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelDefinitions:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_channelDefinitions</a> - Shows numeric values to
--   indicate the channel assigned to the agent's audio and the channel
--   assigned to the customer's audio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_identifiedLanguageScore</a> - A value between zero
--   and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the language that it
--   identified in the source audio. This value appears only when you don't
--   provide a single language code. Larger values indicate that Amazon
--   Transcribe has higher confidence in the language that it identified
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobName</a> - The name of the call
--   analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>AnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field contains
--   information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>: The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>: The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>: The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>: The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>: The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <i>Guidelines and Quotas</i> in the Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>:
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas in the <a>Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate, in
--   Hertz, of the audio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) that you use to get access to the analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_settings</a> - Provides information about the
--   settings used to run a transcription job.
newCallAnalyticsJob :: CallAnalyticsJob

-- | If you know the language spoken between the customer and the agent,
--   specify a language code for this field.
--   
--   If you don't know the language, you can leave this field blank, and
--   Amazon Transcribe will use machine learning to automatically identify
--   the language. To improve the accuracy of language identification, you
--   can provide an array containing the possible language codes for the
--   language spoken in your audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
callAnalyticsJob_languageCode :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The format of the input audio file. Note: for call analytics jobs,
--   only the following media formats are supported: MP3, MP4, WAV, FLAC,
--   OGG, and WebM.
callAnalyticsJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | The status of the analytics job.
callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobStatus :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job was created.
callAnalyticsJob_creationTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
callAnalyticsJob_media :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Media)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job was completed.
callAnalyticsJob_completionTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
callAnalyticsJob_transcript :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Transcript)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job started processing.
callAnalyticsJob_startTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Shows numeric values to indicate the channel assigned to the agent's
--   audio and the channel assigned to the customer's audio.
callAnalyticsJob_channelDefinitions :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition))

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language that it identified in the source audio. This value appears
--   only when you don't provide a single language code. Larger values
--   indicate that Amazon Transcribe has higher confidence in the language
--   that it identified
callAnalyticsJob_identifiedLanguageScore :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Double)

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | If the <tt>AnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>: The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>: The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>: The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>: The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>: The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <i>Guidelines and Quotas</i> in the Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>:
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas in the <a>Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
callAnalyticsJob_failureReason :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio.
callAnalyticsJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) that you use to get access to the
--   analytics job.
callAnalyticsJob_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the settings used to run a transcription
--   job.
callAnalyticsJob_settings :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJob.CallAnalyticsJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJob.CallAnalyticsJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJob.CallAnalyticsJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJob.CallAnalyticsJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJob.CallAnalyticsJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJob.CallAnalyticsJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.CallAnalyticsJob.CallAnalyticsJob

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyInfo

-- | Provides information about a custom vocabulary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVocabularyInfo</a> smart constructor.
data VocabularyInfo
VocabularyInfo' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyState -> VocabularyInfo

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries.
[$sel:languageCode:VocabularyInfo'] :: VocabularyInfo -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:VocabularyInfo'] :: VocabularyInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the vocabulary.
[$sel:vocabularyName:VocabularyInfo'] :: VocabularyInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The processing state of the vocabulary. If the state is <tt>READY</tt>
--   you can use the vocabulary in a <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   request.
[$sel:vocabularyState:VocabularyInfo'] :: VocabularyInfo -> Maybe VocabularyState

-- | Create a value of <a>VocabularyInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VocabularyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyInfo_languageCode</a> - The language code of the
--   vocabulary entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:VocabularyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyInfo_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time that the
--   vocabulary was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:VocabularyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyInfo_vocabularyName</a> - The name of the vocabulary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyState:VocabularyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyInfo_vocabularyState</a> - The processing state of the
--   vocabulary. If the state is <tt>READY</tt> you can use the vocabulary
--   in a <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> request.
newVocabularyInfo :: VocabularyInfo

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries.
vocabularyInfo_languageCode :: Lens' VocabularyInfo (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was last modified.
vocabularyInfo_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' VocabularyInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the vocabulary.
vocabularyInfo_vocabularyName :: Lens' VocabularyInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The processing state of the vocabulary. If the state is <tt>READY</tt>
--   you can use the vocabulary in a <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   request.
vocabularyInfo_vocabularyState :: Lens' VocabularyInfo (Maybe VocabularyState)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyInfo.VocabularyInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyInfo.VocabularyInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyInfo.VocabularyInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types.VocabularyInfo.VocabularyInfo

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Types

-- | API version <tt>2017-10-26</tt> of the Amazon Transcribe Service SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | We can't find the requested resource. Check the name and try your
--   request again.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your request didn't pass one or more validation tests. For example, if
--   the entity that you're trying to delete doesn't exist or if it is in a
--   non-terminal state (for example, it's "in progress"). See the
--   exception <tt>Message</tt> field for more information.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There is already a resource with that name.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Either you have sent too many requests or your input file is too long.
--   Wait before you resend your request, or use a smaller file and resend
--   the request.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There was an internal error. Check the error message and try your
--   request again.
_InternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
