-- | A time range, set in seconds, between two points in the call.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbsoluteTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data AbsoluteTimeRange
AbsoluteTimeRange' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | A value that indicates the beginning of the time range in seconds. To
--   set absolute time range, you must specify a start time and an end
--   time. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
[$sel:startTime:AbsoluteTimeRange'] :: AbsoluteTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A value that indicates the end of the time range in milliseconds. To
--   set absolute time range, you must specify a start time and an end
--   time. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
[$sel:endTime:AbsoluteTimeRange'] :: AbsoluteTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A time range from the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set to the
--   last 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
[$sel:last:AbsoluteTimeRange'] :: AbsoluteTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | A time range from the beginning of the call to the value that you've
--   specified. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set
--   to the first 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
[$sel:first:AbsoluteTimeRange'] :: AbsoluteTimeRange -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AbsoluteTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:AbsoluteTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>absoluteTimeRange_startTime</a> - A value that indicates the
--   beginning of the time range in seconds. To set absolute time range,
--   you must specify a start time and an end time. For example, if you
--   specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:AbsoluteTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>absoluteTimeRange_endTime</a> - A value that indicates the end of
--   the time range in milliseconds. To set absolute time range, you must
--   specify a start time and an end time. For example, if you specify the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:last:AbsoluteTimeRange'</a>, <a>absoluteTimeRange_last</a> - A
--   time range from the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set to the
--   last 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:first:AbsoluteTimeRange'</a>, <a>absoluteTimeRange_first</a> -
--   A time range from the beginning of the call to the value that you've
--   specified. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set
--   to the first 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
newAbsoluteTimeRange :: AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | A value that indicates the beginning of the time range in seconds. To
--   set absolute time range, you must specify a start time and an end
--   time. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
absoluteTimeRange_startTime :: Lens' AbsoluteTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A value that indicates the end of the time range in milliseconds. To
--   set absolute time range, you must specify a start time and an end
--   time. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
absoluteTimeRange_endTime :: Lens' AbsoluteTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A time range from the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set to the
--   last 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
absoluteTimeRange_last :: Lens' AbsoluteTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A time range from the beginning of the call to the value that you've
--   specified. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set
--   to the first 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
absoluteTimeRange_first :: Lens' AbsoluteTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes an asynchronous analytics job that was created with the
--   <tt>StartAnalyticsJob</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallAnalyticsJob</a> smart constructor.
data CallAnalyticsJob
CallAnalyticsJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Media -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Transcript -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition) -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> CallAnalyticsJob

-- | If you know the language spoken between the customer and the agent,
--   specify a language code for this field.
--   
--   If you don't know the language, you can leave this field blank, and
--   Amazon Transcribe will use machine learning to automatically identify
--   the language. To improve the accuracy of language identification, you
--   can provide an array containing the possible language codes for the
--   language spoken in your audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
[$sel:languageCode:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The format of the input audio file. Note: for call analytics jobs,
--   only the following media formats are supported: MP3, MP4, WAV, FLAC,
--   OGG, and WebM.
[$sel:mediaFormat:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe MediaFormat

-- | The status of the analytics job.
[$sel:callAnalyticsJobStatus:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe POSIX
[$sel:media:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Media

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job was completed.
[$sel:completionTime:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe POSIX
[$sel:transcript:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Transcript

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job started processing.
[$sel:startTime:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Shows numeric values to indicate the channel assigned to the agent's
--   audio and the channel assigned to the customer's audio.
[$sel:channelDefinitions:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition)

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language that it identified in the source audio. This value appears
--   only when you don't provide a single language code. Larger values
--   indicate that Amazon Transcribe has higher confidence in the language
--   that it identified
[$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Double

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
[$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Text

-- | If the <tt>AnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>: The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>: The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>: The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>: The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>: The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <i>Guidelines and Quotas</i> in the Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>:
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas in the <a>Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:failureReason:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio.
[$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) that you use to get access to the
--   analytics job.
[$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides information about the settings used to run a transcription
--   job.
[$sel:settings:CallAnalyticsJob'] :: CallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>CallAnalyticsJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_languageCode</a> - If you know the language spoken
--   between the customer and the agent, specify a language code for this
--   field.
--   
--   If you don't know the language, you can leave this field blank, and
--   Amazon Transcribe will use machine learning to automatically identify
--   the language. To improve the accuracy of language identification, you
--   can provide an array containing the possible language codes for the
--   language spoken in your audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input audio
--   file. Note: for call analytics jobs, only the following media formats
--   are supported: MP3, MP4, WAV, FLAC, OGG, and WebM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobStatus:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobStatus</a> - The status of the
--   analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   analytics job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>, <a>callAnalyticsJob_media</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the analytics job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcript:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_transcript</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   analytics job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelDefinitions:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_channelDefinitions</a> - Shows numeric values to
--   indicate the channel assigned to the agent's audio and the channel
--   assigned to the customer's audio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_identifiedLanguageScore</a> - A value between zero
--   and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the language that it
--   identified in the source audio. This value appears only when you don't
--   provide a single language code. Larger values indicate that Amazon
--   Transcribe has higher confidence in the language that it identified
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobName</a> - The name of the call
--   analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>AnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field contains
--   information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>: The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>: The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>: The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>: The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>: The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <i>Guidelines and Quotas</i> in the Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>:
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas in the <a>Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate, in
--   Hertz, of the audio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) that you use to get access to the analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_settings</a> - Provides information about the
--   settings used to run a transcription job.
newCallAnalyticsJob :: CallAnalyticsJob

-- | If you know the language spoken between the customer and the agent,
--   specify a language code for this field.
--   
--   If you don't know the language, you can leave this field blank, and
--   Amazon Transcribe will use machine learning to automatically identify
--   the language. To improve the accuracy of language identification, you
--   can provide an array containing the possible language codes for the
--   language spoken in your audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
callAnalyticsJob_languageCode :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The format of the input audio file. Note: for call analytics jobs,
--   only the following media formats are supported: MP3, MP4, WAV, FLAC,
--   OGG, and WebM.
callAnalyticsJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | The status of the analytics job.
callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobStatus :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job was created.
callAnalyticsJob_creationTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
callAnalyticsJob_media :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Media)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job was completed.
callAnalyticsJob_completionTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
callAnalyticsJob_transcript :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Transcript)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job started processing.
callAnalyticsJob_startTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Shows numeric values to indicate the channel assigned to the agent's
--   audio and the channel assigned to the customer's audio.
callAnalyticsJob_channelDefinitions :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition))

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language that it identified in the source audio. This value appears
--   only when you don't provide a single language code. Larger values
--   indicate that Amazon Transcribe has higher confidence in the language
--   that it identified
callAnalyticsJob_identifiedLanguageScore :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Double)

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | If the <tt>AnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>: The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>: The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>: The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>: The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>: The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <i>Guidelines and Quotas</i> in the Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>:
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas in the <a>Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
callAnalyticsJob_failureReason :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio.
callAnalyticsJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) that you use to get access to the
--   analytics job.
callAnalyticsJob_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the settings used to run a transcription
--   job.
callAnalyticsJob_settings :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings)

-- | Provides optional settings for the <tt>CallAnalyticsJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallAnalyticsJobSettings</a> smart constructor.
data CallAnalyticsJobSettings
CallAnalyticsJobSettings' :: Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode) -> CallAnalyticsJobSettings
[$sel:contentRedaction:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe ContentRedaction

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to use when running a call analytics
--   job. The filter that you specify must have the same language code as
--   the analytics job.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to mask to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it
--   with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to
--   <tt>remove</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript without
--   using placeholder text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the
--   transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set
--   the filter method to <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary
--   filter are not masked or removed.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterMethod:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod

-- | The structure used to describe a custom language model.
[$sel:languageModelName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the call analytics
--   job.
[$sel:vocabularyName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When you run a call analytics job, you can specify the language spoken
--   in the audio, or you can have Amazon Transcribe identify the language
--   for you.
--   
--   To specify a language, specify an array with one language code. If you
--   don't know the language, you can leave this field blank and Amazon
--   Transcribe will use machine learning to identify the language for you.
--   To improve the ability of Amazon Transcribe to correctly identify the
--   language, you can provide an array of the languages that can be
--   present in the audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
[$sel:languageOptions:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode)

-- | Create a value of <a>CallAnalyticsJobSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_contentRedaction</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary filter to use when running a call analytics job. The filter
--   that you specify must have the same language code as the analytics
--   job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterMethod:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterMethod</a> - Set to mask
--   to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it with three
--   asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to <tt>remove</tt> to
--   remove filtered text from the transcript without using placeholder
--   text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the transcription output
--   that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set the filter method to
--   <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary filter are not masked
--   or removed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageModelName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageModelName</a> - The structure used
--   to describe a custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyName</a> - The name of a
--   vocabulary to use when processing the call analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageOptions:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageOptions</a> - When you run a call
--   analytics job, you can specify the language spoken in the audio, or
--   you can have Amazon Transcribe identify the language for you.
--   
--   To specify a language, specify an array with one language code. If you
--   don't know the language, you can leave this field blank and Amazon
--   Transcribe will use machine learning to identify the language for you.
--   To improve the ability of Amazon Transcribe to correctly identify the
--   language, you can provide an array of the languages that can be
--   present in the audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
newCallAnalyticsJobSettings :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings

callAnalyticsJobSettings_contentRedaction :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to use when running a call analytics
--   job. The filter that you specify must have the same language code as
--   the analytics job.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to mask to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it
--   with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to
--   <tt>remove</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript without
--   using placeholder text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the
--   transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set
--   the filter method to <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary
--   filter are not masked or removed.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterMethod :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod)

-- | The structure used to describe a custom language model.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageModelName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the call analytics
--   job.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

--   in the audio, or you can have Amazon Transcribe identify the language
--   for you.
--   
--   To specify a language, specify an array with one language code. If you
--   don't know the language, you can leave this field blank and Amazon
--   Transcribe will use machine learning to identify the language for you.
--   To improve the ability of Amazon Transcribe to correctly identify the
--   language, you can provide an array of the languages that can be
--   present in the audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageOptions :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode))

data CallAnalyticsJobSummary

-- | The language of the transcript in the source audio file.
[$sel:languageCode:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job began processing.
[$sel:startTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
[$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | If the <tt>CallAnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
[$sel:failureReason:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'] :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CallAnalyticsJobSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobStatus:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,

--   the call analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSummary_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the call analytics job was created.

-- | An object that contains the rules and additional information about a

data CategoryProperties

--   recently updated.
[$sel:lastUpdateTime:CategoryProperties'] :: CategoryProperties -> Maybe POSIX

categoryProperties_createTime :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | For a call analytics job, an object that indicates the audio channel
--   that belongs to the agent and the audio channel that belongs to the
--   customer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelDefinition
ChannelDefinition' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> ChannelDefinition

-- | A value that indicates the audio channel.
[$sel:channelId:ChannelDefinition'] :: ChannelDefinition -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates whether the person speaking on the audio channel is the
--   agent or customer.
[$sel:participantRole:ChannelDefinition'] :: ChannelDefinition -> Maybe ParticipantRole

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelDefinition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelId:ChannelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>channelDefinition_channelId</a> - A value that indicates the audio
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:ChannelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>channelDefinition_participantRole</a> - Indicates whether the
--   person speaking on the audio channel is the agent or customer.
newChannelDefinition :: ChannelDefinition

-- | A value that indicates the audio channel.
channelDefinition_channelId :: Lens' ChannelDefinition (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates whether the person speaking on the audio channel is the
--   agent or customer.
channelDefinition_participantRole :: Lens' ChannelDefinition (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | Settings for content redaction within a transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContentRedaction</a> smart constructor.
data ContentRedaction
ContentRedaction' :: RedactionType -> RedactionOutput -> ContentRedaction

-- | Request parameter that defines the entities to be redacted. The only
--   accepted value is <tt>PII</tt>.
[$sel:redactionType:ContentRedaction'] :: ContentRedaction -> RedactionType

-- | The output transcript file stored in either the default S3 bucket or
--   in a bucket you specify.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe outputs only the
--   redacted transcript.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted_and_unredacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe
--   outputs both the redacted and unredacted transcripts.
[$sel:redactionOutput:ContentRedaction'] :: ContentRedaction -> RedactionOutput

-- | Create a value of <a>ContentRedaction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactionType:ContentRedaction'</a>,
--   <a>contentRedaction_redactionType</a> - Request parameter that defines
--   the entities to be redacted. The only accepted value is <tt>PII</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactionOutput:ContentRedaction'</a>,
--   <a>contentRedaction_redactionOutput</a> - The output transcript file
--   stored in either the default S3 bucket or in a bucket you specify.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe outputs only the
--   redacted transcript.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted_and_unredacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe
--   outputs both the redacted and unredacted transcripts.
newContentRedaction :: RedactionType -> RedactionOutput -> ContentRedaction

-- | Request parameter that defines the entities to be redacted. The only
--   accepted value is <tt>PII</tt>.
contentRedaction_redactionType :: Lens' ContentRedaction RedactionType

-- | The output transcript file stored in either the default S3 bucket or
--   in a bucket you specify.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe outputs only the
--   redacted transcript.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted_and_unredacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe
--   outputs both the redacted and unredacted transcripts.
contentRedaction_redactionOutput :: Lens' ContentRedaction RedactionOutput

-- | The object that contains the Amazon S3 object location and access role
--   required to train and tune your custom language model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDataConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InputDataConfig
InputDataConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> InputDataConfig

-- | The Amazon S3 prefix you specify to access the plain text files that
--   you use to tune your custom language model.
[$sel:tuningDataS3Uri:InputDataConfig'] :: InputDataConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon S3 prefix you specify to access the plain text files that
--   you use to train your custom language model.
[$sel:s3Uri:InputDataConfig'] :: InputDataConfig -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the
--   permissions you've given Amazon Transcribe to access your Amazon S3
--   buckets containing your media files or text data.
[$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:InputDataConfig'] :: InputDataConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDataConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tuningDataS3Uri:InputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>inputDataConfig_tuningDataS3Uri</a> - The Amazon S3 prefix you
--   specify to access the plain text files that you use to tune your
--   custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:InputDataConfig'</a>, <a>inputDataConfig_s3Uri</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 prefix you specify to access the plain text files that you
--   use to train your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:InputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>inputDataConfig_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies the permissions you've given Amazon
--   Transcribe to access your Amazon S3 buckets containing your media
--   files or text data.
newInputDataConfig :: Text -> Text -> InputDataConfig

-- | The Amazon S3 prefix you specify to access the plain text files that
--   you use to tune your custom language model.
inputDataConfig_tuningDataS3Uri :: Lens' InputDataConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 prefix you specify to access the plain text files that
--   you use to train your custom language model.
inputDataConfig_s3Uri :: Lens' InputDataConfig Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the
--   permissions you've given Amazon Transcribe to access your Amazon S3
--   buckets containing your media files or text data.
inputDataConfig_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' InputDataConfig Text

-- | An object that enables you to configure your category to be applied to
--   call analytics jobs where either the customer or agent was
--   interrupted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInterruptionFilter</a> smart constructor.
data InterruptionFilter
InterruptionFilter' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> InterruptionFilter

-- | The duration of the interruption.
[$sel:threshold:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe Natural

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where there was a interruption. For example, you can specify the
--   first half of the call. You can also specify the period of time
--   between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the call.
--   Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you can
--   apply relative time ranges across all calls.
[$sel:relativeTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period where there was no
--   interruption.
[$sel:negate:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe Bool

-- | Indicates whether the caller or customer was interrupting.
[$sel:participantRole:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe ParticipantRole

-- | An object you can use to specify a time range (in milliseconds) for
--   when you'd want to find the interruption. For example, you could
--   search for an interruption between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the
--   45,000 millisecond mark. You could also specify the time period as the
--   first 15,000 milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
[$sel:absoluteTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'] :: InterruptionFilter -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>InterruptionFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_threshold</a> - The duration of the
--   interruption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - An object that allows
--   percentages to specify the proportion of the call where there was a
--   interruption. For example, you can specify the first half of the call.
--   You can also specify the period of time between halfway through to
--   three-quarters of the way through the call. Because the length of
--   conversation can vary between calls, you can apply relative time
--   ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_negate</a> - Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a
--   time period where there was no interruption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_participantRole</a> - Indicates whether the
--   caller or customer was interrupting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - An object you can use to
--   specify a time range (in milliseconds) for when you'd want to find the
--   interruption. For example, you could search for an interruption
--   between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the 45,000 millisecond mark.
--   You could also specify the time period as the first 15,000
--   milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
newInterruptionFilter :: InterruptionFilter

-- | The duration of the interruption.
interruptionFilter_threshold :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe Natural)

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where there was a interruption. For example, you can specify the
--   first half of the call. You can also specify the period of time
--   between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the call.
--   Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you can
--   apply relative time ranges across all calls.
interruptionFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period where there was no
--   interruption.
interruptionFilter_negate :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | Indicates whether the caller or customer was interrupting.
interruptionFilter_participantRole :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | An object you can use to specify a time range (in milliseconds) for
--   when you'd want to find the interruption. For example, you could
--   search for an interruption between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the
--   45,000 millisecond mark. You could also specify the time period as the
--   first 15,000 milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
interruptionFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)

-- | Provides information about when a transcription job should be
--   executed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionSettings
JobExecutionSettings' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> JobExecutionSettings

-- | Indicates whether a job should be queued by Amazon Transcribe when the
--   concurrent execution limit is exceeded. When the
--   <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field is true, jobs are queued and
--   executed when the number of executing jobs falls below the concurrent
--   execution limit. If the field is false, Amazon Transcribe returns a
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt> exception.
--   
--   Note that job queuing is enabled by default for call analytics jobs.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
[$sel:allowDeferredExecution:JobExecutionSettings'] :: JobExecutionSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3
--   bucket that contains the input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this
--   role to read queued media files. If you have specified an output S3
--   bucket for the transcription results, this role should have access to
--   the output bucket as well.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
[$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:JobExecutionSettings'] :: JobExecutionSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowDeferredExecution:JobExecutionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSettings_allowDeferredExecution</a> - Indicates whether
--   a job should be queued by Amazon Transcribe when the concurrent
--   execution limit is exceeded. When the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt>
--   field is true, jobs are queued and executed when the number of
--   executing jobs falls below the concurrent execution limit. If the
--   field is false, Amazon Transcribe returns a
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt> exception.
--   
--   Note that job queuing is enabled by default for call analytics jobs.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:JobExecutionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSettings_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3 bucket that contains
--   the input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this role to read queued
--   media files. If you have specified an output S3 bucket for the
--   transcription results, this role should have access to the output
--   bucket as well.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
newJobExecutionSettings :: JobExecutionSettings

-- | Indicates whether a job should be queued by Amazon Transcribe when the
--   concurrent execution limit is exceeded. When the
--   <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field is true, jobs are queued and
--   executed when the number of executing jobs falls below the concurrent
--   execution limit. If the field is false, Amazon Transcribe returns a
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt> exception.
--   
--   Note that job queuing is enabled by default for call analytics jobs.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
jobExecutionSettings_allowDeferredExecution :: Lens' JobExecutionSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3
--   bucket that contains the input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this
--   role to read queued media files. If you have specified an output S3
--   bucket for the transcription results, this role should have access to
--   the output bucket as well.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
jobExecutionSettings_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' JobExecutionSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The structure used to describe a custom language model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLanguageModel</a> smart constructor.
data LanguageModel
LanguageModel' :: Maybe CLMLanguageCode -> Maybe InputDataConfig -> Maybe ModelStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BaseModelName -> LanguageModel

-- | The language code you used to create your custom language model.
[$sel:languageCode:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe CLMLanguageCode

-- | The data access role and Amazon S3 prefixes for the input files used
--   to train the custom language model.
[$sel:inputDataConfig:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe InputDataConfig

-- | The creation status of a custom language model. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is ready for use.
[$sel:modelStatus:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe ModelStatus

-- | The reason why the custom language model couldn't be created.
[$sel:failureReason:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the custom language model was created.
[$sel:createTime:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Whether the base model used for the custom language model is up to
--   date. If this field is <tt>true</tt> then you are running the most
--   up-to-date version of the base model in your custom language model.
[$sel:upgradeAvailability:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe Bool

-- | The most recent time the custom language model was modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the custom language model.
[$sel:modelName:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model used to
--   create the custom language model.
[$sel:baseModelName:LanguageModel'] :: LanguageModel -> Maybe BaseModelName

-- | Create a value of <a>LanguageModel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_languageCode</a> - The language code you used to
--   create your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_inputDataConfig</a> - The data access role and Amazon
--   S3 prefixes for the input files used to train the custom language
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelStatus:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_modelStatus</a> - The creation status of a custom
--   language model. When the status is <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is
--   ready for use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_failureReason</a> - The reason why the custom
--   language model couldn't be created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTime:LanguageModel'</a>, <a>languageModel_createTime</a>
--   - The time the custom language model was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:upgradeAvailability:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_upgradeAvailability</a> - Whether the base model used
--   for the custom language model is up to date. If this field is
--   <tt>true</tt> then you are running the most up-to-date version of the
--   base model in your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_lastModifiedTime</a> - The most recent time the
--   custom language model was modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelName:LanguageModel'</a>, <a>languageModel_modelName</a> -
--   The name of the custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseModelName:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_baseModelName</a> - The Amazon Transcribe standard
--   language model, or base model used to create the custom language
--   model.
newLanguageModel :: LanguageModel

-- | The language code you used to create your custom language model.
languageModel_languageCode :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe CLMLanguageCode)

-- | The data access role and Amazon S3 prefixes for the input files used
--   to train the custom language model.
languageModel_inputDataConfig :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe InputDataConfig)

-- | The creation status of a custom language model. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is ready for use.
languageModel_modelStatus :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe ModelStatus)

-- | The reason why the custom language model couldn't be created.
languageModel_failureReason :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the custom language model was created.
languageModel_createTime :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Whether the base model used for the custom language model is up to
--   date. If this field is <tt>true</tt> then you are running the most
--   up-to-date version of the base model in your custom language model.
languageModel_upgradeAvailability :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Bool)

-- | The most recent time the custom language model was modified.
languageModel_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the custom language model.
languageModel_modelName :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model used to
--   create the custom language model.
languageModel_baseModelName :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe BaseModelName)

-- | Describes the input media file in a transcription request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedia</a> smart constructor.
data Media
Media' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Media

-- | The S3 object location of the input media file. The URI must be in the
--   same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form
--   is:
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:mediaFileUri:Media'] :: Media -> Maybe Text

-- | The S3 object location for your redacted output media file. This is
--   only supported for call analytics jobs.
[$sel:redactedMediaFileUri:Media'] :: Media -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Media</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFileUri:Media'</a>, <a>media_mediaFileUri</a> - The S3
--   object location of the input media file. The URI must be in the same
--   region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form is:
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactedMediaFileUri:Media'</a>,
--   <a>media_redactedMediaFileUri</a> - The S3 object location for your
--   redacted output media file. This is only supported for call analytics
--   jobs.
newMedia :: Media

-- | The S3 object location of the input media file. The URI must be in the
--   same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form
--   is:
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
media_mediaFileUri :: Lens' Media (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 object location for your redacted output media file. This is
--   only supported for call analytics jobs.
media_redactedMediaFileUri :: Lens' Media (Maybe Text)

-- | Identifies the location of a medical transcript.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscript</a> smart constructor.
data MedicalTranscript
MedicalTranscript' :: Maybe Text -> MedicalTranscript

-- | The S3 object location of the medical transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the medical transcript. This URI points to the
--   S3 bucket you created to store the medical transcript.
[$sel:transcriptFileUri:MedicalTranscript'] :: MedicalTranscript -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscript</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptFileUri:MedicalTranscript'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscript_transcriptFileUri</a> - The S3 object location of
--   the medical transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the medical transcript. This URI points to the
--   S3 bucket you created to store the medical transcript.
newMedicalTranscript :: MedicalTranscript

-- | The S3 object location of the medical transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the medical transcript. This URI points to the
--   S3 bucket you created to store the medical transcript.
medicalTranscript_transcriptFileUri :: Lens' MedicalTranscript (Maybe Text)

-- | The data structure that contains the information for a medical
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.
data MedicalTranscriptionJob
MedicalTranscriptionJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Media -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe MedicalTranscript -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Specialty -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Type -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> MedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | The language code for the language spoken in the source audio file. US
--   English (en-US) is the only supported language for medical
--   transcriptions. Any other value you enter for language code results in
--   a <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
[$sel:languageCode:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The format of the input media file.
[$sel:mediaFormat:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MediaFormat

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX
[$sel:media:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Media

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
[$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that contains the <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>. The
--   <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt> contains the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>.
[$sel:transcript:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MedicalTranscript

-- | Shows the type of content that you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the job to identify personal health
--   information (PHI) in the transcription output.
[$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType

-- | The completion status of a medical transcription job.
[$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
[$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The medical specialty of any clinicians providing a dictation or
--   having a conversation. Refer to <a>Transcribing a medical
--   conversation</a>for a list of supported specialties.
[$sel:specialty:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Specialty

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this
--   field contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field contains one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>- The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>- The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>- The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>- The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>- The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <a>Guidelines and Quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Transcribe Medical Guide</i></li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>-
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services General Reference</i></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:failureReason:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A key:value pair assigned to a given medical transcription job.
[$sel:tags:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the source audio containing medical
--   information.
--   
--   If you don't specify the sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines it for you. If you choose to specify the sample rate, it
--   must match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most
--   cases, you should leave the <tt>MedicalMediaSampleHertz</tt> blank and
--   let Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
[$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Natural

-- | The type of speech in the transcription job. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> is
--   generally used for patient-physician dialogues. <tt>DICTATION</tt> is
--   the setting for physicians speaking their notes after seeing a
--   patient. For more information, see <a>What is Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical?</a>.
[$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Type

-- | The name for a given medical transcription job.
[$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Object that contains object.
[$sel:settings:MedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code for
--   the language spoken in the source audio file. US English (en-US) is
--   the only supported language for medical transcriptions. Any other
--   value you enter for language code results in a
--   <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input
--   media file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_media</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcript:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_transcript</a> - An object that contains
--   the <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>. The <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>
--   contains the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_contentIdentificationType</a> - Shows the
--   type of content that you've configured Amazon Transcribe Medical to
--   identify in a transcription job. If the value is <tt>PHI</tt>, you've
--   configured the job to identify personal health information (PHI) in
--   the transcription output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus</a> - The completion
--   status of a medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:specialty:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_specialty</a> - The medical specialty of
--   any clinicians providing a dictation or having a conversation. Refer
--   to <a>Transcribing a medical conversation</a>for a list of supported
--   specialties.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field contains one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>- The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>- The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>- The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>- The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>- The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <a>Guidelines and Quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Transcribe Medical Guide</i></li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>-
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services General Reference</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_tags</a> - A key:value pair assigned to a
--   given medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate,
--   in Hertz, of the source audio containing medical information.
--   
--   If you don't specify the sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines it for you. If you choose to specify the sample rate, it
--   must match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most
--   cases, you should leave the <tt>MedicalMediaSampleHertz</tt> blank and
--   let Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_type</a> - The type of speech in the
--   transcription job. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> is generally used for
--   patient-physician dialogues. <tt>DICTATION</tt> is the setting for
--   physicians speaking their notes after seeing a patient. For more
--   information, see <a>What is Amazon Transcribe Medical?</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName</a> - The name
--   for a given medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_settings</a> - Object that contains object.
newMedicalTranscriptionJob :: MedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | The language code for the language spoken in the source audio file. US
--   English (en-US) is the only supported language for medical
--   transcriptions. Any other value you enter for language code results in
--   a <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
medicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The format of the input media file.
medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
medicalTranscriptionJob_creationTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
medicalTranscriptionJob_media :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Media)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
medicalTranscriptionJob_completionTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that contains the <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>. The
--   <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt> contains the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>.
medicalTranscriptionJob_transcript :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalTranscript)

-- | Shows the type of content that you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the job to identify personal health
--   information (PHI) in the transcription output.
medicalTranscriptionJob_contentIdentificationType :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType)

-- | The completion status of a medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
medicalTranscriptionJob_startTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The medical specialty of any clinicians providing a dictation or
--   having a conversation. Refer to <a>Transcribing a medical
--   conversation</a>for a list of supported specialties.
medicalTranscriptionJob_specialty :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Specialty)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this
--   field contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field contains one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>- The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>- The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>- The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>- The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>- The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <a>Guidelines and Quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Transcribe Medical Guide</i></li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>-
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services General Reference</i></li>
--   </ul>
medicalTranscriptionJob_failureReason :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A key:value pair assigned to a given medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_tags :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the source audio containing medical
--   information.
--   
--   If you don't specify the sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines it for you. If you choose to specify the sample rate, it
--   must match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most
--   cases, you should leave the <tt>MedicalMediaSampleHertz</tt> blank and
--   let Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | The type of speech in the transcription job. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> is
--   generally used for patient-physician dialogues. <tt>DICTATION</tt> is
--   the setting for physicians speaking their notes after seeing a
--   patient. For more information, see <a>What is Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical?</a>.
medicalTranscriptionJob_type :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Type)

-- | The name for a given medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Object that contains object.
medicalTranscriptionJob_settings :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting)

-- | Provides summary information about a transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscriptionJobSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary
MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe OutputLocationType -> Maybe Specialty -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Type -> Maybe Text -> MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary

-- | The language of the transcript in the source audio file.
[$sel:languageCode:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | A timestamp that shows when the medical transcription job was created.
[$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
[$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Shows the type of information you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the transcription job to identify
--   personal health information (PHI).
[$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType

-- | The status of the medical transcription job.
[$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job began processing.
[$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Indicates the location of the transcription job's output. This field
--   must be the path of an S3 bucket; if you don't already have an S3
--   bucket, one is created based on the path you add.
[$sel:outputLocationType:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe OutputLocationType

-- | The medical specialty of the transcription job. Refer to
--   <a>Transcribing a medical conversation</a>for a list of supported
--   specialties.
[$sel:specialty:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Specialty

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
[$sel:failureReason:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The speech of the clinician in the input audio.
[$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Type

-- | The name of a medical transcription job.
[$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'] :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   <a>$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,

--   shows when the medical transcription job was created.
--

--   that shows when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,

--   Shows the type of information you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the transcription job to identify
--   personal health information (PHI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,

--   status of the medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,

--   shows when the job began processing.

--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType</a> - Indicates
--   the location of the transcription job's output. This field must be the

--   created based on the path you add.

--   specialty of the transcription job. Refer to <a>Transcribing a medical
--   conversation</a>for a list of supported specialties.

--   description of the error.

--   clinician in the input audio.

-- | Optional settings for the StartMedicalTranscriptionJob operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscriptionSetting</a> smart constructor.
data MedicalTranscriptionSetting
MedicalTranscriptionSetting' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | Determines whether alternative transcripts are generated along with
--   the transcript that has the highest confidence. If you set
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
[$sel:showAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Bool

-- | Instructs Amazon Transcribe Medical to process each audio channel
--   separately and then merge the transcription output of each channel
--   into a single transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical also produces a transcription of each item
--   detected on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of
--   the item and alternative transcriptions of item. The alternative
--   transcriptions also come with confidence scores provided by Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>
[$sel:channelIdentification:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Bool

-- | The maximum number of alternatives that you tell the service to
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
[$sel:maxAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Natural

-- | Determines whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to
--   identify different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition
--   labels individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels in the <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
[$sel:showSpeakerLabels:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the vocabulary to use when processing a medical
--   transcription job.
[$sel:vocabularyName:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If
--   there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple
--   speakers are identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
[$sel:maxSpeakerLabels:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'] :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionSetting</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:showAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_showAlternatives</a> - Determines
--   whether alternative transcripts are generated along with the
--   transcript that has the highest confidence. If you set
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelIdentification:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_channelIdentification</a> - Instructs
