-- | Starts an asynchronous job to transcribe speech to text.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.StartTranscriptionJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.
data StartTranscriptionJob
StartTranscriptionJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe ModelSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Subtitles -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JobExecutionSettings -> Maybe Settings -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode) -> Text -> Media -> StartTranscriptionJob

-- | The language code for the language used in the input media file.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
[$sel:languageCode:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The format of the input media file.
[$sel:mediaFormat:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MediaFormat

-- | An object that contains the request parameters for content redaction.
[$sel:contentRedaction:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe ContentRedaction

-- | Set this field to <tt>true</tt> to enable automatic language
--   identification. Automatic language identification is disabled by
--   default. You receive a <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error if you enter
--   a value for a <tt>LanguageCode</tt>.
[$sel:identifyLanguage:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Bool

-- | You can specify a location in an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output
--   of your transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe stores the
--   output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
[$sel:outputKey:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of plain text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption
--   context pairs, that provide an added layer of security for your data.
[$sel:kmsEncryptionContext:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Choose the custom language model you use for your transcription job in
--   this parameter.
[$sel:modelSettings:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe ModelSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the
--   transcription job. The user calling the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation must have permission to use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
[$sel:outputEncryptionKMSKeyId:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Add subtitles to your batch transcription job.
[$sel:subtitles:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Subtitles

-- | Add tags to an Amazon Transcribe transcription job.
[$sel:tags:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the sample rate detected by Amazon Transcribe. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe determine the sample rate.
[$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Natural

-- | The location where the transcription is stored.
--   
--   If you set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe puts the
--   transcript in the specified S3 bucket. When you call the
--   GetTranscriptionJob operation, the operation returns this location in
--   the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. If you enable content redaction,
--   the redacted transcript appears in <tt>RedactedTranscriptFileUri</tt>.
--   If you enable content redaction and choose to output an unredacted
--   transcript, that transcript's location still appears in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>. The S3 bucket must have permissions that
--   allow Amazon Transcribe to put files in the bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of your transcription using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   If you don't set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   generates a pre-signed URL, a shareable URL that provides secure
--   access to your transcription, and returns it in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. Use this URL to download the
--   transcription.
[$sel:outputBucketName:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides information about how a transcription job is executed. Use
--   this field to indicate that the job can be queued for deferred
--   execution if the concurrency limit is reached and there are no slots
--   available to immediately run the job.
[$sel:jobExecutionSettings:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe JobExecutionSettings

-- | A <tt>Settings</tt> object that provides optional settings for a
--   transcription job.
[$sel:settings:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Settings

-- | An object containing a list of languages that might be present in your
--   collection of audio files. Automatic language identification chooses a
--   language that best matches the source audio from that list.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
[$sel:languageOptions:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode)

-- | The name of the job. You can't use the strings "<tt>.</tt>" or
--   "<tt>..</tt>" by themselves as the job name. The name must also be
--   unique within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try to create a
--   transcription job with the same name as a previous transcription job,
--   you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:transcriptionJobName:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Text

-- | An object that describes the input media for a transcription job.
[$sel:media:StartTranscriptionJob'] :: StartTranscriptionJob -> Media

-- | Create a value of <a>StartTranscriptionJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code for the
--   language used in the input media file.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input
--   media file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_contentRedaction</a> - An object that
--   contains the request parameters for content redaction.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifyLanguage:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_identifyLanguage</a> - Set this field to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable automatic language identification. Automatic
--   language identification is disabled by default. You receive a
--   <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error if you enter a value for a
--   <tt>LanguageCode</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputKey:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_outputKey</a> - You can specify a location in
--   an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output of your transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe stores the
--   output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncryptionContext:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_kmsEncryptionContext</a> - A map of plain
--   text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption context pairs,
--   that provide an added layer of security for your data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelSettings:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_modelSettings</a> - Choose the custom
--   language model you use for your transcription job in this parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputEncryptionKMSKeyId:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_outputEncryptionKMSKeyId</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the transcription job. The
--   user calling the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> operation must have
--   permission to use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subtitles:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_subtitles</a> - Add subtitles to your batch
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_tags</a> - Add tags to an Amazon Transcribe
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate,
--   in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the sample rate detected by Amazon Transcribe. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe determine the sample rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputBucketName:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_outputBucketName</a> - The location where the
--   transcription is stored.
--   
--   If you set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe puts the
--   transcript in the specified S3 bucket. When you call the
--   GetTranscriptionJob operation, the operation returns this location in
--   the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. If you enable content redaction,
--   the redacted transcript appears in <tt>RedactedTranscriptFileUri</tt>.
--   If you enable content redaction and choose to output an unredacted
--   transcript, that transcript's location still appears in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>. The S3 bucket must have permissions that
--   allow Amazon Transcribe to put files in the bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of your transcription using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   If you don't set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   generates a pre-signed URL, a shareable URL that provides secure
--   access to your transcription, and returns it in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. Use this URL to download the
--   transcription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionSettings:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_jobExecutionSettings</a> - Provides
--   information about how a transcription job is executed. Use this field
--   to indicate that the job can be queued for deferred execution if the
--   concurrency limit is reached and there are no slots available to
--   immediately run the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_settings</a> - A <tt>Settings</tt> object
--   that provides optional settings for a transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageOptions:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_languageOptions</a> - An object containing a
--   list of languages that might be present in your collection of audio
--   files. Automatic language identification chooses a language that best
--   matches the source audio from that list.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobName:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobName</a> - The name of the
--   job. You can't use the strings "<tt>.</tt>" or "<tt>..</tt>" by
--   themselves as the job name. The name must also be unique within an
--   Amazon Web Services account. If you try to create a transcription job
--   with the same name as a previous transcription job, you get a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_media</a> - An object that describes the
--   input media for a transcription job.
newStartTranscriptionJob :: Text -> Media -> StartTranscriptionJob

-- | The language code for the language used in the input media file.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
startTranscriptionJob_languageCode :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The format of the input media file.
startTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | An object that contains the request parameters for content redaction.
startTranscriptionJob_contentRedaction :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | Set this field to <tt>true</tt> to enable automatic language
--   identification. Automatic language identification is disabled by
--   default. You receive a <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error if you enter
--   a value for a <tt>LanguageCode</tt>.
startTranscriptionJob_identifyLanguage :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Bool)

-- | You can specify a location in an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output
--   of your transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe stores the
--   output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
startTranscriptionJob_outputKey :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of plain text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption
--   context pairs, that provide an added layer of security for your data.
startTranscriptionJob_kmsEncryptionContext :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Choose the custom language model you use for your transcription job in
--   this parameter.
startTranscriptionJob_modelSettings :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe ModelSettings)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the
--   transcription job. The user calling the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation must have permission to use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
startTranscriptionJob_outputEncryptionKMSKeyId :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Add subtitles to your batch transcription job.
startTranscriptionJob_subtitles :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Subtitles)

-- | Add tags to an Amazon Transcribe transcription job.
startTranscriptionJob_tags :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the sample rate detected by Amazon Transcribe. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe determine the sample rate.
startTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | The location where the transcription is stored.
--   
--   If you set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe puts the
--   transcript in the specified S3 bucket. When you call the
--   GetTranscriptionJob operation, the operation returns this location in
--   the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. If you enable content redaction,
--   the redacted transcript appears in <tt>RedactedTranscriptFileUri</tt>.
--   If you enable content redaction and choose to output an unredacted
--   transcript, that transcript's location still appears in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>. The S3 bucket must have permissions that
--   allow Amazon Transcribe to put files in the bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of your transcription using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   If you don't set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   generates a pre-signed URL, a shareable URL that provides secure
--   access to your transcription, and returns it in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. Use this URL to download the
--   transcription.
startTranscriptionJob_outputBucketName :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about how a transcription job is executed. Use
--   this field to indicate that the job can be queued for deferred
--   execution if the concurrency limit is reached and there are no slots
--   available to immediately run the job.
startTranscriptionJob_jobExecutionSettings :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe JobExecutionSettings)

-- | A <tt>Settings</tt> object that provides optional settings for a
--   transcription job.
startTranscriptionJob_settings :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Settings)

-- | An object containing a list of languages that might be present in your
--   collection of audio files. Automatic language identification chooses a
--   language that best matches the source audio from that list.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
startTranscriptionJob_languageOptions :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode))

-- | The name of the job. You can't use the strings "<tt>.</tt>" or
--   "<tt>..</tt>" by themselves as the job name. The name must also be
--   unique within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try to create a
--   transcription job with the same name as a previous transcription job,
--   you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
startTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobName :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob Text

-- | An object that describes the input media for a transcription job.
startTranscriptionJob_media :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob Media

StartTranscriptionJobResponse' :: Maybe TranscriptionJob -> Int -> StartTranscriptionJobResponse

[$sel:transcriptionJob:StartTranscriptionJobResponse'] :: StartTranscriptionJobResponse -> Maybe TranscriptionJob

[$sel:httpStatus:StartTranscriptionJobResponse'] :: StartTranscriptionJobResponse -> Int

-- | Starts a batch job to transcribe medical speech to text.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.StartMedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartMedicalTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.
data StartMedicalTranscriptionJob
StartMedicalTranscriptionJob' :: Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> Text -> LanguageCode -> Media -> Text -> Specialty -> Type -> StartMedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | The audio format of the input media file.
[$sel:mediaFormat:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MediaFormat

-- | You can configure Amazon Transcribe Medical to label content in the
--   transcription output. If you specify <tt>PHI</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical labels the personal health information (PHI) that it
--   identifies in the transcription output.
[$sel:contentIdentificationType:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType

-- | You can specify a location in an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output
--   of your medical transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe Medical stores
--   the output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
[$sel:outputKey:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of plain text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption
--   context pairs, that provide an added layer of security for your data.
[$sel:kmsEncryptionContext:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the
--   transcription job. The user calling the StartMedicalTranscriptionJob
--   operation must have permission to use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the current
--   account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS key in the current account or
--   another account: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the medical
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
[$sel:outputEncryptionKMSKeyId:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Add tags to an Amazon Transcribe medical transcription job.
[$sel:tags:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
[$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe Natural

-- | Optional settings for the medical transcription job.
[$sel:settings:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | The name of the medical transcription job. You can't use the strings
--   "<tt>.</tt>" or "<tt>..</tt>" by themselves as the job name. The name
--   must also be unique within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try
--   to create a medical transcription job with the same name as a previous
--   medical transcription job, you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Text

-- | The language code for the language spoken in the input media file. US
--   English (en-US) is the valid value for medical transcription jobs. Any
--   other value you enter for language code results in a
--   <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
[$sel:languageCode:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> LanguageCode
[$sel:media:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Media

-- | The Amazon S3 location where the transcription is stored.
--   
--   You must set <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> for Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   to store the transcription results. Your transcript appears in the S3
--   location you specify. When you call the GetMedicalTranscriptionJob,
--   the operation returns this location in the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field. The S3 bucket must have permissions that allow Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical to put files in the bucket. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of your transcription using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe Medical uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3
--   bucket.
[$sel:outputBucketName:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Text

-- | The medical specialty of any clinician speaking in the input media.
[$sel:specialty:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Specialty

-- | The type of speech in the input audio. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> refers to
--   conversations between two or more speakers, e.g., a conversations
--   between doctors and patients. <tt>DICTATION</tt> refers to
--   single-speaker dictated speech, such as clinical notes.
[$sel:type':StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'] :: StartMedicalTranscriptionJob -> Type

-- | Create a value of <a>StartMedicalTranscriptionJob</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   transcription output. If you specify <tt>PHI</tt>, Amazon Transcribe

--   pairs, that provide an added layer of security for your data.
--

--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>

--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>

--   another account: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the medical
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--

--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.

--   Transcribe medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample
--   rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_settings</a> - Optional settings for
--   the medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName</a> - The
--   name of the medical transcription job. You can't use the strings
--   "<tt>.</tt>" or "<tt>..</tt>" by themselves as the job name. The name
--   must also be unique within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try
--   to create a medical transcription job with the same name as a previous
--   medical transcription job, you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code
--   for the language spoken in the input media file. US English (en-US) is
--   the valid value for medical transcription jobs. Any other value you
--   enter for language code results in a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>
--   error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_media</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputBucketName:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_outputBucketName</a> - The Amazon S3
--   location where the transcription is stored.
--   
--   You must set <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> for Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   to store the transcription results. Your transcript appears in the S3
--   location you specify. When you call the GetMedicalTranscriptionJob,
--   the operation returns this location in the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field. The S3 bucket must have permissions that allow Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical to put files in the bucket. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of your transcription using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe Medical uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:specialty:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_specialty</a> - The medical specialty
--   of any clinician speaking in the input media.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_type</a> - The type of speech in the
--   input audio. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> refers to conversations between two
--   or more speakers, e.g., a conversations between doctors and patients.
--   <tt>DICTATION</tt> refers to single-speaker dictated speech, such as
--   clinical notes.
newStartMedicalTranscriptionJob :: Text -> LanguageCode -> Media -> Text -> Specialty -> Type -> StartMedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | The audio format of the input media file.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | You can configure Amazon Transcribe Medical to label content in the
--   transcription output. If you specify <tt>PHI</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical labels the personal health information (PHI) that it
--   identifies in the transcription output.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_contentIdentificationType :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType)

-- | You can specify a location in an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output
--   of your medical transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe Medical stores
--   the output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_outputKey :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of plain text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption
--   context pairs, that provide an added layer of security for your data.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_kmsEncryptionContext :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the
--   transcription job. The user calling the StartMedicalTranscriptionJob
--   operation must have permission to use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the current
--   account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS key in the current account or
--   another account: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the medical
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_outputEncryptionKMSKeyId :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Add tags to an Amazon Transcribe medical transcription job.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_tags :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | Optional settings for the medical transcription job.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_settings :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting)

-- | The name of the medical transcription job. You can't use the strings
--   "<tt>.</tt>" or "<tt>..</tt>" by themselves as the job name. The name
--   must also be unique within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try
--   to create a medical transcription job with the same name as a previous
--   medical transcription job, you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob Text

-- | The language code for the language spoken in the input media file. US
--   English (en-US) is the valid value for medical transcription jobs. Any
--   other value you enter for language code results in a
--   <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob LanguageCode

-- | Undocumented member.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_media :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob Media

-- | The Amazon S3 location where the transcription is stored.
--   
--   You must set <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> for Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   to store the transcription results. Your transcript appears in the S3
--   location you specify. When you call the GetMedicalTranscriptionJob,
--   the operation returns this location in the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field. The S3 bucket must have permissions that allow Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical to put files in the bucket. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of your transcription using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe Medical uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3
--   bucket.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_outputBucketName :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob Text

-- | The medical specialty of any clinician speaking in the input media.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_specialty :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob Specialty

-- | The type of speech in the input audio. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> refers to
--   conversations between two or more speakers, e.g., a conversations
--   between doctors and patients. <tt>DICTATION</tt> refers to
--   single-speaker dictated speech, such as clinical notes.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_type :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob Type

-- | Starts an asynchronous analytics job that not only transcribes the
--   audio recording of a caller and agent, but also returns additional
--   insights. These insights include how quickly or loudly the caller or
--   agent was speaking. To retrieve additional insights with your
--   analytics jobs, create categories. A category is a way to classify
--   analytics jobs based on attributes, such as a customer's sentiment or
--   a particular phrase being used during the call. For more information,
--   see the operation.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.StartCallAnalyticsJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartCallAnalyticsJob</a> smart constructor.
data StartCallAnalyticsJob
StartCallAnalyticsJob' :: Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Media -> Text -> StartCallAnalyticsJob

-- | When you start a call analytics job, you must pass an array that maps
--   the agent and the customer to specific audio channels. The values you
--   can assign to a channel are 0 and 1. The agent and the customer must
--   each have their own channel. You can't assign more than one channel to
--   an agent or customer.
[$sel:channelDefinitions:StartCallAnalyticsJob'] :: StartCallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key
--   Management Service key used to encrypt the output of the call
--   analytics job. The user calling the operation must have permission to
--   use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You use either of the following to identify an Amazon Web Services KMS
--   key in the current account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS key in the current account or
--   another account: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the call
--   analytics job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputLocation</tt> parameter.
[$sel:outputEncryptionKMSKeyId:StartCallAnalyticsJob'] :: StartCallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A <tt>Settings</tt> object that provides optional settings for a call
--   analytics job.
[$sel:settings:StartCallAnalyticsJob'] :: StartCallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings

-- | The Amazon S3 location where the output of the call analytics job is
--   stored. You can provide the following location types to store the
--   output of call analytics job:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1If you specify a bucket, Amazon Transcribe
--   saves the output of the analytics job as a JSON file at the root level
--   of the bucket.</li>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/f you specify a path, Amazon
--   Transcribe saves the output of the analytics job as
--   s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/your-transcription-job-name.jsonIf you
--   specify a folder, you must provide a trailing slash.</li>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/filename.jsonIf you provide a path
--   that has the filename specified, Amazon Transcribe saves the output of
--   the analytics job as s3://DOC-EXAMPLEBUCKET1/folder/filename.json</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of our analytics job using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of the analytics job output that is placed in
--   your S3 bucket.
[$sel:outputLocation:StartCallAnalyticsJob'] :: StartCallAnalyticsJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the call analytics job. You can't use the string "." or
--   ".." by themselves as the job name. The name must also be unique
--   within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try to create a call
--   analytics job with the same name as a previous call analytics job, you
--   get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:StartCallAnalyticsJob'] :: StartCallAnalyticsJob -> Text
[$sel:media:StartCallAnalyticsJob'] :: StartCallAnalyticsJob -> Media

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3
--   bucket that contains your input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this
--   role to read queued audio files. If you have specified an output S3
--   bucket for your transcription results, this role should have access to
--   the output bucket as well.
[$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:StartCallAnalyticsJob'] :: StartCallAnalyticsJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartCallAnalyticsJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Gets information about vocabulary filters.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.ListVocabularyFilters

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListVocabularyFilters</a> smart constructor.
data ListVocabularyFilters
ListVocabularyFilters' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListVocabularyFilters

-- | If the result of the previous request to
--   <tt>ListVocabularyFilters</tt> was truncated, include the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of collections.
[$sel:nextToken:ListVocabularyFilters'] :: ListVocabularyFilters -> Maybe Text

-- | Filters the response so that it only contains vocabulary filters whose
--   name contains the specified string.
[$sel:nameContains:ListVocabularyFilters'] :: ListVocabularyFilters -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of filters to return in each page of results. If
--   there are fewer results than the value you specify, only the actual
--   results are returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5
--   is used.
[$sel:maxResults:ListVocabularyFilters'] :: ListVocabularyFilters -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListVocabularyFilters</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   
--   <a>$sel:nameContains:ListVocabularyFilters'</a>,
--   <a>listVocabularyFilters_nameContains</a> - Filters the response so
--   that it only contains vocabulary filters whose name contains the
--   specified string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListVocabularyFilters'</a>,

--   filters to return in each page of results. If there are fewer results

--   is used.
listVocabularyFilters_maxResults :: Lens' ListVocabularyFilters (Maybe Natural)

--   collections at a time. The maximum size of the page is set by the
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> parameter. If there are more jobs in the list than
--   the page size, Amazon Transcribe returns the <tt>NextPage</tt> token.
--   Include the token in the next request to the
--   <tt>ListVocabularyFilters</tt> operation to return in the next page of
--   jobs.

--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> number of filters. If there are more filters, call
--   the <tt>ListVocabularyFilters</tt> operation again with the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter in the request set to the value of the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> field in the response.
[$sel:vocabularyFilters:ListVocabularyFiltersResponse'] :: ListVocabularyFiltersResponse -> Maybe [VocabularyFilterInfo]

-- | Returns a list of vocabularies that match the specified criteria. If
--   no criteria are specified, returns the entire list of vocabularies.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.ListVocabularies

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListVocabularies</a> smart constructor.
data ListVocabularies
ListVocabularies' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe VocabularyState -> ListVocabularies

-- | If the result of the previous request to <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> was
--   truncated, include the <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of
--   jobs.
[$sel:nextToken:ListVocabularies'] :: ListVocabularies -> Maybe Text

-- | When specified, the vocabularies returned in the list are limited to
--   vocabularies whose name contains the specified string. The search is
--   not case sensitive, <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> returns both
--   "vocabularyname" and "VocabularyName" in the response list.
[$sel:nameContains:ListVocabularies'] :: ListVocabularies -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of vocabularies to return in each page of results.
--   If there are fewer results than the value you specify, only the actual
--   results are returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5
--   is used.
[$sel:maxResults:ListVocabularies'] :: ListVocabularies -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified, only returns vocabularies with the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field equal to the specified state.
[$sel:stateEquals:ListVocabularies'] :: ListVocabularies -> Maybe VocabularyState

-- | Create a value of <a>ListVocabularies</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListVocabularies'</a>,
--   <a>listVocabularies_nextToken</a> - If the result of the previous
--   request to <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> was truncated, include the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nameContains:ListVocabularies'</a>,
--   <a>listVocabularies_nameContains</a> - When specified, the
--   vocabularies returned in the list are limited to vocabularies whose
--   name contains the specified string. The search is not case sensitive,
--   <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> returns both "vocabularyname" and
--   "VocabularyName" in the response list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListVocabularies'</a>,
--   <a>listVocabularies_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   vocabularies to return in each page of results. If there are fewer
--   results than the value you specify, only the actual results are
--   returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5 is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateEquals:ListVocabularies'</a>,
--   <a>listVocabularies_stateEquals</a> - When specified, only returns
--   vocabularies with the <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field equal to the
--   specified state.
newListVocabularies :: ListVocabularies

-- | If the result of the previous request to <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> was
--   truncated, include the <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of
--   jobs.
listVocabularies_nextToken :: Lens' ListVocabularies (Maybe Text)

-- | When specified, the vocabularies returned in the list are limited to
--   vocabularies whose name contains the specified string. The search is
--   not case sensitive, <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> returns both
--   "vocabularyname" and "VocabularyName" in the response list.
listVocabularies_nameContains :: Lens' ListVocabularies (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of vocabularies to return in each page of results.
--   If there are fewer results than the value you specify, only the actual
--   results are returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5
--   is used.
listVocabularies_maxResults :: Lens' ListVocabularies (Maybe Natural)

-- | When specified, only returns vocabularies with the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field equal to the specified state.
listVocabularies_stateEquals :: Lens' ListVocabularies (Maybe VocabularyState)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListVocabulariesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListVocabulariesResponse
ListVocabulariesResponse' :: Maybe VocabularyState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VocabularyInfo] -> Int -> ListVocabulariesResponse

-- | The requested vocabulary state.
[$sel:status:ListVocabulariesResponse'] :: ListVocabulariesResponse -> Maybe VocabularyState

-- | The <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> operation returns a page of vocabularies
--   at a time. The maximum size of the page is set in the
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> parameter. If there are more jobs in the list than
--   will fit on the page, Amazon Transcribe returns the <tt>NextPage</tt>
--   token. To return in the next page of jobs, include the token in the
--   next request to the <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> operation.
[$sel:nextToken:ListVocabulariesResponse'] :: ListVocabulariesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of objects that describe the vocabularies that match the search
--   criteria in the request.
[$sel:vocabularies:ListVocabulariesResponse'] :: ListVocabulariesResponse -> Maybe [VocabularyInfo]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListVocabulariesResponse'] :: ListVocabulariesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListVocabulariesResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>listVocabulariesResponse_status</a> - The requested vocabulary
--   state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListVocabularies'</a>,
--   <a>listVocabulariesResponse_nextToken</a> - The
--   <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> operation returns a page of vocabularies at
--   a time. The maximum size of the page is set in the <tt>MaxResults</tt>
--   parameter. If there are more jobs in the list than will fit on the
--   page, Amazon Transcribe returns the <tt>NextPage</tt> token. To return
--   in the next page of jobs, include the token in the next request to the
--   <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularies:ListVocabulariesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listVocabulariesResponse_vocabularies</a> - A list of objects that
--   describe the vocabularies that match the search criteria in the
--   request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListVocabulariesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listVocabulariesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newListVocabulariesResponse :: Int -> ListVocabulariesResponse

listVocabulariesResponse_status :: Lens' ListVocabulariesResponse (Maybe VocabularyState)

-- | The <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> operation returns a page of vocabularies
--   at a time. The maximum size of the page is set in the
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> parameter. If there are more jobs in the list than
--   will fit on the page, Amazon Transcribe returns the <tt>NextPage</tt>

-- | Lists transcription jobs with the specified status.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.ListTranscriptionJobs

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTranscriptionJobs</a> smart constructor.
data ListTranscriptionJobs
ListTranscriptionJobs' :: Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> ListTranscriptionJobs

-- | When specified, returns only transcription jobs with the specified
--   status. Jobs are ordered by creation date, with the newest jobs
--   returned first. If you dont specify a status, Amazon Transcribe
--   returns all transcription jobs ordered by creation date.
[$sel:status:ListTranscriptionJobs'] :: ListTranscriptionJobs -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | If the result of the previous request to
--   <tt>ListTranscriptionJobs</tt> is truncated, include the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of jobs.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTranscriptionJobs'] :: ListTranscriptionJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of jobs to return in each page of results. If there
--   are fewer results than the value you specify, only the actual results
--   are returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5 is used.
[$sel:maxResults:ListTranscriptionJobs'] :: ListTranscriptionJobs -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified, the jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs
--   whose name contains the specified string.
[$sel:jobNameContains:ListTranscriptionJobs'] :: ListTranscriptionJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTranscriptionJobs</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ListTranscriptionJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listTranscriptionJobs_status</a> - When specified, returns only
--   transcription jobs with the specified status. Jobs are ordered by
--   creation date, with the newest jobs returned first. If you dont
--   specify a status, Amazon Transcribe returns all transcription jobs
--   ordered by creation date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTranscriptionJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listTranscriptionJobs_nextToken</a> - If the result of the previous
--   request to <tt>ListTranscriptionJobs</tt> is truncated, include the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListTranscriptionJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listTranscriptionJobs_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of jobs
--   to return in each page of results. If there are fewer results than the
--   value you specify, only the actual results are returned. If you do not
--   specify a value, the default of 5 is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobNameContains:ListTranscriptionJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listTranscriptionJobs_jobNameContains</a> - When specified, the
--   jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs whose name contains the
--   specified string.
newListTranscriptionJobs :: ListTranscriptionJobs

-- | When specified, returns only transcription jobs with the specified
--   status. Jobs are ordered by creation date, with the newest jobs
--   returned first. If you dont specify a status, Amazon Transcribe
--   returns all transcription jobs ordered by creation date.
listTranscriptionJobs_status :: Lens' ListTranscriptionJobs (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | If the result of the previous request to
--   <tt>ListTranscriptionJobs</tt> is truncated, include the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of jobs.
listTranscriptionJobs_nextToken :: Lens' ListTranscriptionJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of jobs to return in each page of results. If there
--   are fewer results than the value you specify, only the actual results
--   are returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5 is used.
listTranscriptionJobs_maxResults :: Lens' ListTranscriptionJobs (Maybe Natural)

-- | When specified, the jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs
--   whose name contains the specified string.
listTranscriptionJobs_jobNameContains :: Lens' ListTranscriptionJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTranscriptionJobsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListTranscriptionJobsResponse
ListTranscriptionJobsResponse' :: Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [TranscriptionJobSummary] -> Int -> ListTranscriptionJobsResponse

-- | The requested status of the jobs returned.
[$sel:status:ListTranscriptionJobsResponse'] :: ListTranscriptionJobsResponse -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | The <tt>ListTranscriptionJobs</tt> operation returns a page of jobs at
--   a time. The maximum size of the page is set by the <tt>MaxResults</tt>
--   parameter. If there are more jobs in the list than the page size,
--   Amazon Transcribe returns the <tt>NextPage</tt> token. Include the
--   token in the next request to the <tt>ListTranscriptionJobs</tt>
--   operation to return in the next page of jobs.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTranscriptionJobsResponse'] :: ListTranscriptionJobsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of objects containing summary information for a transcription
--   job.
[$sel:transcriptionJobSummaries:ListTranscriptionJobsResponse'] :: ListTranscriptionJobsResponse -> Maybe [TranscriptionJobSummary]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListTranscriptionJobsResponse'] :: ListTranscriptionJobsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTranscriptionJobsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | Returns a list of vocabularies that match the specified criteria. If
--   you don't enter a value in any of the request parameters, returns the
--   entire list of vocabularies.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.ListMedicalVocabularies

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListMedicalVocabularies</a> smart constructor.
data ListMedicalVocabularies
ListMedicalVocabularies' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe VocabularyState -> ListMedicalVocabularies

-- | If the result of your previous request to
--   <tt>ListMedicalVocabularies</tt> was truncated, include the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of vocabularies.
[$sel:nextToken:ListMedicalVocabularies'] :: ListMedicalVocabularies -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns vocabularies whose names contain the specified string. The
--   search is not case sensitive. <tt>ListMedicalVocabularies</tt> returns
--   both "<tt>vocabularyname</tt>" and "<tt>VocabularyName</tt>".
[$sel:nameContains:ListMedicalVocabularies'] :: ListMedicalVocabularies -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of vocabularies to return in each page of results.
--   If there are fewer results than the value you specify, only the actual
--   results are returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5
--   is used.
[$sel:maxResults:ListMedicalVocabularies'] :: ListMedicalVocabularies -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified, returns only vocabularies with the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> equal to the specified vocabulary state. Use
--   this field to see which vocabularies are ready for your medical
--   transcription jobs.
[$sel:stateEquals:ListMedicalVocabularies'] :: ListMedicalVocabularies -> Maybe VocabularyState

-- | Create a value of <a>ListMedicalVocabularies</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   include the <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of vocabularies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nameContains:ListMedicalVocabularies'</a>,
--   <a>listMedicalVocabularies_nameContains</a> - Returns vocabularies
--   whose names contain the specified string. The search is not case
--   sensitive. <tt>ListMedicalVocabularies</tt> returns both
--   "<tt>vocabularyname</tt>" and "<tt>VocabularyName</tt>".
--

--   <a>listMedicalVocabularies_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   vocabularies to return in each page of results. If there are fewer
--   results than the value you specify, only the actual results are
--   returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5 is used.

-- | Lists medical transcription jobs with a specified status or substring
--   that matches their names.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListMedicalTranscriptionJobs</a> smart constructor.
data ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs
ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs' :: Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs

-- | When specified, returns only medical transcription jobs with the
--   specified status. Jobs are ordered by creation date, with the newest
--   jobs returned first. If you don't specify a status, Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical returns all transcription jobs ordered by creation date.
[$sel:status:ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs'] :: ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus

-- | If you a receive a truncated result in the previous request of
--   <tt>ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs</tt>, include <tt>NextToken</tt> to
--   fetch the next set of jobs.
[$sel:nextToken:ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs'] :: ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of medical transcription jobs to return in each
--   page of results. If there are fewer results than the value you
--   specify, only the actual results are returned. If you do not specify a
--   value, the default of 5 is used.
[$sel:maxResults:ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs'] :: ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified, the jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs
--   whose name contains the specified string.
[$sel:jobNameContains:ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs'] :: ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listMedicalTranscriptionJobs_status</a> - When specified, returns
--   only medical transcription jobs with the specified status. Jobs are
--   ordered by creation date, with the newest jobs returned first. If you
--   don't specify a status, Amazon Transcribe Medical returns all
--   transcription jobs ordered by creation date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listMedicalTranscriptionJobs_nextToken</a> - If you a receive a
--   truncated result in the previous request of
--   <tt>ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs</tt>, include <tt>NextToken</tt> to
--   fetch the next set of jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listMedicalTranscriptionJobs_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   medical transcription jobs to return in each page of results. If there
--   are fewer results than the value you specify, only the actual results
--   are returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5 is used.
--

--   the jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs whose name contains
--   the specified string.
newListMedicalTranscriptionJobs :: ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs

--   jobs returned first. If you don't specify a status, Amazon Transcribe

-- | The maximum number of medical transcription jobs to return in each

--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> parameter. If the number of jobs exceeds what can
--   fit on a page, Amazon Transcribe Medical returns the <tt>NextPage</tt>

--   <tt>ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs</tt> operation to return in the next

-- | Provides more information about the custom language models you've
--   created. You can use the information in this list to find a specific
--   custom language model. You can then use the operation to get more
--   information about it.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.ListLanguageModels

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListLanguageModels</a> smart constructor.
data ListLanguageModels
ListLanguageModels' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ModelStatus -> ListLanguageModels

-- | When included, fetches the next set of jobs if the result of the
--   previous request was truncated.
[$sel:nextToken:ListLanguageModels'] :: ListLanguageModels -> Maybe Text

-- | When specified, the custom language model names returned contain the
--   substring you've specified.
[$sel:nameContains:ListLanguageModels'] :: ListLanguageModels -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of language models to return in each page of
--   results. If there are fewer results than the value you specify, only
--   the actual results are returned. If you do not specify a value, the
--   default of 5 is used.
[$sel:maxResults:ListLanguageModels'] :: ListLanguageModels -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified, returns only custom language models with the specified
--   status. Language models are ordered by creation date, with the newest
--   models first. If you don't specify a status, Amazon Transcribe returns
--   all custom language models ordered by date.
[$sel:statusEquals:ListLanguageModels'] :: ListLanguageModels -> Maybe ModelStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>ListLanguageModels</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>listLanguageModels_nextToken</a> - When included, fetches the next
--   set of jobs if the result of the previous request was truncated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nameContains:ListLanguageModels'</a>,
--   <a>listLanguageModels_nameContains</a> - When specified, the custom
--   language model names returned contain the substring you've specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListLanguageModels'</a>,
--   <a>listLanguageModels_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of language
--   models to return in each page of results. If there are fewer results
--   than the value you specify, only the actual results are returned. If
--   you do not specify a value, the default of 5 is used.

--   custom language models with the specified status. Language models are

--   ordered by date.

--   models first. If you don't specify a status, Amazon Transcribe returns
--   all custom language models ordered by date.

-- | List call analytics jobs with a specified status or substring that
--   matches their names.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.ListCallAnalyticsJobs

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListCallAnalyticsJobs</a> smart constructor.
data ListCallAnalyticsJobs
ListCallAnalyticsJobs' :: Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> ListCallAnalyticsJobs

-- | When specified, returns only call analytics jobs with the specified
--   status. Jobs are ordered by creation date, with the most recent jobs
--   returned first. If you don't specify a status, Amazon Transcribe
--   returns all analytics jobs ordered by creation date.
[$sel:status:ListCallAnalyticsJobs'] :: ListCallAnalyticsJobs -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus

-- | If you receive a truncated result in the previous request of , include
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of jobs.
[$sel:nextToken:ListCallAnalyticsJobs'] :: ListCallAnalyticsJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of call analytics jobs to return in each page of
--   results. If there are fewer results than the value you specify, only
--   the actual results are returned. If you do not specify a value, the
--   default of 5 is used.
[$sel:maxResults:ListCallAnalyticsJobs'] :: ListCallAnalyticsJobs -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified, the jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs
--   whose name contains the specified string.
[$sel:jobNameContains:ListCallAnalyticsJobs'] :: ListCallAnalyticsJobs -> Maybe Text

--   fields omitted.

--   call analytics jobs with the specified status. Jobs are ordered by
--   creation date, with the most recent jobs returned first. If you don't
--   specify a status, Amazon Transcribe returns all analytics jobs ordered
--   by creation date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListCallAnalyticsJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listCallAnalyticsJobs_nextToken</a> - If you receive a truncated
--   result in the previous request of , include <tt>NextToken</tt> to
--   fetch the next set of jobs.

--   analytics jobs to return in each page of results. If there are fewer
--   results than the value you specify, only the actual results are
--   returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5 is used.

--   jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs whose name contains the
--   specified string.

-- | Returns information about a vocabulary filter.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.GetVocabularyFilter

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetVocabularyFilter</a> smart constructor.
data GetVocabularyFilter

[$sel:vocabularyFilterName:GetVocabularyFilter'] :: GetVocabularyFilter -> Text

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   vocabulary filter for which to return information.

data GetVocabularyFilterResponse
GetVocabularyFilterResponse' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Int -> GetVocabularyFilterResponse

-- | The language code of the words in the vocabulary filter.

-- | The date and time that the contents of the vocabulary filter were
--   updated.

--   this URI to get the list of words.

--   time.

-- | Returns information about a transcription job. To see the status of
--   the job, check the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field. If the
--   status is <tt>COMPLETED</tt>, the job is finished and you can find the
--   results at the location specified in the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field. If you enable content redaction, the redacted transcript
--   appears in <tt>RedactedTranscriptFileUri</tt>.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.GetTranscriptionJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>getTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobName</a> - The name of the job.
newGetTranscriptionJob :: Text -> GetTranscriptionJob

getTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobName :: Lens' GetTranscriptionJob Text

-- | Retrieves information about a medical vocabulary.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetMedicalVocabulary</a> smart constructor.
data GetMedicalVocabulary
GetMedicalVocabulary' :: Text -> GetMedicalVocabulary

-- | The name of the vocabulary that you want information about. The value
--   is case sensitive.
[$sel:vocabularyName:GetMedicalVocabulary'] :: GetMedicalVocabulary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetMedicalVocabulary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   vocabulary that you want information about. The value is case
--   sensitive.

--   is case sensitive.
getMedicalVocabulary_vocabularyName :: Lens' GetMedicalVocabulary Text

data GetMedicalVocabularyResponse
GetMedicalVocabularyResponse' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyState -> Maybe Text -> Int -> GetMedicalVocabularyResponse

-- | The valid language code for your vocabulary entries.
[$sel:languageCode:GetMedicalVocabularyResponse'] :: GetMedicalVocabularyResponse -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | If the <tt>VocabularyState</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
[$sel:failureReason:GetMedicalVocabularyResponse'] :: GetMedicalVocabularyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was last modified with a text
--   file different from the one that was previously used.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:GetMedicalVocabularyResponse'] :: GetMedicalVocabularyResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the vocabulary returned by Amazon Transcribe Medical.
[$sel:vocabularyName:GetMedicalVocabularyResponse'] :: GetMedicalVocabularyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The processing state of the vocabulary. If the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> is <tt>READY</tt> then you can use it in the
--   <tt>StartMedicalTranscriptionJob</tt> operation.
[$sel:vocabularyState:GetMedicalVocabularyResponse'] :: GetMedicalVocabularyResponse -> Maybe VocabularyState

-- | The location in Amazon S3 where the vocabulary is stored. Use this URI
--   to get the contents of the vocabulary. You can download your
--   vocabulary from the URI for a limited time.
[$sel:downloadUri:GetMedicalVocabularyResponse'] :: GetMedicalVocabularyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetMedicalVocabularyResponse'] :: GetMedicalVocabularyResponse -> Int

-- | Returns information about a transcription job from Amazon Transcribe

--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt>, the job is finished. You find the results of the
--   completed job in the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field.

-- | Returns information about a call analytics job. To see the status of
--   the job, check the <tt>CallAnalyticsJobStatus</tt> field. If the
--   status is <tt>COMPLETED</tt>, the job is finished and you can find the
--   results at the location specified in the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field. If you enable personally identifiable information (PII)
--   redaction, the redacted transcript appears in the
--   <tt>RedactedTranscriptFileUri</tt> field.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.GetCallAnalyticsJob

-- | Gets information about a single custom language model. Use this
--   information to see details about the language model in your Amazon Web
--   Services account. You can also see whether the base language model
--   used to create your custom language model has been updated. If Amazon
--   Transcribe has updated the base model, you can create a new custom
--   language model using the updated base model. If the language model
--   wasn't created, you can use this operation to understand why Amazon
--   Transcribe couldn't create it.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.DescribeLanguageModel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeLanguageModel</a> smart constructor.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--
