--   language model you submit to get more information.

-- | Creates a new vocabulary filter that you can use to filter words, such
--   as profane words, from the output of a transcription job.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.CreateVocabularyFilter

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateVocabularyFilter</a> smart constructor.
data CreateVocabularyFilter
CreateVocabularyFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Text -> LanguageCode -> CreateVocabularyFilter

-- | The Amazon S3 location of a text file used as input to create the
--   vocabulary filter. Only use characters from the character set defined
--   for custom vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see
--   <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   The specified file must be less than 50 KB of UTF-8 characters.
--   
--   If you provide the location of a list of words in the
--   <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter, you can't use the
--   <tt>Words</tt> parameter.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterFileUri:CreateVocabularyFilter'] :: CreateVocabularyFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   Amazon Transcribe vocabulary filter at the time you create this new
--   vocabulary filter.
[$sel:tags:CreateVocabularyFilter'] :: CreateVocabularyFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The words to use in the vocabulary filter. Only use characters from
--   the character set defined for custom vocabularies. For a list of
--   character sets, see <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   If you provide a list of words in the <tt>Words</tt> parameter, you
--   can't use the <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter.
[$sel:words:CreateVocabularyFilter'] :: CreateVocabularyFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The vocabulary filter name. The name must be unique within the account
--   that contains it. If you try to create a vocabulary filter with the
--   same name as another vocabulary filter, you get a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterName:CreateVocabularyFilter'] :: CreateVocabularyFilter -> Text

-- | The language code of the words in the vocabulary filter. All words in
--   the filter must be in the same language. The vocabulary filter can
--   only be used with transcription jobs in the specified language.
[$sel:languageCode:CreateVocabularyFilter'] :: CreateVocabularyFilter -> LanguageCode

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateVocabularyFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterFileUri:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterFileUri</a> - The Amazon S3
--   location of a text file used as input to create the vocabulary filter.
--   Only use characters from the character set defined for custom
--   vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see <a>Character Sets for
--   Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   The specified file must be less than 50 KB of UTF-8 characters.
--   
--   If you provide the location of a list of words in the
--   <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter, you can't use the
--   <tt>Words</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_tags</a> - Adds one or more tags, each in
--   the form of a key:value pair, to a new Amazon Transcribe vocabulary
--   filter at the time you create this new vocabulary filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:words:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_words</a> - The words to use in the
--   vocabulary filter. Only use characters from the character set defined
--   for custom vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see
--   <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   If you provide a list of words in the <tt>Words</tt> parameter, you
--   can't use the <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The vocabulary
--   filter name. The name must be unique within the account that contains
--   it. If you try to create a vocabulary filter with the same name as
--   another vocabulary filter, you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_languageCode</a> - The language code of the
--   words in the vocabulary filter. All words in the filter must be in the
--   same language. The vocabulary filter can only be used with
--   transcription jobs in the specified language.
newCreateVocabularyFilter :: Text -> LanguageCode -> CreateVocabularyFilter

-- | The Amazon S3 location of a text file used as input to create the
--   vocabulary filter. Only use characters from the character set defined
--   for custom vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see
--   <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   The specified file must be less than 50 KB of UTF-8 characters.
--   
--   If you provide the location of a list of words in the
--   <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter, you can't use the
--   <tt>Words</tt> parameter.
createVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterFileUri :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | The words to use in the vocabulary filter. Only use characters from

--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
createVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilter Text

--   the filter must be in the same language. The vocabulary filter can
--   only be used with transcription jobs in the specified language.

-- | Creates a new custom vocabulary that you can use to change the way
--   Amazon Transcribe handles transcription of an audio file.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.CreateVocabulary

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateVocabulary</a> smart constructor.
data CreateVocabulary
CreateVocabulary' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> LanguageCode -> CreateVocabulary

-- | An array of strings that contains the vocabulary entries.
[$sel:phrases:CreateVocabulary'] :: CreateVocabulary -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   Amazon Transcribe vocabulary at the time you create this new
--   vocabulary.
[$sel:tags:CreateVocabulary'] :: CreateVocabulary -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The S3 location of the text file that contains the definition of the
--   custom vocabulary. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling. The general form is:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about custom vocabularies, see <a>Custom
--   vocabularies</a>.
[$sel:vocabularyFileUri:CreateVocabulary'] :: CreateVocabulary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the vocabulary. The name must be unique within an Amazon
--   Web Services account. The name is case sensitive. If you try to create
--   a vocabulary with the same name as a previous vocabulary you will
--   receive a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:vocabularyName:CreateVocabulary'] :: CreateVocabulary -> Text

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries. For a list of languages
--   and their corresponding language codes, see transcribe-whatis.
[$sel:languageCode:CreateVocabulary'] :: CreateVocabulary -> LanguageCode

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateVocabulary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phrases:CreateVocabulary'</a>, <a>createVocabulary_phrases</a>
--   - An array of strings that contains the vocabulary entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateVocabulary'</a>, <a>createVocabulary_tags</a> -
--   Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   Amazon Transcribe vocabulary at the time you create this new
--   vocabulary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFileUri:CreateVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabulary_vocabularyFileUri</a> - The S3 location of the
--   text file that contains the definition of the custom vocabulary. The
--   URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are
--   calling. The general form is:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about custom vocabularies, see <a>Custom
--   vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:CreateVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabulary_vocabularyName</a> - The name of the vocabulary.
--   The name must be unique within an Amazon Web Services account. The
--   name is case sensitive. If you try to create a vocabulary with the
--   same name as a previous vocabulary you will receive a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CreateVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabulary_languageCode</a> - The language code of the
--   vocabulary entries. For a list of languages and their corresponding
--   language codes, see transcribe-whatis.
newCreateVocabulary :: Text -> LanguageCode -> CreateVocabulary

-- | An array of strings that contains the vocabulary entries.
createVocabulary_phrases :: Lens' CreateVocabulary (Maybe [Text])

-- | Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   Amazon Transcribe vocabulary at the time you create this new
--   vocabulary.
createVocabulary_tags :: Lens' CreateVocabulary (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The S3 location of the text file that contains the definition of the
--   custom vocabulary. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling. The general form is:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about custom vocabularies, see <a>Custom
--   vocabularies</a>.
createVocabulary_vocabularyFileUri :: Lens' CreateVocabulary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the vocabulary. The name must be unique within an Amazon
--   Web Services account. The name is case sensitive. If you try to create
--   a vocabulary with the same name as a previous vocabulary you will
--   receive a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
createVocabulary_vocabularyName :: Lens' CreateVocabulary Text

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries. For a list of languages
--   and their corresponding language codes, see transcribe-whatis.
createVocabulary_languageCode :: Lens' CreateVocabulary LanguageCode

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateVocabularyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateVocabularyResponse
CreateVocabularyResponse' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyState -> Int -> CreateVocabularyResponse

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries.
[$sel:languageCode:CreateVocabularyResponse'] :: CreateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | If the <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
[$sel:failureReason:CreateVocabularyResponse'] :: CreateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was created.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:CreateVocabularyResponse'] :: CreateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the vocabulary.
[$sel:vocabularyName:CreateVocabularyResponse'] :: CreateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The processing state of the vocabulary. When the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field contains <tt>READY</tt> the vocabulary
--   is ready to be used in a <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> request.
[$sel:vocabularyState:CreateVocabularyResponse'] :: CreateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe VocabularyState

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateVocabularyResponse'] :: CreateVocabularyResponse -> Int

--   fields omitted.

--   vocabulary.

-- | Creates a new custom vocabulary that you can use to modify how Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical transcribes your audio file.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.CreateMedicalVocabulary

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateMedicalVocabulary</a> smart constructor.
data CreateMedicalVocabulary
CreateMedicalVocabulary' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Text -> LanguageCode -> Text -> CreateMedicalVocabulary

-- | Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   medical vocabulary at the time you create this new vocabulary.
[$sel:tags:CreateMedicalVocabulary'] :: CreateMedicalVocabulary -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The name of the custom vocabulary. This case-sensitive name must be
--   unique within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try to create a
--   vocabulary with the same name as a previous vocabulary, you get a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:vocabularyName:CreateMedicalVocabulary'] :: CreateMedicalVocabulary -> Text

-- | The language code for the language used for the entries in your custom
--   vocabulary. The language code of your custom vocabulary must match the
--   language code of your transcription job. US English (en-US) is the
--   only language code available for Amazon Transcribe Medical.
[$sel:languageCode:CreateMedicalVocabulary'] :: CreateMedicalVocabulary -> LanguageCode

-- | The location in Amazon S3 of the text file you use to define your
--   custom vocabulary. The URI must be in the same Amazon Web Services
--   Region as the resource that you're calling. Enter information about
--   your <tt>VocabularyFileUri</tt> in the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   https://s3.&lt;aws-region&gt;.amazonaws.com/&lt;bucket-name&gt;/&lt;keyprefix&gt;/&lt;objectkey&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following is an example URI for a vocabulary file that is stored
--   in Amazon S3:
--   
--   <pre>
--   https://s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/AWSDOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/vocab.txt
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon S3 object names, see <a>Object
--   Keys</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about custom vocabularies, see <a>Medical Custom
--   Vocabularies</a>.
[$sel:vocabularyFileUri:CreateMedicalVocabulary'] :: CreateMedicalVocabulary -> Text

--   fields omitted.

-- | Creates a new custom language model. Use Amazon S3 prefixes to provide
--   the location of your input files. The time it takes to create your
--   model depends on the size of your training data.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.CreateLanguageModel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLanguageModel</a> smart constructor.
data CreateLanguageModel
CreateLanguageModel' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> CLMLanguageCode -> BaseModelName -> Text -> InputDataConfig -> CreateLanguageModel

-- | Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   language model at the time you create this new model.
[$sel:tags:CreateLanguageModel'] :: CreateLanguageModel -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The language of the input text you're using to train your custom
--   language model.
[$sel:languageCode:CreateLanguageModel'] :: CreateLanguageModel -> CLMLanguageCode

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model used to
--   create your custom language model.
--   
--   If you want to use your custom language model to transcribe audio with
--   a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or greater, choose <tt>Wideband</tt>.
--   
--   If you want to use your custom language model to transcribe audio with
--   a sample rate that is less than 16,000 Hz, choose <tt>Narrowband</tt>.
[$sel:baseModelName:CreateLanguageModel'] :: CreateLanguageModel -> BaseModelName

-- | The name you choose for your custom language model when you create it.
[$sel:modelName:CreateLanguageModel'] :: CreateLanguageModel -> Text

-- | Contains the data access role and the Amazon S3 prefixes to read the
--   required input files to create a custom language model.
[$sel:inputDataConfig:CreateLanguageModel'] :: CreateLanguageModel -> InputDataConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLanguageModel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateLanguageModel'</a>, <a>createLanguageModel_tags</a>
--   - Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a
--   new language model at the time you create this new model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CreateLanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModel_languageCode</a> - The language of the input
--   text you're using to train your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseModelName:CreateLanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModel_baseModelName</a> - The Amazon Transcribe
--   standard language model, or base model used to create your custom
--   language model.
--   
--   If you want to use your custom language model to transcribe audio with
--   a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or greater, choose <tt>Wideband</tt>.
--   
--   If you want to use your custom language model to transcribe audio with
--   a sample rate that is less than 16,000 Hz, choose <tt>Narrowband</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelName:CreateLanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModel_modelName</a> - The name you choose for your
--   custom language model when you create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:CreateLanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModel_inputDataConfig</a> - Contains the data access
--   role and the Amazon S3 prefixes to read the required input files to
--   create a custom language model.
newCreateLanguageModel :: CLMLanguageCode -> BaseModelName -> Text -> InputDataConfig -> CreateLanguageModel

-- | Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   language model at the time you create this new model.
createLanguageModel_tags :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The language of the input text you're using to train your custom
--   language model.
createLanguageModel_languageCode :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel CLMLanguageCode

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model used to
--   create your custom language model.
--   
--   If you want to use your custom language model to transcribe audio with
--   a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or greater, choose <tt>Wideband</tt>.
--   
--   If you want to use your custom language model to transcribe audio with
--   a sample rate that is less than 16,000 Hz, choose <tt>Narrowband</tt>.
createLanguageModel_baseModelName :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel BaseModelName

-- | The name you choose for your custom language model when you create it.
createLanguageModel_modelName :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel Text

-- | Contains the data access role and the Amazon S3 prefixes to read the
--   required input files to create a custom language model.
createLanguageModel_inputDataConfig :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel InputDataConfig

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLanguageModelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateLanguageModelResponse
CreateLanguageModelResponse' :: Maybe CLMLanguageCode -> Maybe InputDataConfig -> Maybe ModelStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BaseModelName -> Int -> CreateLanguageModelResponse

-- | The language code of the text you've used to create a custom language
--   model.
[$sel:languageCode:CreateLanguageModelResponse'] :: CreateLanguageModelResponse -> Maybe CLMLanguageCode

-- | The data access role and Amazon S3 prefixes you've chosen to create
--   your custom language model.
[$sel:inputDataConfig:CreateLanguageModelResponse'] :: CreateLanguageModelResponse -> Maybe InputDataConfig

-- | The status of the custom language model. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is ready to use.
[$sel:modelStatus:CreateLanguageModelResponse'] :: CreateLanguageModelResponse -> Maybe ModelStatus

-- | The name you've chosen for your custom language model.
[$sel:modelName:CreateLanguageModelResponse'] :: CreateLanguageModelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model you've
--   used to create a custom language model.
[$sel:baseModelName:CreateLanguageModelResponse'] :: CreateLanguageModelResponse -> Maybe BaseModelName

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateLanguageModelResponse'] :: CreateLanguageModelResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLanguageModelResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CreateLanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModelResponse_languageCode</a> - The language code of
--   the text you've used to create a custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:CreateLanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModelResponse_inputDataConfig</a> - The data access
--   role and Amazon S3 prefixes you've chosen to create your custom
--   language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelStatus:CreateLanguageModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModelResponse_modelStatus</a> - The status of the
--   custom language model. When the status is <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model
--   is ready to use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelName:CreateLanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModelResponse_modelName</a> - The name you've chosen
--   for your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseModelName:CreateLanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModelResponse_baseModelName</a> - The Amazon
--   Transcribe standard language model, or base model you've used to
--   create a custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateLanguageModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLanguageModelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCreateLanguageModelResponse :: Int -> CreateLanguageModelResponse

-- | The language code of the text you've used to create a custom language
--   model.
createLanguageModelResponse_languageCode :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe CLMLanguageCode)

-- | The data access role and Amazon S3 prefixes you've chosen to create
--   your custom language model.
createLanguageModelResponse_inputDataConfig :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe InputDataConfig)

-- | The status of the custom language model. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is ready to use.
createLanguageModelResponse_modelStatus :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe ModelStatus)

-- | The name you've chosen for your custom language model.
createLanguageModelResponse_modelName :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model you've
--   used to create a custom language model.
createLanguageModelResponse_baseModelName :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe BaseModelName)

-- | The response's http status code.
createLanguageModelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse Int

-- | Creates an analytics category. Amazon Transcribe applies the
--   conditions specified by your analytics categories to your call
--   analytics jobs. For each analytics category, you specify one or more
--   rules. For example, you can specify a rule that the customer sentiment
--   was neutral or negative within that category. If you start a call
--   analytics job, Amazon Transcribe applies the category to the analytics
--   job that you've specified.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.CreateCallAnalyticsCategory

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateCallAnalyticsCategory</a> smart constructor.
data CreateCallAnalyticsCategory
CreateCallAnalyticsCategory' :: Text -> NonEmpty Rule -> CreateCallAnalyticsCategory

-- | The name that you choose for your category when you create it.
[$sel:categoryName:CreateCallAnalyticsCategory'] :: CreateCallAnalyticsCategory -> Text

-- | To create a category, you must specify between 1 and 20 rules. For
--   each rule, you specify a filter to be applied to the attributes of the
--   call. For example, you can specify a sentiment filter to detect if the
--   customer's sentiment was negative or neutral.
[$sel:rules:CreateCallAnalyticsCategory'] :: CreateCallAnalyticsCategory -> NonEmpty Rule

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateCallAnalyticsCategory</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:categoryName:CreateCallAnalyticsCategory'</a>,
--   <a>createCallAnalyticsCategory_categoryName</a> - The name that you
--   choose for your category when you create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:CreateCallAnalyticsCategory'</a>,
--   <a>createCallAnalyticsCategory_rules</a> - To create a category, you
--   must specify between 1 and 20 rules. For each rule, you specify a
--   filter to be applied to the attributes of the call. For example, you
--   can specify a sentiment filter to detect if the customer's sentiment
--   was negative or neutral.
newCreateCallAnalyticsCategory :: Text -> NonEmpty Rule -> CreateCallAnalyticsCategory

-- | The name that you choose for your category when you create it.
createCallAnalyticsCategory_categoryName :: Lens' CreateCallAnalyticsCategory Text

-- | To create a category, you must specify between 1 and 20 rules. For
--   each rule, you specify a filter to be applied to the attributes of the
--   call. For example, you can specify a sentiment filter to detect if the
--   customer's sentiment was negative or neutral.
createCallAnalyticsCategory_rules :: Lens' CreateCallAnalyticsCategory (NonEmpty Rule)

--   constructor.

-- | Removes specified tags from a specified Amazon Transcribe resource.

--   Transcribe resource.

--   list of tag keys you want to remove from a specified Amazon Transcribe
--   resource.

--   want to remove tags from.

--   existing information with the values that you provide in the request.

-- | The name of the analytics category to update. The name is case
--   sensitive. If you try to update a call analytics category with the
--   same name as a previous category you will receive a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:categoryName:UpdateCallAnalyticsCategory'] :: UpdateCallAnalyticsCategory -> Text

--   provide in this field replace the ones that are currently being used.

-- | Updates a vocabulary with new values that you provide in a different
--   text file from the one you used to create the vocabulary. The
--   <tt>UpdateMedicalVocabulary</tt> operation overwrites all of the
--   existing information with the values that you provide in the request.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateMedicalVocabulary</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateMedicalVocabulary
UpdateMedicalVocabulary' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> LanguageCode -> UpdateMedicalVocabulary

-- | The location in Amazon S3 of the text file that contains your custom
--   vocabulary. The URI must be in the same Amazon Web Services Region as
--   the resource that you are calling. The following is the format for a
--   URI:
--   
--   <pre>
--   https://s3.&lt;aws-region&gt;.amazonaws.com/&lt;bucket-name&gt;/&lt;keyprefix&gt;/&lt;objectkey&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   https://s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/AWSDOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/vocab.txt
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon S3 object names, see <a>Object
--   Keys</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about custom vocabularies in Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical, see <a>Medical Custom Vocabularies</a>.
[$sel:vocabularyFileUri:UpdateMedicalVocabulary'] :: UpdateMedicalVocabulary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the vocabulary to update. The name is case sensitive. If
--   you try to update a vocabulary with the same name as a vocabulary
--   you've already made, you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:vocabularyName:UpdateMedicalVocabulary'] :: UpdateMedicalVocabulary -> Text

-- | The language code of the language used for the entries in the updated
--   vocabulary. US English (en-US) is the only valid language code in
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical.
[$sel:languageCode:UpdateMedicalVocabulary'] :: UpdateMedicalVocabulary -> LanguageCode

--   constructor.
data UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse

-- | The language code for the language of the text file used to update the
--   custom vocabulary. US English (en-US) is the only language supported
--   in Amazon Transcribe Medical.

--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field is <tt>READY</tt>, the vocabulary is
--   ready to be used in a <tt>StartMedicalTranscriptionJob</tt> request.

--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyState:UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateMedicalVocabularyResponse_vocabularyState</a> - The
--   processing state of the update to the vocabulary. When the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field is <tt>READY</tt>, the vocabulary is

-- | The name of the updated vocabulary.

-- | The processing state of the update to the vocabulary. When the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field is <tt>READY</tt>, the vocabulary is
--   ready to be used in a <tt>StartMedicalTranscriptionJob</tt> request.
updateMedicalVocabularyResponse_vocabularyState :: Lens' UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse (Maybe VocabularyState)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateMedicalVocabularyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabularyResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateMedicalVocabulary.UpdateMedicalVocabulary


-- | Updates an existing vocabulary with new values. The
--   <tt>UpdateVocabulary</tt> operation overwrites all of the existing
--   information with the values that you provide in the request.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateVocabulary

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateVocabulary</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateVocabulary
UpdateVocabulary' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> LanguageCode -> UpdateVocabulary

-- | An array of strings containing the vocabulary entries.
[$sel:phrases:UpdateVocabulary'] :: UpdateVocabulary -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The S3 location of the text file that contains the definition of the
--   custom vocabulary. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling. The general form is
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about custom vocabularies, see <a>Custom
--   Vocabularies</a>.
[$sel:vocabularyFileUri:UpdateVocabulary'] :: UpdateVocabulary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the vocabulary to update. The name is case sensitive. If
--   you try to update a vocabulary with the same name as a previous
--   vocabulary you will receive a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:vocabularyName:UpdateVocabulary'] :: UpdateVocabulary -> Text

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries. For a list of languages
--   and their corresponding language codes, see transcribe-whatis.
[$sel:languageCode:UpdateVocabulary'] :: UpdateVocabulary -> LanguageCode

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateVocabulary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phrases:UpdateVocabulary'</a>, <a>updateVocabulary_phrases</a>
--   - An array of strings containing the vocabulary entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFileUri:UpdateVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabulary_vocabularyFileUri</a> - The S3 location of the
--   text file that contains the definition of the custom vocabulary. The
--   URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are
--   calling. The general form is
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about custom vocabularies, see <a>Custom
--   Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:UpdateVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabulary_vocabularyName</a> - The name of the vocabulary to
--   update. The name is case sensitive. If you try to update a vocabulary
--   with the same name as a previous vocabulary you will receive a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:UpdateVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabulary_languageCode</a> - The language code of the
--   vocabulary entries. For a list of languages and their corresponding
--   language codes, see transcribe-whatis.
newUpdateVocabulary :: Text -> LanguageCode -> UpdateVocabulary

-- | An array of strings containing the vocabulary entries.
updateVocabulary_phrases :: Lens' UpdateVocabulary (Maybe [Text])

-- | The S3 location of the text file that contains the definition of the
--   custom vocabulary. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling. The general form is
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about custom vocabularies, see <a>Custom
--   Vocabularies</a>.
updateVocabulary_vocabularyFileUri :: Lens' UpdateVocabulary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the vocabulary to update. The name is case sensitive. If
--   you try to update a vocabulary with the same name as a previous
--   vocabulary you will receive a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
updateVocabulary_vocabularyName :: Lens' UpdateVocabulary Text

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries. For a list of languages
--   and their corresponding language codes, see transcribe-whatis.
updateVocabulary_languageCode :: Lens' UpdateVocabulary LanguageCode

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateVocabularyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateVocabularyResponse
UpdateVocabularyResponse' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyState -> Int -> UpdateVocabularyResponse

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries.
[$sel:languageCode:UpdateVocabularyResponse'] :: UpdateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was updated.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:UpdateVocabularyResponse'] :: UpdateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the vocabulary that was updated.
[$sel:vocabularyName:UpdateVocabularyResponse'] :: UpdateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The processing state of the vocabulary. When the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field contains <tt>READY</tt> the vocabulary
--   is ready to be used in a <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> request.
[$sel:vocabularyState:UpdateVocabularyResponse'] :: UpdateVocabularyResponse -> Maybe VocabularyState

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateVocabularyResponse'] :: UpdateVocabularyResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateVocabularyResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:UpdateVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabularyResponse_languageCode</a> - The language code of
--   the vocabulary entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:UpdateVocabularyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabularyResponse_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time
--   that the vocabulary was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:UpdateVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabularyResponse_vocabularyName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary that was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyState:UpdateVocabularyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabularyResponse_vocabularyState</a> - The processing state
--   of the vocabulary. When the <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field contains
--   <tt>READY</tt> the vocabulary is ready to be used in a
--   <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateVocabularyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabularyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newUpdateVocabularyResponse :: Int -> UpdateVocabularyResponse

updateVocabularyResponse_languageCode :: Lens' UpdateVocabularyResponse (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was updated.
updateVocabularyResponse_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' UpdateVocabularyResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the vocabulary that was updated.
updateVocabularyResponse_vocabularyName :: Lens' UpdateVocabularyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The processing state of the vocabulary. When the
--   <tt>VocabularyState</tt> field contains <tt>READY</tt> the vocabulary
--   is ready to be used in a <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> request.
updateVocabularyResponse_vocabularyState :: Lens' UpdateVocabularyResponse (Maybe VocabularyState)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateVocabularyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateVocabularyResponse Int

-- | Updates a vocabulary filter with a new list of filtered words.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe.UpdateVocabularyFilter

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateVocabularyFilter</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateVocabularyFilter
UpdateVocabularyFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Text -> UpdateVocabularyFilter

-- | The Amazon S3 location of a text file used as input to create the
--   vocabulary filter. Only use characters from the character set defined
--   for custom vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see
--   <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   The specified file must be less than 50 KB of UTF-8 characters.
--   
--   If you provide the location of a list of words in the
--   <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter, you can't use the
--   <tt>Words</tt> parameter.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterFileUri:UpdateVocabularyFilter'] :: UpdateVocabularyFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | The words to use in the vocabulary filter. Only use characters from
--   the character set defined for custom vocabularies. For a list of
--   character sets, see <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   If you provide a list of words in the <tt>Words</tt> parameter, you
--   can't use the <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter.
[$sel:words:UpdateVocabularyFilter'] :: UpdateVocabularyFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to update. If you try to update a
--   vocabulary filter with the same name as another vocabulary filter, you
--   get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterName:UpdateVocabularyFilter'] :: UpdateVocabularyFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateVocabularyFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterFileUri:UpdateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterFileUri</a> - The Amazon S3
--   location of a text file used as input to create the vocabulary filter.
--   Only use characters from the character set defined for custom
--   vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see <a>Character Sets for
--   Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   The specified file must be less than 50 KB of UTF-8 characters.
--   
--   If you provide the location of a list of words in the
--   <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter, you can't use the
--   <tt>Words</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:words:UpdateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabularyFilter_words</a> - The words to use in the
--   vocabulary filter. Only use characters from the character set defined
--   for custom vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see
--   <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   If you provide a list of words in the <tt>Words</tt> parameter, you
--   can't use the <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:UpdateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>updateVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary filter to update. If you try to update a vocabulary filter
--   with the same name as another vocabulary filter, you get a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
newUpdateVocabularyFilter :: Text -> UpdateVocabularyFilter

-- | The Amazon S3 location of a text file used as input to create the
--   vocabulary filter. Only use characters from the character set defined
--   for custom vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see
--   <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   The specified file must be less than 50 KB of UTF-8 characters.
--   
--   If you provide the location of a list of words in the
--   <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter, you can't use the
--   <tt>Words</tt> parameter.
updateVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterFileUri :: Lens' UpdateVocabularyFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | The words to use in the vocabulary filter. Only use characters from
--   the character set defined for custom vocabularies. For a list of
--   character sets, see <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   If you provide a list of words in the <tt>Words</tt> parameter, you
--   can't use the <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter.
updateVocabularyFilter_words :: Lens' UpdateVocabularyFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to update. If you try to update a
--   vocabulary filter with the same name as another vocabulary filter, you
--   get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
updateVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' UpdateVocabularyFilter Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateVocabularyFilterResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateVocabularyFilterResponse
UpdateVocabularyFilterResponse' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Int -> UpdateVocabularyFilterResponse

-- | The language code of the words in the vocabulary filter.
[$sel:languageCode:UpdateVocabularyFilterResponse'] :: UpdateVocabularyFilterResponse -> Maybe LanguageCode

-- | The name of the updated vocabulary filter.
[$sel:vocabularyFilterName:UpdateVocabularyFilterResponse'] :: UpdateVocabularyFilterResponse -> Maybe Text

module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Lens

-- | When included, fetches the next set of jobs if the result of the
--   previous request was truncated.
listLanguageModels_nextToken :: Lens' ListLanguageModels (Maybe Text)

-- | When specified, the custom language model names returned contain the
--   substring you've specified.
listLanguageModels_nameContains :: Lens' ListLanguageModels (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of language models to return in each page of
--   results. If there are fewer results than the value you specify, only
--   the actual results are returned. If you do not specify a value, the
--   default of 5 is used.
listLanguageModels_maxResults :: Lens' ListLanguageModels (Maybe Natural)

-- | When specified, returns only custom language models with the specified
--   status. Language models are ordered by creation date, with the newest
--   models first. If you don't specify a status, Amazon Transcribe returns
--   all custom language models ordered by date.
listLanguageModels_statusEquals :: Lens' ListLanguageModels (Maybe ModelStatus)

-- | The operation returns a page of jobs at a time. The maximum size of
--   the list is set by the MaxResults parameter. If there are more
--   language models in the list than the page size, Amazon Transcribe
--   returns the <tt>NextPage</tt> token. Include the token in the next
--   request to the operation to return the next page of language models.
listLanguageModelsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListLanguageModelsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of objects containing information about custom language models.
listLanguageModelsResponse_models :: Lens' ListLanguageModelsResponse (Maybe [LanguageModel])

-- | The response's http status code.
listLanguageModelsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListLanguageModelsResponse Int

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter for which to return information.
getVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' GetVocabularyFilter Text

-- | The language code of the words in the vocabulary filter.
getVocabularyFilterResponse_languageCode :: Lens' GetVocabularyFilterResponse (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter.
getVocabularyFilterResponse_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' GetVocabularyFilterResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the contents of the vocabulary filter were
--   updated.
getVocabularyFilterResponse_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' GetVocabularyFilterResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The URI of the list of words in the vocabulary filter. You can use
--   this URI to get the list of words.
getVocabularyFilterResponse_downloadUri :: Lens' GetVocabularyFilterResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getVocabularyFilterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetVocabularyFilterResponse Int

-- | The language code for the language used in the input media file.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
startTranscriptionJob_languageCode :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The format of the input media file.
startTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | An object that contains the request parameters for content redaction.
startTranscriptionJob_contentRedaction :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | Set this field to <tt>true</tt> to enable automatic language
--   identification. Automatic language identification is disabled by
--   default. You receive a <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error if you enter
--   a value for a <tt>LanguageCode</tt>.
startTranscriptionJob_identifyLanguage :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Bool)

-- | You can specify a location in an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output
--   of your transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe stores the
--   output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
startTranscriptionJob_outputKey :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of plain text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption
--   context pairs, that provide an added layer of security for your data.
startTranscriptionJob_kmsEncryptionContext :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Choose the custom language model you use for your transcription job in
--   this parameter.
startTranscriptionJob_modelSettings :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe ModelSettings)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the
--   transcription job. The user calling the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation must have permission to use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
startTranscriptionJob_outputEncryptionKMSKeyId :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Add subtitles to your batch transcription job.
startTranscriptionJob_subtitles :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Subtitles)

-- | Add tags to an Amazon Transcribe transcription job.
startTranscriptionJob_tags :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the sample rate detected by Amazon Transcribe. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe determine the sample rate.
startTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | The location where the transcription is stored.
--   
--   If you set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe puts the
--   transcript in the specified S3 bucket. When you call the
--   GetTranscriptionJob operation, the operation returns this location in
--   the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. If you enable content redaction,
--   the redacted transcript appears in <tt>RedactedTranscriptFileUri</tt>.
--   If you enable content redaction and choose to output an unredacted
--   transcript, that transcript's location still appears in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>. The S3 bucket must have permissions that
--   allow Amazon Transcribe to put files in the bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of your transcription using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   If you don't set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   generates a pre-signed URL, a shareable URL that provides secure
--   access to your transcription, and returns it in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. Use this URL to download the
--   transcription.
startTranscriptionJob_outputBucketName :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about how a transcription job is executed. Use
--   this field to indicate that the job can be queued for deferred
--   execution if the concurrency limit is reached and there are no slots
--   available to immediately run the job.
startTranscriptionJob_jobExecutionSettings :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe JobExecutionSettings)

-- | A <tt>Settings</tt> object that provides optional settings for a
--   transcription job.
startTranscriptionJob_settings :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe Settings)

-- | An object containing a list of languages that might be present in your
--   collection of audio files. Automatic language identification chooses a
--   language that best matches the source audio from that list.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
startTranscriptionJob_languageOptions :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode))

-- | The name of the job. You can't use the strings "<tt>.</tt>" or
--   "<tt>..</tt>" by themselves as the job name. The name must also be
--   unique within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try to create a
--   transcription job with the same name as a previous transcription job,
--   you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
startTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobName :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob Text

-- | An object that describes the input media for a transcription job.
startTranscriptionJob_media :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJob Media

-- | An object containing details of the asynchronous transcription job.
startTranscriptionJobResponse_transcriptionJob :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJobResponse (Maybe TranscriptionJob)

-- | The response's http status code.
startTranscriptionJobResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartTranscriptionJobResponse Int

-- | Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   language model at the time you create this new model.
createLanguageModel_tags :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The language of the input text you're using to train your custom
--   language model.
createLanguageModel_languageCode :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel CLMLanguageCode

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model used to
--   create your custom language model.
--   
--   If you want to use your custom language model to transcribe audio with
--   a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or greater, choose <tt>Wideband</tt>.
--   
--   If you want to use your custom language model to transcribe audio with
--   a sample rate that is less than 16,000 Hz, choose <tt>Narrowband</tt>.
createLanguageModel_baseModelName :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel BaseModelName

-- | The name you choose for your custom language model when you create it.
createLanguageModel_modelName :: Lens' CreateLanguageModel Text

-- | Contains the data access role and the Amazon S3 prefixes to read the
--   required input files to create a custom language model.

-- | The language code of the text you've used to create a custom language
--   model.

-- | The data access role and Amazon S3 prefixes you've chosen to create
--   your custom language model.
createLanguageModelResponse_inputDataConfig :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe InputDataConfig)

-- | The status of the custom language model. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is ready to use.
createLanguageModelResponse_modelStatus :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe ModelStatus)

-- | The name you've chosen for your custom language model.
createLanguageModelResponse_modelName :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model you've
--   used to create a custom language model.
createLanguageModelResponse_baseModelName :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse (Maybe BaseModelName)

-- | The response's http status code.
createLanguageModelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateLanguageModelResponse Int

--   truncated, include the <tt>NextToken</tt> to fetch the next set of
--   jobs.
listVocabularies_nextToken :: Lens' ListVocabularies (Maybe Text)

-- | When specified, the vocabularies returned in the list are limited to

--   "vocabularyname" and "VocabularyName" in the response list.
listVocabularies_nameContains :: Lens' ListVocabularies (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of vocabularies to return in each page of results.

--   results are returned. If you do not specify a value, the default of 5
--   is used.
listVocabularies_maxResults :: Lens' ListVocabularies (Maybe Natural)

-- | The <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> operation returns a page of vocabularies

--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> parameter. If there are more jobs in the list than
--   will fit on the page, Amazon Transcribe returns the <tt>NextPage</tt>
--   token. To return in the next page of jobs, include the token in the
--   next request to the <tt>ListVocabularies</tt> operation.

startMedicalTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | You can configure Amazon Transcribe Medical to label content in the
--   transcription output. If you specify <tt>PHI</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical labels the personal health information (PHI) that it
--   identifies in the transcription output.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_contentIdentificationType :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType)

-- | You can specify a location in an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output
--   of your medical transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe Medical stores
--   the output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_outputKey :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of plain text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption
--   context pairs, that provide an added layer of security for your data.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_kmsEncryptionContext :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the
--   transcription job. The user calling the StartMedicalTranscriptionJob
--   operation must have permission to use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the current
--   account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS key in the current account or
--   another account: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the medical
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_outputEncryptionKMSKeyId :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

startMedicalTranscriptionJob_tags :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
startMedicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' StartMedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

--   
--   The specified file must be less than 50 KB of UTF-8 characters.
--   
--   If you provide the location of a list of words in the
--   <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter, you can't use the
--   <tt>Words</tt> parameter.

-- | Adds one or more tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, to a new
--   Amazon Transcribe vocabulary filter at the time you create this new
--   vocabulary filter.
createVocabularyFilter_tags :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The words to use in the vocabulary filter. Only use characters from
--   the character set defined for custom vocabularies. For a list of
--   character sets, see <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   If you provide a list of words in the <tt>Words</tt> parameter, you
--   can't use the <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter.
createVocabularyFilter_words :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The vocabulary filter name. The name must be unique within the account
--   that contains it. If you try to create a vocabulary filter with the
--   same name as another vocabulary filter, you get a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
createVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilter Text

-- | The language code of the words in the vocabulary filter. All words in
--   the filter must be in the same language. The vocabulary filter can
--   only be used with transcription jobs in the specified language.
createVocabularyFilter_languageCode :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilter LanguageCode

-- | The language code of the words in the collection.
createVocabularyFilterResponse_languageCode :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilterResponse (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter.
createVocabularyFilterResponse_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilterResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary filter was modified.
createVocabularyFilterResponse_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilterResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The response's http status code.
createVocabularyFilterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateVocabularyFilterResponse Int

-- | When specified, returns only medical transcription jobs with the
--   specified status. Jobs are ordered by creation date, with the newest
--   jobs returned first. If you don't specify a status, Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical returns all transcription jobs ordered by creation date.
listMedicalTranscriptionJobs_status :: Lens' ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | If you a receive a truncated result in the previous request of
--   <tt>ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs</tt>, include <tt>NextToken</tt> to
--   fetch the next set of jobs.
listMedicalTranscriptionJobs_nextToken :: Lens' ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of medical transcription jobs to return in each
--   page of results. If there are fewer results than the value you
--   specify, only the actual results are returned. If you do not specify a
--   value, the default of 5 is used.
listMedicalTranscriptionJobs_maxResults :: Lens' ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs (Maybe Natural)

-- | When specified, the jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs
--   whose name contains the specified string.
listMedicalTranscriptionJobs_jobNameContains :: Lens' ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | The requested status of the medical transcription jobs returned.
listMedicalTranscriptionJobsResponse_status :: Lens' ListMedicalTranscriptionJobsResponse (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | The <tt>ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs</tt> operation returns a page of
--   jobs at a time. The maximum size of the page is set by the
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> parameter. If the number of jobs exceeds what can
--   fit on a page, Amazon Transcribe Medical returns the <tt>NextPage</tt>
--   token. Include the token in the next request to the
--   <tt>ListMedicalTranscriptionJobs</tt> operation to return in the next
--   page of jobs.
listMedicalTranscriptionJobsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListMedicalTranscriptionJobsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of objects containing summary information for a transcription
--   job.
listMedicalTranscriptionJobsResponse_medicalTranscriptionJobSummaries :: Lens' ListMedicalTranscriptionJobsResponse (Maybe [MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listMedicalTranscriptionJobsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListMedicalTranscriptionJobsResponse Int

-- | When you start a call analytics job, you must pass an array that maps
--   the agent and the customer to specific audio channels. The values you
--   can assign to a channel are 0 and 1. The agent and the customer must
--   each have their own channel. You can't assign more than one channel to
--   an agent or customer.
startCallAnalyticsJob_channelDefinitions :: Lens' StartCallAnalyticsJob (Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition))

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key
--   Management Service key used to encrypt the output of the call
--   analytics job. The user calling the operation must have permission to
--   use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You use either of the following to identify an Amazon Web Services KMS
--   key in the current account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS key in the current account or
--   another account: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the call
--   analytics job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputLocation</tt> parameter.
startCallAnalyticsJob_outputEncryptionKMSKeyId :: Lens' StartCallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>Settings</tt> object that provides optional settings for a call
--   analytics job.
startCallAnalyticsJob_settings :: Lens' StartCallAnalyticsJob (Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings)

-- | The Amazon S3 location where the output of the call analytics job is
--   stored. You can provide the following location types to store the
--   output of call analytics job:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1If you specify a bucket, Amazon Transcribe
--   saves the output of the analytics job as a JSON file at the root level
--   of the bucket.</li>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/f you specify a path, Amazon
--   Transcribe saves the output of the analytics job as
--   s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/your-transcription-job-name.jsonIf you
--   specify a folder, you must provide a trailing slash.</li>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/filename.jsonIf you provide a path
--   that has the filename specified, Amazon Transcribe saves the output of
--   the analytics job as s3://DOC-EXAMPLEBUCKET1/folder/filename.json</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of our analytics job using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of the analytics job output that is placed in
--   your S3 bucket.
startCallAnalyticsJob_outputLocation :: Lens' StartCallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the call analytics job. You can't use the string "." or
--   ".." by themselves as the job name. The name must also be unique
--   within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try to create a call
--   analytics job with the same name as a previous call analytics job, you
--   get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
startCallAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobName :: Lens' StartCallAnalyticsJob Text

-- | Undocumented member.
startCallAnalyticsJob_media :: Lens' StartCallAnalyticsJob Media

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3
--   bucket that contains your input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this
--   role to read queued audio files. If you have specified an output S3
--   bucket for your transcription results, this role should have access to
--   the output bucket as well.

-- | A value that indicates the beginning of the time range in seconds. To
--   set absolute time range, you must specify a start time and an end
--   time. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
absoluteTimeRange_startTime :: Lens' AbsoluteTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A value that indicates the end of the time range in milliseconds. To
--   set absolute time range, you must specify a start time and an end
--   time. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
absoluteTimeRange_endTime :: Lens' AbsoluteTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A time range from the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set to the
--   last 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
absoluteTimeRange_last :: Lens' AbsoluteTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A time range from the beginning of the call to the value that you've
--   specified. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set
--   to the first 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
absoluteTimeRange_first :: Lens' AbsoluteTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | If you know the language spoken between the customer and the agent,
--   specify a language code for this field.
--   
--   If you don't know the language, you can leave this field blank, and
--   Amazon Transcribe will use machine learning to automatically identify
--   the language. To improve the accuracy of language identification, you
--   can provide an array containing the possible language codes for the
--   language spoken in your audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
callAnalyticsJob_languageCode :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

--   OGG, and WebM.
