callAnalyticsJob_transcript :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Transcript)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the analytics job started processing.
callAnalyticsJob_startTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Shows numeric values to indicate the channel assigned to the agent's
--   audio and the channel assigned to the customer's audio.
callAnalyticsJob_channelDefinitions :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition))

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language that it identified in the source audio. This value appears
--   only when you don't provide a single language code. Larger values
--   indicate that Amazon Transcribe has higher confidence in the language
--   that it identified
callAnalyticsJob_identifiedLanguageScore :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Double)

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | If the <tt>AnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>: The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>: The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>: The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>: The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>: The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <i>Guidelines and Quotas</i> in the Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>:
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas in the <a>Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
callAnalyticsJob_failureReason :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio.
callAnalyticsJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) that you use to get access to the
--   analytics job.
callAnalyticsJob_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the settings used to run a transcription
--   job.
callAnalyticsJob_settings :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJob (Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings)

-- | Undocumented member.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_contentRedaction :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to use when running a call analytics
--   job. The filter that you specify must have the same language code as
--   the analytics job.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to mask to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it
--   with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to
--   <tt>remove</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript without
--   using placeholder text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the
--   transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set
--   the filter method to <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary
--   filter are not masked or removed.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterMethod :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod)

-- | The structure used to describe a custom language model.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageModelName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the call analytics
--   job.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When you run a call analytics job, you can specify the language spoken
--   in the audio, or you can have Amazon Transcribe identify the language
--   for you.
--   
--   To specify a language, specify an array with one language code. If you
--   don't know the language, you can leave this field blank and Amazon
--   Transcribe will use machine learning to identify the language for you.
--   To improve the ability of Amazon Transcribe to correctly identify the
--   language, you can provide an array of the languages that can be
--   present in the audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageOptions :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSettings (Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode))

-- | The language of the transcript in the source audio file.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_languageCode :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The status of the call analytics job.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_callAnalyticsJobStatus :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics job was created.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_creationTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_completionTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job began processing.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_startTime :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the call analytics job.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_callAnalyticsJobName :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | If the <tt>CallAnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
callAnalyticsJobSummary_failureReason :: Lens' CallAnalyticsJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics category was most
--   recently updated.
categoryProperties_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The rules used to create a call analytics category.
categoryProperties_rules :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe (NonEmpty Rule))

-- | The name of the call analytics category.
categoryProperties_categoryName :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the call analytics category was created.
categoryProperties_createTime :: Lens' CategoryProperties (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A value that indicates the audio channel.
channelDefinition_channelId :: Lens' ChannelDefinition (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates whether the person speaking on the audio channel is the
--   agent or customer.
channelDefinition_participantRole :: Lens' ChannelDefinition (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | Request parameter that defines the entities to be redacted. The only
--   accepted value is <tt>PII</tt>.
contentRedaction_redactionType :: Lens' ContentRedaction RedactionType

-- | The output transcript file stored in either the default S3 bucket or
--   in a bucket you specify.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe outputs only the
--   redacted transcript.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted_and_unredacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe
--   outputs both the redacted and unredacted transcripts.
contentRedaction_redactionOutput :: Lens' ContentRedaction RedactionOutput

-- | The Amazon S3 prefix you specify to access the plain text files that
--   you use to tune your custom language model.
inputDataConfig_tuningDataS3Uri :: Lens' InputDataConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 prefix you specify to access the plain text files that
--   you use to train your custom language model.
inputDataConfig_s3Uri :: Lens' InputDataConfig Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the
--   permissions you've given Amazon Transcribe to access your Amazon S3
--   buckets containing your media files or text data.
inputDataConfig_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' InputDataConfig Text

-- | The duration of the interruption.
interruptionFilter_threshold :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe Natural)

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where there was a interruption. For example, you can specify the
--   first half of the call. You can also specify the period of time
--   between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the call.
--   Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you can
--   apply relative time ranges across all calls.
interruptionFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period where there was no
--   interruption.
interruptionFilter_negate :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | Indicates whether the caller or customer was interrupting.
interruptionFilter_participantRole :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | An object you can use to specify a time range (in milliseconds) for
--   when you'd want to find the interruption. For example, you could
--   search for an interruption between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the
--   45,000 millisecond mark. You could also specify the time period as the
--   first 15,000 milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
interruptionFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' InterruptionFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)

-- | Indicates whether a job should be queued by Amazon Transcribe when the
--   concurrent execution limit is exceeded. When the
--   <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field is true, jobs are queued and
--   executed when the number of executing jobs falls below the concurrent
--   execution limit. If the field is false, Amazon Transcribe returns a
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt> exception.
--   
--   Note that job queuing is enabled by default for call analytics jobs.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
jobExecutionSettings_allowDeferredExecution :: Lens' JobExecutionSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3
--   bucket that contains the input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this
--   role to read queued media files. If you have specified an output S3
--   bucket for the transcription results, this role should have access to
--   the output bucket as well.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
jobExecutionSettings_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' JobExecutionSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The language code you used to create your custom language model.
languageModel_languageCode :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe CLMLanguageCode)

-- | The data access role and Amazon S3 prefixes for the input files used
--   to train the custom language model.
languageModel_inputDataConfig :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe InputDataConfig)

-- | The creation status of a custom language model. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is ready for use.
languageModel_modelStatus :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe ModelStatus)

-- | The reason why the custom language model couldn't be created.
languageModel_failureReason :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the custom language model was created.
languageModel_createTime :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Whether the base model used for the custom language model is up to
--   date. If this field is <tt>true</tt> then you are running the most
--   up-to-date version of the base model in your custom language model.
languageModel_upgradeAvailability :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Bool)

-- | The most recent time the custom language model was modified.
languageModel_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the custom language model.
languageModel_modelName :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model used to
--   create the custom language model.
languageModel_baseModelName :: Lens' LanguageModel (Maybe BaseModelName)

-- | The S3 object location of the input media file. The URI must be in the
--   same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form
--   is:
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
media_mediaFileUri :: Lens' Media (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 object location for your redacted output media file. This is
--   only supported for call analytics jobs.
media_redactedMediaFileUri :: Lens' Media (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 object location of the medical transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the medical transcript. This URI points to the
--   S3 bucket you created to store the medical transcript.
medicalTranscript_transcriptFileUri :: Lens' MedicalTranscript (Maybe Text)

-- | The language code for the language spoken in the source audio file. US
--   English (en-US) is the only supported language for medical
--   transcriptions. Any other value you enter for language code results in
--   a <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
medicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

medicalTranscriptionJob_completionTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

--   <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt> contains the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>.
medicalTranscriptionJob_transcript :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalTranscript)

-- | Shows the type of content that you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the job to identify personal health
--   information (PHI) in the transcription output.
medicalTranscriptionJob_contentIdentificationType :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType)

-- | The completion status of a medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
medicalTranscriptionJob_startTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The medical specialty of any clinicians providing a dictation or
--   having a conversation. Refer to <a>Transcribing a medical
--   conversation</a>for a list of supported specialties.
medicalTranscriptionJob_specialty :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Specialty)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this
--   field contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field contains one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>- The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>- The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>- The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>- The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>- The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <a>Guidelines and Quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Transcribe Medical Guide</i></li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>-
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services General Reference</i></li>
--   </ul>
medicalTranscriptionJob_failureReason :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A key:value pair assigned to a given medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_tags :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the source audio containing medical
--   information.
--   
--   If you don't specify the sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines it for you. If you choose to specify the sample rate, it
--   must match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most
--   cases, you should leave the <tt>MedicalMediaSampleHertz</tt> blank and
--   let Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | The type of speech in the transcription job. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> is
--   generally used for patient-physician dialogues. <tt>DICTATION</tt> is
--   the setting for physicians speaking their notes after seeing a
--   patient. For more information, see <a>What is Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical?</a>.
medicalTranscriptionJob_type :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Type)

-- | The name for a given medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Object that contains object.
medicalTranscriptionJob_settings :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJob (Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting)

-- | The language of the transcript in the source audio file.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_languageCode :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the medical transcription job was created.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_creationTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_completionTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Shows the type of information you've configured Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical to identify in a transcription job. If the value is
--   <tt>PHI</tt>, you've configured the transcription job to identify
--   personal health information (PHI).
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_contentIdentificationType :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType)

-- | The status of the medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job began processing.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_startTime :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates the location of the transcription job's output. This field
--   must be the path of an S3 bucket; if you don't already have an S3
--   bucket, one is created based on the path you add.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe OutputLocationType)

-- | The medical specialty of the transcription job. Refer to
--   <a>Transcribing a medical conversation</a>for a list of supported
--   specialties.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_specialty :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Specialty)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_failureReason :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The speech of the clinician in the input audio.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_type :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Type)

-- | The name of a medical transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_medicalTranscriptionJobName :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Determines whether alternative transcripts are generated along with
--   the transcript that has the highest confidence. If you set
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_showAlternatives :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Bool)

-- | Instructs Amazon Transcribe Medical to process each audio channel
--   separately and then merge the transcription output of each channel
--   into a single transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical also produces a transcription of each item
--   detected on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of
--   the item and alternative transcriptions of item. The alternative
--   transcriptions also come with confidence scores provided by Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>
medicalTranscriptionSetting_channelIdentification :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Bool)

-- | The maximum number of alternatives that you tell the service to
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_maxAlternatives :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Natural)

-- | Determines whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to
--   identify different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition
--   labels individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels in the <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_showSpeakerLabels :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the vocabulary to use when processing a medical
--   transcription job.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_vocabularyName :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If
--   there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple
--   speakers are identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
medicalTranscriptionSetting_maxSpeakerLabels :: Lens' MedicalTranscriptionSetting (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of your custom language model.
modelSettings_languageModelName :: Lens' ModelSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The duration of the period when neither the customer nor agent was
--   talking.
nonTalkTimeFilter_threshold :: Lens' NonTalkTimeFilter (Maybe Natural)

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where there was silence. For example, you can specify the first
--   half of the call. You can also specify the period of time between
--   halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the call. Because
--   the length of conversation can vary between calls, you can apply
--   relative time ranges across all calls.
nonTalkTimeFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' NonTalkTimeFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period when people were
--   talking.
nonTalkTimeFilter_negate :: Lens' NonTalkTimeFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object you can use to specify a time range (in milliseconds) for
--   when no one is talking. For example, you could specify a time period
--   between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the 45,000 millisecond mark.
--   You could also specify the time period as the first 15,000
--   milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
nonTalkTimeFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' NonTalkTimeFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)

-- | A value that indicates the percentage of the beginning of the time
--   range. To set a relative time range, you must specify a start
--   percentage and an end percentage. For example, if you specify the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
relativeTimeRange_startPercentage :: Lens' RelativeTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A value that indicates the percentage of the end of the time range. To
--   set a relative time range, you must specify a start percentage and an
--   end percentage. For example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
relativeTimeRange_endPercentage :: Lens' RelativeTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A range that takes the portion of the call from the time in
--   milliseconds set by the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is
--   set for the last 120,000 milliseconds of the call.
relativeTimeRange_last :: Lens' RelativeTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A range that takes the portion of the call up to the time in
--   milliseconds set by the value that you've specified. For example, if
--   you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is set for the first
--   120,000 milliseconds of the call.
relativeTimeRange_first :: Lens' RelativeTimeRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | A condition that is applied to a particular customer sentiment.
rule_sentimentFilter :: Lens' Rule (Maybe SentimentFilter)

-- | A condition for a time period when either the customer or agent was
--   interrupting the other person.
rule_interruptionFilter :: Lens' Rule (Maybe InterruptionFilter)

-- | A condition that catches particular words or phrases based on a exact
--   match. For example, if you set the phrase "I want to speak to the
--   manager", only that exact phrase will be returned.
rule_transcriptFilter :: Lens' Rule (Maybe TranscriptFilter)

-- | A condition for a time period when neither the customer nor the agent
--   was talking.
rule_nonTalkTimeFilter :: Lens' Rule (Maybe NonTalkTimeFilter)

-- | The time range, set in percentages, that correspond to proportion of
--   the call.
sentimentFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' SentimentFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for sentiments that weren't specified in
--   the request.
sentimentFilter_negate :: Lens' SentimentFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that determines whether the sentiment belongs to the customer
--   or the agent.
sentimentFilter_participantRole :: Lens' SentimentFilter (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | The time range, measured in seconds, of the sentiment.
sentimentFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' SentimentFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)

-- | An array that enables you to specify sentiments for the customer or
--   agent. You can specify one or more values.
sentimentFilter_sentiments :: Lens' SentimentFilter (NonEmpty SentimentValue)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter to use when transcribing the audio.
--   The filter that you specify must have the same language code as the
--   transcription job.
settings_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <tt>mask</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript and
--   replace it with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to
--   <tt>remove</tt> to remove filtered text from the transcript without
--   using placeholder text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the
--   transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set
--   the filter method to <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary
--   filter are not masked or removed.
settings_vocabularyFilterMethod :: Lens' Settings (Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod)

-- | Determines whether the transcription contains alternative
--   transcriptions. If you set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to
--   true, you must also set the maximum number of alternatives to return
--   in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field.
settings_showAlternatives :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Instructs Amazon Transcribe to process each audio channel separately
--   and then merge the transcription output of each channel into a single
--   transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe also produces a transcription of each item detected
--   on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of the item
--   and alternative transcriptions of the item including the confidence
--   that Amazon Transcribe has in the transcription.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
settings_channelIdentification :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of alternative transcriptions that the service should
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
settings_maxAlternatives :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Determines whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to
--   identify different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition
--   labels individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
settings_showSpeakerLabels :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the transcription job.
settings_vocabularyName :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If
--   there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple
--   speakers are identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
settings_maxSpeakerLabels :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specify the output format for your subtitle file.
subtitles_formats :: Lens' Subtitles (Maybe [SubtitleFormat])

-- | Choose the output location for your subtitle file. This location must
--   be an S3 bucket.
subtitlesOutput_subtitleFileUris :: Lens' SubtitlesOutput (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specify the output format for your subtitle file; if you select both
--   SRT and VTT formats, two output files are genereated.
subtitlesOutput_formats :: Lens' SubtitlesOutput (Maybe [SubtitleFormat])

-- | The first part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a
--   given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the key
--   is 'Department'.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The second part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a
--   given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the
--   value is 'Sales'.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The S3 object location of the transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the transcript. If you specified an S3 bucket
--   in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the job, this
--   is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the transcript in
--   Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides secure access
--   to that location.
transcript_transcriptFileUri :: Lens' Transcript (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 object location of the redacted transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the redacted transcript. If you specified an S3
--   bucket in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the
--   job, this is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the
--   transcript in Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides
--   secure access to that location.
transcript_redactedTranscriptFileUri :: Lens' Transcript (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where you would like to apply a filter. For example, you can
--   specify the first half of the call. You can also specify the period of
--   time between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the
--   call. Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you
--   can apply relative time ranges across all calls.
transcriptFilter_relativeTimeRange :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (Maybe RelativeTimeRange)

-- | If <tt>TRUE</tt>, the rule that you specify is applied to everything
--   except for the phrases that you specify.
transcriptFilter_negate :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | Determines whether the customer or the agent is speaking the phrases
--   that you've specified.
transcriptFilter_participantRole :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (Maybe ParticipantRole)

-- | A time range, set in seconds, between two points in the call.
transcriptFilter_absoluteTimeRange :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange)

-- | Matches the phrase to the transcription output in a word for word
--   fashion. For example, if you specify the phrase "I want to speak to
--   the manager." Amazon Transcribe attempts to match that specific phrase
--   to the transcription.
transcriptFilter_transcriptFilterType :: Lens' TranscriptFilter TranscriptFilterType

-- | The phrases that you're specifying for the transcript filter to match.
transcriptFilter_targets :: Lens' TranscriptFilter (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The language code for the input speech.
transcriptionJob_languageCode :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The format of the input media file.
transcriptionJob_mediaFormat :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe MediaFormat)

-- | An object that describes content redaction settings for the
--   transcription job.
transcriptionJob_contentRedaction :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
transcriptionJob_creationTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the input media for the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_media :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Media)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job completed.
transcriptionJob_completionTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the output of the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_transcript :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Transcript)

-- | A value that shows if automatic language identification was enabled
--   for a transcription job.
transcriptionJob_identifyLanguage :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_transcriptionJobName :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
transcriptionJob_startTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object containing the details of your custom language model.
transcriptionJob_modelSettings :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe ModelSettings)

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language that it identified in the source audio. Larger values
--   indicate that Amazon Transcribe has higher confidence in the language
--   it identified.
transcriptionJob_identifiedLanguageScore :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Double)

-- | Generate subtitles for your batch transcription job.
transcriptionJob_subtitles :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe SubtitlesOutput)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this
--   field contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt> - The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><pre>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</pre></li>
--   <li>The media format of the audio file doesn't match the format
--   specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request. Check the
--   media format of your media file and make sure that the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt> - The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt> - The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt> - The size of your
--   audio file is larger than Amazon Transcribe can process. For more
--   information, see <a>Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Transcribe Developer
--   Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>
--   - Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
transcriptionJob_failureReason :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A key:value pair assigned to a given transcription job.
transcriptionJob_tags :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
transcriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Natural)

-- | Provides information about how a transcription job is executed.
transcriptionJob_jobExecutionSettings :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe JobExecutionSettings)

-- | Optional settings for the transcription job. Use these settings to
--   turn on speaker recognition, to set the maximum number of speakers
--   that should be identified and to specify a custom vocabulary to use
--   when processing the transcription job.
transcriptionJob_settings :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe Settings)

-- | An object that shows the optional array of languages inputted for
--   transcription jobs with automatic language identification enabled.
transcriptionJob_languageOptions :: Lens' TranscriptionJob (Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode))

-- | The language code for the input speech.
transcriptionJobSummary_languageCode :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The content redaction settings of the transcription job.
transcriptionJobSummary_contentRedaction :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe ContentRedaction)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was created.
transcriptionJobSummary_creationTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.
transcriptionJobSummary_completionTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Whether automatic language identification was enabled for a
--   transcription job.
transcriptionJobSummary_identifyLanguage :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the transcription job.
transcriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobName :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the transcription job. When the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt>, use the <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> operation to
--   get the results of the transcription.
transcriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobStatus :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus)

-- | A timestamp that shows when the job started processing.
transcriptionJobSummary_startTime :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates the location of the output of the transcription job.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>CUSTOMER_BUCKET</tt> then the location is the S3
--   bucket specified in the <tt>outputBucketName</tt> field when the
--   transcription job was started with the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>SERVICE_BUCKET</tt> then the output is stored by
--   Amazon Transcribe and can be retrieved using the URI in the
--   <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> response's <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field.
transcriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe OutputLocationType)

-- | Undocumented member.
transcriptionJobSummary_modelSettings :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe ModelSettings)

-- | A value between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the
--   language it identified in the source audio. A higher score indicates
--   that Amazon Transcribe is more confident in the language it
--   identified.
transcriptionJobSummary_identifiedLanguageScore :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Double)

-- | If the <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
transcriptionJobSummary_failureReason :: Lens' TranscriptionJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The language code of the words in the vocabulary filter.
vocabularyFilterInfo_languageCode :: Lens' VocabularyFilterInfo (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The name of the vocabulary filter. The name must be unique in the
--   account that holds the filter.
vocabularyFilterInfo_vocabularyFilterName :: Lens' VocabularyFilterInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was last updated.
vocabularyFilterInfo_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' VocabularyFilterInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The language code of the vocabulary entries.
vocabularyInfo_languageCode :: Lens' VocabularyInfo (Maybe LanguageCode)

-- | The date and time that the vocabulary was last modified.
vocabularyInfo_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' VocabularyInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the vocabulary.
vocabularyInfo_vocabularyName :: Lens' VocabularyInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The processing state of the vocabulary. If the state is <tt>READY</tt>
--   you can use the vocabulary in a <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   request.
vocabularyInfo_vocabularyState :: Lens' VocabularyInfo (Maybe VocabularyState)


module Network.AWS.Transcribe.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2017-10-26</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Operations and objects for transcribing speech to text.
module Network.AWS.Transcribe

-- | API version <tt>2017-10-26</tt> of the Amazon Transcribe Service SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | We can't find the requested resource. Check the name and try your
--   request again.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your request didn't pass one or more validation tests. For example, if
--   the entity that you're trying to delete doesn't exist or if it is in a
--   non-terminal state (for example, it's "in progress"). See the
--   exception <tt>Message</tt> field for more information.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There is already a resource with that name.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Either you have sent too many requests or your input file is too long.
--   Wait before you resend your request, or use a smaller file and resend
--   the request.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There was an internal error. Check the error message and try your
--   request again.
_InternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListLanguageModels'</a>,
--   <a>listLanguageModels_nextToken</a> - When included, fetches the next
--   set of jobs if the result of the previous request was truncated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nameContains:ListLanguageModels'</a>,
--   <a>listLanguageModels_nameContains</a> - When specified, the custom
--   language model names returned contain the substring you've specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListLanguageModels'</a>,
--   <a>listLanguageModels_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of language
--   models to return in each page of results. If there are fewer results
--   than the value you specify, only the actual results are returned. If
--   you do not specify a value, the default of 5 is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusEquals:ListLanguageModels'</a>,
--   <a>listLanguageModels_statusEquals</a> - When specified, returns only
--   custom language models with the specified status. Language models are
--   ordered by creation date, with the newest models first. If you don't
--   specify a status, Amazon Transcribe returns all custom language models
--   ordered by date.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.
data StartTranscriptionJob
StartTranscriptionJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe ModelSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Subtitles -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JobExecutionSettings -> Maybe Settings -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode) -> Text -> Media -> StartTranscriptionJob

-- | Create a value of <a>StartTranscriptionJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code for the
--   language used in the input media file.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input
--   media file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_contentRedaction</a> - An object that
--   contains the request parameters for content redaction.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifyLanguage:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_identifyLanguage</a> - Set this field to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable automatic language identification. Automatic
--   language identification is disabled by default. You receive a
--   <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error if you enter a value for a
--   <tt>LanguageCode</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputKey:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_outputKey</a> - You can specify a location in
--   an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output of your transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe stores the
--   output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncryptionContext:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_kmsEncryptionContext</a> - A map of plain
--   text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption context pairs,
--   that provide an added layer of security for your data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelSettings:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_modelSettings</a> - Choose the custom
--   language model you use for your transcription job in this parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputEncryptionKMSKeyId:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_outputEncryptionKMSKeyId</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the transcription job. The
--   user calling the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> operation must have
--   permission to use the specified KMS key.
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the
--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key
--   (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subtitles:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_subtitles</a> - Add subtitles to your batch
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_tags</a> - Add tags to an Amazon Transcribe
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate,
--   in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the sample rate detected by Amazon Transcribe. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let
--   Amazon Transcribe determine the sample rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputBucketName:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_outputBucketName</a> - The location where the
--   transcription is stored.
--   
--   If you set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe puts the
--   transcript in the specified S3 bucket. When you call the
--   GetTranscriptionJob operation, the operation returns this location in
--   the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. If you enable content redaction,
--   the redacted transcript appears in <tt>RedactedTranscriptFileUri</tt>.
--   If you enable content redaction and choose to output an unredacted
--   transcript, that transcript's location still appears in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>. The S3 bucket must have permissions that
--   allow Amazon Transcribe to put files in the bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of your transcription using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   If you don't set the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   generates a pre-signed URL, a shareable URL that provides secure
--   access to your transcription, and returns it in the
--   <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt> field. Use this URL to download the
--   transcription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionSettings:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_jobExecutionSettings</a> - Provides
--   information about how a transcription job is executed. Use this field
--   to indicate that the job can be queued for deferred execution if the
--   concurrency limit is reached and there are no slots available to
--   immediately run the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_settings</a> - A <tt>Settings</tt> object
--   that provides optional settings for a transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageOptions:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_languageOptions</a> - An object containing a
--   list of languages that might be present in your collection of audio
--   files. Automatic language identification chooses a language that best
--   matches the source audio from that list.
--   
--   To transcribe speech in Modern Standard Arabic (ar-SA), your audio or
--   video file must be encoded at a sample rate of 16,000 Hz or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobName:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobName</a> - The name of the
--   job. You can't use the strings "<tt>.</tt>" or "<tt>..</tt>" by
--   themselves as the job name. The name must also be unique within an
--   Amazon Web Services account. If you try to create a transcription job
--   with the same name as a previous transcription job, you get a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:StartTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startTranscriptionJob_media</a> - An object that describes the
--   input media for a transcription job.
newStartTranscriptionJob :: Text -> Media -> StartTranscriptionJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartTranscriptionJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StartTranscriptionJobResponse
StartTranscriptionJobResponse' :: Maybe TranscriptionJob -> Int -> StartTranscriptionJobResponse

--   to return in each page of results. If there are fewer results than the
--   value you specify, only the actual results are returned. If you do not
--   specify a value, the default of 5 is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobNameContains:ListTranscriptionJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listTranscriptionJobs_jobNameContains</a> - When specified, the
--   jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs whose name contains the
--   specified string.
newListTranscriptionJobs :: ListTranscriptionJobs

--   can configure Amazon Transcribe Medical to label content in the
--   transcription output. If you specify <tt>PHI</tt>, Amazon Transcribe
--   Medical labels the personal health information (PHI) that it
--   identifies in the transcription output.
--

--   location in an Amazon S3 bucket to store the output of your medical
--   transcription job.
--   
--   If you don't specify an output key, Amazon Transcribe Medical stores
--   the output of your transcription job in the Amazon S3 bucket you
--   specified. By default, the object key is
--   "your-transcription-job-name.json".
--   
--   You can use output keys to specify the Amazon S3 prefix and file name
--   of the transcription output. For example, specifying the Amazon S3
--   prefix, "folder1/folder2/", as an output key would lead to the output
--   being stored as "folder1/folder2/your-transcription-job-name.json". If
--   you specify "my-other-job-name.json" as the output key, the object key
--   is changed to "my-other-job-name.json". You can use an output key to
--   change both the prefix and the file name, for example
--   "folder/my-other-job-name.json".
--   
--   If you specify an output key, you must also specify an S3 bucket in
--   the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
--

--   plain text, non-secret key:value pairs, known as encryption context
--   pairs, that provide an added layer of security for your data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputEncryptionKMSKeyId:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,

--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (KMS) key used to encrypt the output of the transcription job.
--   The user calling the StartMedicalTranscriptionJob operation must have
--   permission to use the specified KMS key.
--

--   account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS key in the current account or
--   another account: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>

--   transcription job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key

--   an output location in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> parameter.
--

--   Transcribe medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample
--   rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must
--   match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most cases,
--   you should leave the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field blank and let

--   the medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName</a> - The
--   name of the medical transcription job. You can't use the strings
--   "<tt>.</tt>" or "<tt>..</tt>" by themselves as the job name. The name
--   must also be unique within an Amazon Web Services account. If you try
--   to create a medical transcription job with the same name as a previous
--   medical transcription job, you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code
--   for the language spoken in the input media file. US English (en-US) is
--   the valid value for medical transcription jobs. Any other value you
--   enter for language code results in a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>
--   error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_media</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputBucketName:StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>startMedicalTranscriptionJob_outputBucketName</a> - The Amazon S3
--   location where the transcription is stored.
--   
--   You must set <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> for Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   to store the transcription results. Your transcript appears in the S3
--   location you specify. When you call the GetMedicalTranscriptionJob,
--   the operation returns this location in the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field. The S3 bucket must have permissions that allow Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical to put files in the bucket. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions Required for IAM User Roles</a>.
--

--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe Medical uses the default Amazon S3 key for

--   bucket.
--

--   of any clinician speaking in the input media.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':StartMedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,

--   input audio. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> refers to conversations between two
--   or more speakers, e.g., a conversations between doctors and patients.
--   <tt>DICTATION</tt> refers to single-speaker dictated speech, such as
--   clinical notes.

data CreateVocabularyFilter
CreateVocabularyFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Text -> LanguageCode -> CreateVocabularyFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateVocabularyFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterFileUri:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterFileUri</a> - The Amazon S3
--   location of a text file used as input to create the vocabulary filter.
--   Only use characters from the character set defined for custom
--   vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see <a>Character Sets for
--   Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   The specified file must be less than 50 KB of UTF-8 characters.
--   
--   If you provide the location of a list of words in the
--   <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter, you can't use the
--   <tt>Words</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_tags</a> - Adds one or more tags, each in
--   the form of a key:value pair, to a new Amazon Transcribe vocabulary
--   filter at the time you create this new vocabulary filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:words:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_words</a> - The words to use in the
--   vocabulary filter. Only use characters from the character set defined
--   for custom vocabularies. For a list of character sets, see
--   <a>Character Sets for Custom Vocabularies</a>.
--   
--   If you provide a list of words in the <tt>Words</tt> parameter, you
--   can't use the <tt>VocabularyFilterFileUri</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The vocabulary
--   filter name. The name must be unique within the account that contains
--   it. If you try to create a vocabulary filter with the same name as
--   another vocabulary filter, you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CreateVocabularyFilter'</a>,
--   <a>createVocabularyFilter_languageCode</a> - The language code of the
--   words in the vocabulary filter. All words in the filter must be in the
--   same language. The vocabulary filter can only be used with
--   transcription jobs in the specified language.
newCreateVocabularyFilter :: Text -> LanguageCode -> CreateVocabularyFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>StartCallAnalyticsJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   <a>startCallAnalyticsJob_channelDefinitions</a> - When you start a
--   call analytics job, you must pass an array that maps the agent and the
--   customer to specific audio channels. The values you can assign to a
--   channel are 0 and 1. The agent and the customer must each have their
--   own channel. You can't assign more than one channel to an agent or
--   customer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputEncryptionKMSKeyId:StartCallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>startCallAnalyticsJob_outputEncryptionKMSKeyId</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   key used to encrypt the output of the call analytics job. The user
--   calling the operation must have permission to use the specified KMS
--   key.
--   
--   You use either of the following to identify an Amazon Web Services KMS
--   key in the current account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either of the following to identify a KMS key in the
--   current account or another account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS key in the current account or
--   another account: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef1234567890ab"</li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:region:account
--   ID:alias/ExampleAlias"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify an encryption key, the output of the call
--   analytics job is encrypted with the default Amazon S3 key (SSE-S3).
--   
--   If you specify a KMS key to encrypt your output, you must also specify
--   an output location in the <tt>OutputLocation</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:StartCallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>startCallAnalyticsJob_settings</a> - A <tt>Settings</tt> object
--   that provides optional settings for a call analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocation:StartCallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>startCallAnalyticsJob_outputLocation</a> - The Amazon S3 location
--   where the output of the call analytics job is stored. You can provide
--   the following location types to store the output of call analytics
--   job:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1If you specify a bucket, Amazon Transcribe
--   saves the output of the analytics job as a JSON file at the root level
--   of the bucket.</li>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/f you specify a path, Amazon
--   Transcribe saves the output of the analytics job as
--   s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/your-transcription-job-name.jsonIf you
--   specify a folder, you must provide a trailing slash.</li>
--   <li>s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET1/folder/filename.jsonIf you provide a path
--   that has the filename specified, Amazon Transcribe saves the output of
--   the analytics job as s3://DOC-EXAMPLEBUCKET1/folder/filename.json</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can specify an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS)
--   key to encrypt the output of our analytics job using the
--   <tt>OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId</tt> parameter. If you don't specify a
--   KMS key, Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for
--   server-side encryption of the analytics job output that is placed in
--   your S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:StartCallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>startCallAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobName</a> - The name of the
--   call analytics job. You can't use the string "." or ".." by themselves
--   as the job name. The name must also be unique within an Amazon Web
--   Services account. If you try to create a call analytics job with the
--   same name as a previous call analytics job, you get a
--   <tt>ConflictException</tt> error.
--

--   your input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this role to read queued
--   audio files. If you have specified an output S3 bucket for your
--   transcription results, this role should have access to the output
--   bucket as well.

--   you create this new vocabulary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:CreateMedicalVocabulary'</a>,
--   <a>createMedicalVocabulary_vocabularyName</a> - The name of the custom
--   vocabulary. This case-sensitive name must be unique within an Amazon
--   Web Services account. If you try to create a vocabulary with the same
--   name as a previous vocabulary, you get a <tt>ConflictException</tt>
--   error.

--   language code of your custom vocabulary must match the language code
--   of your transcription job. US English (en-US) is the only language

--   Amazon S3 of the text file you use to define your custom vocabulary.
--   The URI must be in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the resource
--   that you're calling. Enter information about your
--   <tt>VocabularyFileUri</tt> in the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   https://s3.&lt;aws-region&gt;.amazonaws.com/&lt;bucket-name&gt;/&lt;keyprefix&gt;/&lt;objectkey&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following is an example URI for a vocabulary file that is stored
--   in Amazon S3:
--   
--   <pre>
--   https://s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/AWSDOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/vocab.txt
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon S3 object names, see <a>Object
--   Keys</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--

--   Vocabularies</a>.

pattern MediaFormat_Flac :: MediaFormat
pattern MediaFormat_Mp3 :: MediaFormat
pattern MediaFormat_Mp4 :: MediaFormat
pattern MediaFormat_Ogg :: MediaFormat
pattern MediaFormat_Wav :: MediaFormat
pattern MediaFormat_Webm :: MediaFormat
newtype MedicalContentIdentificationType

[fromMedicalContentIdentificationType] :: MedicalContentIdentificationType -> Text
pattern MedicalContentIdentificationType_PHI :: MedicalContentIdentificationType
newtype ModelStatus
ModelStatus' :: Text -> ModelStatus
[fromModelStatus] :: ModelStatus -> Text
pattern ModelStatus_COMPLETED :: ModelStatus
pattern ModelStatus_FAILED :: ModelStatus
pattern ModelStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: ModelStatus

pattern OutputLocationType_SERVICE_BUCKET :: OutputLocationType

newtype RedactionOutput

pattern RedactionOutput_Redacted_and_unredacted :: RedactionOutput

newtype TranscriptFilterType
