pattern VocabularyState_READY :: VocabularyState

-- | A time range, set in seconds, between two points in the call.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbsoluteTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data AbsoluteTimeRange
AbsoluteTimeRange' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>AbsoluteTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:AbsoluteTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>absoluteTimeRange_startTime</a> - A value that indicates the
--   beginning of the time range in seconds. To set absolute time range,
--   you must specify a start time and an end time. For example, if you
--   specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:AbsoluteTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>absoluteTimeRange_endTime</a> - A value that indicates the end of
--   the time range in milliseconds. To set absolute time range, you must
--   specify a start time and an end time. For example, if you specify the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartTime - 10000</li>
--   <li>Endtime - 50000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The time range is set between 10,000 milliseconds and 50,000
--   milliseconds into the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:last:AbsoluteTimeRange'</a>, <a>absoluteTimeRange_last</a> - A
--   time range from the value that you've specified to the end of the
--   call. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set to the
--   last 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:first:AbsoluteTimeRange'</a>, <a>absoluteTimeRange_first</a> -
--   A time range from the beginning of the call to the value that you've
--   specified. For example, if you specify 100000, the time range is set
--   to the first 100,000 milliseconds of the call.
newAbsoluteTimeRange :: AbsoluteTimeRange

-- | Describes an asynchronous analytics job that was created with the
--   <tt>StartAnalyticsJob</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallAnalyticsJob</a> smart constructor.
data CallAnalyticsJob
CallAnalyticsJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Media -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Transcript -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (NonEmpty ChannelDefinition) -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CallAnalyticsJobSettings -> CallAnalyticsJob

-- | Create a value of <a>CallAnalyticsJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_languageCode</a> - If you know the language spoken
--   between the customer and the agent, specify a language code for this
--   field.
--   
--   If you don't know the language, you can leave this field blank, and
--   Amazon Transcribe will use machine learning to automatically identify
--   the language. To improve the accuracy of language identification, you
--   can provide an array containing the possible language codes for the
--   language spoken in your audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input audio
--   file. Note: for call analytics jobs, only the following media formats
--   are supported: MP3, MP4, WAV, FLAC, OGG, and WebM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobStatus:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobStatus</a> - The status of the
--   analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   analytics job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>, <a>callAnalyticsJob_media</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the analytics job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcript:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_transcript</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   analytics job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelDefinitions:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_channelDefinitions</a> - Shows numeric values to
--   indicate the channel assigned to the agent's audio and the channel
--   assigned to the customer's audio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_identifiedLanguageScore</a> - A value between zero
--   and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the language that it
--   identified in the source audio. This value appears only when you don't
--   provide a single language code. Larger values indicate that Amazon
--   Transcribe has higher confidence in the language that it identified
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_callAnalyticsJobName</a> - The name of the call
--   analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>AnalyticsJobStatus</tt> is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field contains
--   information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>: The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>: The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>: The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>: The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>: The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <i>Guidelines and Quotas</i> in the Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>:
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas in the <a>Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate, in
--   Hertz, of the audio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) that you use to get access to the analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:CallAnalyticsJob'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJob_settings</a> - Provides information about the
--   settings used to run a transcription job.
newCallAnalyticsJob :: CallAnalyticsJob

-- | Provides optional settings for the <tt>CallAnalyticsJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallAnalyticsJobSettings</a> smart constructor.
data CallAnalyticsJobSettings
CallAnalyticsJobSettings' :: Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode) -> CallAnalyticsJobSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>CallAnalyticsJobSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_contentRedaction</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary filter to use when running a call analytics job. The filter
--   that you specify must have the same language code as the analytics
--   job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterMethod:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyFilterMethod</a> - Set to mask
--   to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it with three
--   asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to <tt>remove</tt> to
--   remove filtered text from the transcript without using placeholder
--   text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the transcription output
--   that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set the filter method to
--   <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary filter are not masked
--   or removed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageModelName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageModelName</a> - The structure used
--   to describe a custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_vocabularyName</a> - The name of a
--   vocabulary to use when processing the call analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageOptions:CallAnalyticsJobSettings'</a>,
--   <a>callAnalyticsJobSettings_languageOptions</a> - When you run a call
--   analytics job, you can specify the language spoken in the audio, or
--   you can have Amazon Transcribe identify the language for you.
--   
--   To specify a language, specify an array with one language code. If you
--   don't know the language, you can leave this field blank and Amazon
--   Transcribe will use machine learning to identify the language for you.
--   To improve the ability of Amazon Transcribe to correctly identify the
--   language, you can provide an array of the languages that can be
--   present in the audio. Refer to <a>Supported languages and
--   language-specific features</a> for additional information.
newCallAnalyticsJobSettings :: CallAnalyticsJobSettings

--   the call analytics job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,

--   when the call analytics job was created.
--

--   <a>$sel:callAnalyticsJobName:CallAnalyticsJobSummary'</a>,

--

--   the error.
newCallAnalyticsJobSummary :: CallAnalyticsJobSummary

-- | For a call analytics job, an object that indicates the audio channel
--   that belongs to the agent and the audio channel that belongs to the
--   customer.

data ChannelDefinition

--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:ChannelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>channelDefinition_participantRole</a> - Indicates whether the
--   person speaking on the audio channel is the agent or customer.
newChannelDefinition :: ChannelDefinition

-- | Settings for content redaction within a transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContentRedaction</a> smart constructor.
data ContentRedaction
ContentRedaction' :: RedactionType -> RedactionOutput -> ContentRedaction

-- | Create a value of <a>ContentRedaction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactionType:ContentRedaction'</a>,
--   <a>contentRedaction_redactionType</a> - Request parameter that defines
--   the entities to be redacted. The only accepted value is <tt>PII</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactionOutput:ContentRedaction'</a>,
--   <a>contentRedaction_redactionOutput</a> - The output transcript file
--   stored in either the default S3 bucket or in a bucket you specify.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe outputs only the
--   redacted transcript.
--   
--   When you choose <tt>redacted_and_unredacted</tt> Amazon Transcribe
--   outputs both the redacted and unredacted transcripts.
newContentRedaction :: RedactionType -> RedactionOutput -> ContentRedaction

-- | The object that contains the Amazon S3 object location and access role
--   required to train and tune your custom language model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDataConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InputDataConfig
InputDataConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> InputDataConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDataConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tuningDataS3Uri:InputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>inputDataConfig_tuningDataS3Uri</a> - The Amazon S3 prefix you
--   specify to access the plain text files that you use to tune your
--   custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:InputDataConfig'</a>, <a>inputDataConfig_s3Uri</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 prefix you specify to access the plain text files that you
--   use to train your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:InputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>inputDataConfig_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies the permissions you've given Amazon
--   Transcribe to access your Amazon S3 buckets containing your media
--   files or text data.
newInputDataConfig :: Text -> Text -> InputDataConfig

-- | An object that enables you to configure your category to be applied to
--   call analytics jobs where either the customer or agent was
--   interrupted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInterruptionFilter</a> smart constructor.
data InterruptionFilter
InterruptionFilter' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> InterruptionFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>InterruptionFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_threshold</a> - The duration of the
--   interruption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - An object that allows
--   percentages to specify the proportion of the call where there was a
--   interruption. For example, you can specify the first half of the call.
--   You can also specify the period of time between halfway through to
--   three-quarters of the way through the call. Because the length of
--   conversation can vary between calls, you can apply relative time
--   ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_negate</a> - Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a
--   time period where there was no interruption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_participantRole</a> - Indicates whether the
--   caller or customer was interrupting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:InterruptionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>interruptionFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - An object you can use to
--   specify a time range (in milliseconds) for when you'd want to find the
--   interruption. For example, you could search for an interruption
--   between the 30,000 millisecond mark and the 45,000 millisecond mark.
--   You could also specify the time period as the first 15,000
--   milliseconds or the last 15,000 milliseconds.
newInterruptionFilter :: InterruptionFilter

-- | Provides information about when a transcription job should be
--   executed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionSettings
JobExecutionSettings' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> JobExecutionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowDeferredExecution:JobExecutionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSettings_allowDeferredExecution</a> - Indicates whether
--   a job should be queued by Amazon Transcribe when the concurrent
--   execution limit is exceeded. When the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt>
--   field is true, jobs are queued and executed when the number of
--   executing jobs falls below the concurrent execution limit. If the
--   field is false, Amazon Transcribe returns a
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt> exception.
--   
--   Note that job queuing is enabled by default for call analytics jobs.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:JobExecutionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSettings_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3 bucket that contains
--   the input files. Amazon Transcribe assumes this role to read queued
--   media files. If you have specified an output S3 bucket for the
--   transcription results, this role should have access to the output
--   bucket as well.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>AllowDeferredExecution</tt> field, you must
--   specify the <tt>DataAccessRoleArn</tt> field.
newJobExecutionSettings :: JobExecutionSettings

-- | The structure used to describe a custom language model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLanguageModel</a> smart constructor.
data LanguageModel
LanguageModel' :: Maybe CLMLanguageCode -> Maybe InputDataConfig -> Maybe ModelStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BaseModelName -> LanguageModel

-- | Create a value of <a>LanguageModel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_languageCode</a> - The language code you used to
--   create your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_inputDataConfig</a> - The data access role and Amazon
--   S3 prefixes for the input files used to train the custom language
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelStatus:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_modelStatus</a> - The creation status of a custom
--   language model. When the status is <tt>COMPLETED</tt> the model is
--   ready for use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_failureReason</a> - The reason why the custom
--   language model couldn't be created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTime:LanguageModel'</a>, <a>languageModel_createTime</a>
--   - The time the custom language model was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:upgradeAvailability:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_upgradeAvailability</a> - Whether the base model used
--   for the custom language model is up to date. If this field is
--   <tt>true</tt> then you are running the most up-to-date version of the
--   base model in your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_lastModifiedTime</a> - The most recent time the
--   custom language model was modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelName:LanguageModel'</a>, <a>languageModel_modelName</a> -
--   The name of the custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseModelName:LanguageModel'</a>,
--   <a>languageModel_baseModelName</a> - The Amazon Transcribe standard
--   language model, or base model used to create the custom language
--   model.
newLanguageModel :: LanguageModel

-- | Describes the input media file in a transcription request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedia</a> smart constructor.
data Media
Media' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Media

-- | Create a value of <a>Media</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFileUri:Media'</a>, <a>media_mediaFileUri</a> - The S3
--   object location of the input media file. The URI must be in the same
--   region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form is:
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   For more information about S3 object names, see <a>Object Keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactedMediaFileUri:Media'</a>,
--   <a>media_redactedMediaFileUri</a> - The S3 object location for your
--   redacted output media file. This is only supported for call analytics
--   jobs.
newMedia :: Media

data MedicalTranscript

newMedicalTranscript :: MedicalTranscript

-- | The data structure that contains the information for a medical
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.
data MedicalTranscriptionJob
MedicalTranscriptionJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Media -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe MedicalTranscript -> Maybe MedicalContentIdentificationType -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Specialty -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Type -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MedicalTranscriptionSetting -> MedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code for
--   the language spoken in the source audio file. US English (en-US) is
--   the only supported language for medical transcriptions. Any other
--   value you enter for language code results in a
--   <tt>BadRequestException</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input
--   media file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_media</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcript:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_transcript</a> - An object that contains
--   the <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>. The <tt>MedicalTranscript</tt>
--   contains the <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_contentIdentificationType</a> - Shows the
--   type of content that you've configured Amazon Transcribe Medical to
--   identify in a transcription job. If the value is <tt>PHI</tt>, you've
--   configured the job to identify personal health information (PHI) in
--   the transcription output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus</a> - The completion
--   status of a medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:specialty:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_specialty</a> - The medical specialty of
--   any clinicians providing a dictation or having a conversation. Refer
--   to <a>Transcribing a medical conversation</a>for a list of supported
--   specialties.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field contains one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt>- The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><tt>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</tt>- The media format of the audio file doesn't match the
--   format specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request.
--   Check the media format of your media file and make sure the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt>- The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt>- The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt>- The size of your
--   audio file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe Medical can process.
--   For more information, see <a>Guidelines and Quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Transcribe Medical Guide</i></li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>-
--   Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe Medical is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical Endpoints and Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services General Reference</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_tags</a> - A key:value pair assigned to a
--   given medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate,
--   in Hertz, of the source audio containing medical information.
--   
--   If you don't specify the sample rate, Amazon Transcribe Medical
--   determines it for you. If you choose to specify the sample rate, it
--   must match the rate detected by Amazon Transcribe Medical. In most
--   cases, you should leave the <tt>MedicalMediaSampleHertz</tt> blank and
--   let Amazon Transcribe Medical determine the sample rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_type</a> - The type of speech in the
--   transcription job. <tt>CONVERSATION</tt> is generally used for
--   patient-physician dialogues. <tt>DICTATION</tt> is the setting for
--   physicians speaking their notes after seeing a patient. For more
--   information, see <a>What is Amazon Transcribe Medical?</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_medicalTranscriptionJobName</a> - The name
--   for a given medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:MedicalTranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJob_settings</a> - Object that contains object.
newMedicalTranscriptionJob :: MedicalTranscriptionJob

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that
--   shows when the medical transcription job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_completionTime</a> - A timestamp
--   that shows when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentIdentificationType:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,

--   Shows the type of information you've configured Amazon Transcribe

--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType</a> - Indicates
--   the location of the transcription job's output. This field must be the
--   path of an S3 bucket; if you don't already have an S3 bucket, one is
--   created based on the path you add.

--   conversation</a>for a list of supported specialties.

--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_type</a> - The speech of the
--   clinician in the input audio.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:medicalTranscriptionJobName:MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionJobSummary_medicalTranscriptionJobName</a> -
--   The name of a medical transcription job.
newMedicalTranscriptionJobSummary :: MedicalTranscriptionJobSummary

-- | Optional settings for the StartMedicalTranscriptionJob operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMedicalTranscriptionSetting</a> smart constructor.
data MedicalTranscriptionSetting
MedicalTranscriptionSetting' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | Create a value of <a>MedicalTranscriptionSetting</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:showAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_showAlternatives</a> - Determines
--   whether alternative transcripts are generated along with the
--   transcript that has the highest confidence. If you set
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelIdentification:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_channelIdentification</a> - Instructs
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical to process each audio channel separately and
--   then merge the transcription output of each channel into a single
--   transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe Medical also produces a transcription of each item
--   detected on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of
--   the item and alternative transcriptions of item. The alternative
--   transcriptions also come with confidence scores provided by Amazon
--   Transcribe Medical.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxAlternatives:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_maxAlternatives</a> - The maximum
--   number of alternatives that you tell the service to return. If you
--   specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:showSpeakerLabels:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_showSpeakerLabels</a> - Determines
--   whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to identify
--   different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition labels
--   individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true, you must also set the
--   maximum number of speaker labels in the <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_vocabularyName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary to use when processing a medical transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSpeakerLabels:MedicalTranscriptionSetting'</a>,
--   <a>medicalTranscriptionSetting_maxSpeakerLabels</a> - The maximum
--   number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If there are more
--   speakers in the audio than this number, multiple speakers are
--   identified as a single speaker. If you specify the
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must set the
--   <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
newMedicalTranscriptionSetting :: MedicalTranscriptionSetting

-- | An object that enables you to configure your category to be applied to
--   call analytics jobs where either the customer or agent was
--   interrupted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNonTalkTimeFilter</a> smart constructor.
data NonTalkTimeFilter
NonTalkTimeFilter' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> NonTalkTimeFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>NonTalkTimeFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:NonTalkTimeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nonTalkTimeFilter_threshold</a> - The duration of the period when
--   neither the customer nor agent was talking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:NonTalkTimeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nonTalkTimeFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - An object that allows
--   percentages to specify the proportion of the call where there was
--   silence. For example, you can specify the first half of the call. You
--   can also specify the period of time between halfway through to
--   three-quarters of the way through the call. Because the length of
--   conversation can vary between calls, you can apply relative time
--   ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:NonTalkTimeFilter'</a>, <a>nonTalkTimeFilter_negate</a>
--   - Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for a time period when people were
--   talking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:NonTalkTimeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nonTalkTimeFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - An object you can use to
--   specify a time range (in milliseconds) for when no one is talking. For
--   example, you could specify a time period between the 30,000
--   millisecond mark and the 45,000 millisecond mark. You could also
--   specify the time period as the first 15,000 milliseconds or the last
--   15,000 milliseconds.
newNonTalkTimeFilter :: NonTalkTimeFilter

-- | An object that allows percentages to specify the proportion of the
--   call where you would like to apply a filter. For example, you can
--   specify the first half of the call. You can also specify the period of
--   time between halfway through to three-quarters of the way through the
--   call. Because the length of conversation can vary between calls, you
--   can apply relative time ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRelativeTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data RelativeTimeRange
RelativeTimeRange' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> RelativeTimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>RelativeTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startPercentage:RelativeTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>relativeTimeRange_startPercentage</a> - A value that indicates the
--   percentage of the beginning of the time range. To set a relative time
--   range, you must specify a start percentage and an end percentage. For
--   example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endPercentage:RelativeTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>relativeTimeRange_endPercentage</a> - A value that indicates the
--   percentage of the end of the time range. To set a relative time range,
--   you must specify a start percentage and an end percentage. For
--   example, if you specify the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>StartPercentage - 10</li>
--   <li>EndPercentage - 50</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This looks at the time range starting from 10% of the way into the
--   call to 50% of the way through the call. For a call that lasts 100,000
--   milliseconds, this example range would apply from the 10,000
--   millisecond mark to the 50,000 millisecond mark.
--   
--   <a>$sel:last:RelativeTimeRange'</a>, <a>relativeTimeRange_last</a> - A
--   range that takes the portion of the call from the time in milliseconds
--   set by the value that you've specified to the end of the call. For
--   example, if you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is set for the
--   last 120,000 milliseconds of the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:first:RelativeTimeRange'</a>, <a>relativeTimeRange_first</a> -
--   A range that takes the portion of the call up to the time in
--   milliseconds set by the value that you've specified. For example, if
--   you specify <tt>120000</tt>, the time range is set for the first
--   120,000 milliseconds of the call.
newRelativeTimeRange :: RelativeTimeRange

-- | A condition in the call between the customer and the agent that you
--   want to filter for.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRule</a> smart constructor.
data Rule
Rule' :: Maybe SentimentFilter -> Maybe InterruptionFilter -> Maybe TranscriptFilter -> Maybe NonTalkTimeFilter -> Rule

-- | Create a value of <a>Rule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentimentFilter:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_sentimentFilter</a> - A
--   condition that is applied to a particular customer sentiment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:interruptionFilter:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_interruptionFilter</a> -
--   A condition for a time period when either the customer or agent was
--   interrupting the other person.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptFilter:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_transcriptFilter</a> - A
--   condition that catches particular words or phrases based on a exact
--   match. For example, if you set the phrase "I want to speak to the
--   manager", only that exact phrase will be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonTalkTimeFilter:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_nonTalkTimeFilter</a> - A
--   condition for a time period when neither the customer nor the agent
--   was talking.
newRule :: Rule

-- | An object that enables you to specify a particular customer or agent
--   sentiment. If at least 50 percent of the conversation turns (the
--   back-and-forth between two speakers) in a specified time period match
--   the specified sentiment, Amazon Transcribe will consider the sentiment
--   a match.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSentimentFilter</a> smart constructor.
data SentimentFilter
SentimentFilter' :: Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> NonEmpty SentimentValue -> SentimentFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>SentimentFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:SentimentFilter'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - The time range, set in
--   percentages, that correspond to proportion of the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:SentimentFilter'</a>, <a>sentimentFilter_negate</a> -
--   Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to look for sentiments that weren't specified in
--   the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:SentimentFilter'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentFilter_participantRole</a> - A value that determines
--   whether the sentiment belongs to the customer or the agent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:SentimentFilter'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - The time range, measured in
--   seconds, of the sentiment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentiments:SentimentFilter'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentFilter_sentiments</a> - An array that enables you to
--   specify sentiments for the customer or agent. You can specify one or
--   more values.
newSentimentFilter :: NonEmpty SentimentValue -> SentimentFilter

-- | Provides optional settings for the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Settings
Settings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyFilterMethod -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>Settings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The name of the vocabulary
--   filter to use when transcribing the audio. The filter that you specify
--   must have the same language code as the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterMethod:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_vocabularyFilterMethod</a> - Set to <tt>mask</tt> to
--   remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it with three
--   asterisks ("***") as placeholder text. Set to <tt>remove</tt> to
--   remove filtered text from the transcript without using placeholder
--   text. Set to <tt>tag</tt> to mark the word in the transcription output
--   that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set the filter method to
--   <tt>tag</tt>, the words matching your vocabulary filter are not masked
--   or removed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:showAlternatives:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_showAlternatives</a> - Determines whether the
--   transcription contains alternative transcriptions. If you set the
--   <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true, you must also set the maximum
--   number of alternatives to return in the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelIdentification:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_channelIdentification</a> - Instructs Amazon Transcribe to
--   process each audio channel separately and then merge the transcription
--   output of each channel into a single transcription.
--   
--   Amazon Transcribe also produces a transcription of each item detected
--   on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of the item
--   and alternative transcriptions of the item including the confidence
--   that Amazon Transcribe has in the transcription.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxAlternatives:Settings'</a>, <a>settings_maxAlternatives</a>
--   - The number of alternative transcriptions that the service should
--   return. If you specify the <tt>MaxAlternatives</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowAlternatives</tt> field to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:showSpeakerLabels:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_showSpeakerLabels</a> - Determines whether the
--   transcription job uses speaker recognition to identify different
--   speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition labels individual
--   speakers in the audio file. If you set the <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt>
--   field to true, you must also set the maximum number of speaker labels
--   <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field.
--   
--   You can't set both <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> and
--   <tt>ChannelIdentification</tt> in the same request. If you set both,
--   your request returns a <tt>BadRequestException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:Settings'</a>, <a>settings_vocabularyName</a> -
--   The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSpeakerLabels:Settings'</a>,
--   <a>settings_maxSpeakerLabels</a> - The maximum number of speakers to
--   identify in the input audio. If there are more speakers in the audio
--   than this number, multiple speakers are identified as a single
--   speaker. If you specify the <tt>MaxSpeakerLabels</tt> field, you must
--   set the <tt>ShowSpeakerLabels</tt> field to true.
newSettings :: Settings

-- | Generate subtitles for your batch transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubtitles</a> smart constructor.
data Subtitles
Subtitles' :: Maybe [SubtitleFormat] -> Subtitles

-- | Create a value of <a>Subtitles</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:formats:Subtitles'</a>, <a>subtitles_formats</a> - Specify the
--   output format for your subtitle file.
newSubtitles :: Subtitles

-- | Specify the output format for your subtitle file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubtitlesOutput</a> smart constructor.
data SubtitlesOutput
SubtitlesOutput' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [SubtitleFormat] -> SubtitlesOutput

-- | Create a value of <a>SubtitlesOutput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subtitleFileUris:SubtitlesOutput'</a>,
--   <a>subtitlesOutput_subtitleFileUris</a> - Choose the output location
--   for your subtitle file. This location must be an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:formats:SubtitlesOutput'</a>, <a>subtitlesOutput_formats</a> -
--   Specify the output format for your subtitle file; if you select both
--   SRT and VTT formats, two output files are genereated.
newSubtitlesOutput :: SubtitlesOutput

-- | A key:value pair that adds metadata to a resource used by Amazon
--   Transcribe. For example, a tag with the key:value pair
--   Department:Sales might be added to a resource to indicate its use
--   by your organization's sales department.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The first part of a key:value
--   pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For example,
--   in the tag Department:Sales, the key is 'Department'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The second part of a
--   key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For
--   example, in the tag Department:Sales, the value is 'Sales'.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Identifies the location of a transcription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTranscript</a> smart constructor.
data Transcript
Transcript' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Transcript

-- | Create a value of <a>Transcript</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptFileUri:Transcript'</a>,
--   <a>transcript_transcriptFileUri</a> - The S3 object location of the
--   transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the transcript. If you specified an S3 bucket
--   in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the job, this
--   is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the transcript in
--   Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides secure access
--   to that location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactedTranscriptFileUri:Transcript'</a>,
--   <a>transcript_redactedTranscriptFileUri</a> - The S3 object location
--   of the redacted transcript.
--   
--   Use this URI to access the redacted transcript. If you specified an S3
--   bucket in the <tt>OutputBucketName</tt> field when you created the
--   job, this is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the
--   transcript in Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides
--   secure access to that location.
newTranscript :: Transcript

-- | Matches the output of the transcription to either the specific phrases
--   that you specify, or the intent of the phrases that you specify.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTranscriptFilter</a> smart constructor.
data TranscriptFilter
TranscriptFilter' :: Maybe RelativeTimeRange -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ParticipantRole -> Maybe AbsoluteTimeRange -> TranscriptFilterType -> NonEmpty Text -> TranscriptFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>TranscriptFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativeTimeRange:TranscriptFilter'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptFilter_relativeTimeRange</a> - An object that allows
--   percentages to specify the proportion of the call where you would like
--   to apply a filter. For example, you can specify the first half of the
--   call. You can also specify the period of time between halfway through
--   to three-quarters of the way through the call. Because the length of
--   conversation can vary between calls, you can apply relative time
--   ranges across all calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:negate:TranscriptFilter'</a>, <a>transcriptFilter_negate</a> -
--   If <tt>TRUE</tt>, the rule that you specify is applied to everything
--   except for the phrases that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:participantRole:TranscriptFilter'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptFilter_participantRole</a> - Determines whether the
--   customer or the agent is speaking the phrases that you've specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absoluteTimeRange:TranscriptFilter'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptFilter_absoluteTimeRange</a> - A time range, set in
--   seconds, between two points in the call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptFilterType:TranscriptFilter'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptFilter_transcriptFilterType</a> - Matches the phrase to
--   the transcription output in a word for word fashion. For example, if
--   you specify the phrase "I want to speak to the manager." Amazon
--   Transcribe attempts to match that specific phrase to the
--   transcription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:TranscriptFilter'</a>, <a>transcriptFilter_targets</a>
--   - The phrases that you're specifying for the transcript filter to
--   match.
newTranscriptFilter :: TranscriptFilterType -> NonEmpty Text -> TranscriptFilter

-- | Describes an asynchronous transcription job that was created with the
--   <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTranscriptionJob</a> smart constructor.
data TranscriptionJob
TranscriptionJob' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe MediaFormat -> Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Media -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Transcript -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ModelSettings -> Maybe Double -> Maybe SubtitlesOutput -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe JobExecutionSettings -> Maybe Settings -> Maybe (NonEmpty LanguageCode) -> TranscriptionJob

-- | Create a value of <a>TranscriptionJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_languageCode</a> - The language code for the input
--   speech.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaFormat:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_mediaFormat</a> - The format of the input media
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_contentRedaction</a> - An object that describes
--   content redaction settings for the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:media:TranscriptionJob'</a>, <a>transcriptionJob_media</a> -
--   An object that describes the input media for the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the job completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcript:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_transcript</a> - An object that describes the
--   output of the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifyLanguage:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_identifyLanguage</a> - A value that shows if
--   automatic language identification was enabled for a transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobName:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_transcriptionJobName</a> - The name of the
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_transcriptionJobStatus</a> - The status of the
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when the
--   job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelSettings:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_modelSettings</a> - An object containing the
--   details of your custom language model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_identifiedLanguageScore</a> - A value between zero
--   and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the language that it
--   identified in the source audio. Larger values indicate that Amazon
--   Transcribe has higher confidence in the language it identified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subtitles:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_subtitles</a> - Generate subtitles for your batch
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, this field
--   contains information about why the job failed.
--   
--   The <tt>FailureReason</tt> field can contain one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Unsupported media format</tt> - The media format specified in
--   the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field of the request isn't valid. See the
--   description of the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field for a list of valid
--   values.</li>
--   <li><pre>The media format provided does not match the detected media
--   format</pre></li>
--   <li>The media format of the audio file doesn't match the format
--   specified in the <tt>MediaFormat</tt> field in the request. Check the
--   media format of your media file and make sure that the two values
--   match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid sample rate for audio file</tt> - The sample rate
--   specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> of the request isn't
--   valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 Hertz.</li>
--   <li><tt>The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample
--   rate</tt> - The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample
--   rate specified in the <tt>MediaSampleRateHertz</tt> field in the
--   request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that
--   the two values match.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid file size: file size too large</tt> - The size of your
--   audio file is larger than Amazon Transcribe can process. For more
--   information, see <a>Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Transcribe Developer
--   Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large</tt>
--   - Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe is
--   configured to process. To request additional channels, see <a>Amazon
--   Transcribe Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TranscriptionJob'</a>, <a>transcriptionJob_tags</a> - A
--   key:value pair assigned to a given transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaSampleRateHertz:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_mediaSampleRateHertz</a> - The sample rate, in
--   Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionSettings:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_jobExecutionSettings</a> - Provides information
--   about how a transcription job is executed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_settings</a> - Optional settings for the
--   transcription job. Use these settings to turn on speaker recognition,
--   to set the maximum number of speakers that should be identified and to
--   specify a custom vocabulary to use when processing the transcription
--   job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageOptions:TranscriptionJob'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJob_languageOptions</a> - An object that shows the
--   optional array of languages inputted for transcription jobs with
--   automatic language identification enabled.
newTranscriptionJob :: TranscriptionJob

-- | Provides a summary of information about a transcription job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTranscriptionJobSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TranscriptionJobSummary
TranscriptionJobSummary' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe ContentRedaction -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TranscriptionJobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe OutputLocationType -> Maybe ModelSettings -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> TranscriptionJobSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>TranscriptionJobSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_languageCode</a> - The language code for
--   the input speech.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRedaction:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_contentRedaction</a> - The content
--   redaction settings of the transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_creationTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_completionTime</a> - A timestamp that shows
--   when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifyLanguage:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_identifyLanguage</a> - Whether automatic
--   language identification was enabled for a transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobName:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobName</a> - The name of the
--   transcription job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transcriptionJobStatus:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_transcriptionJobStatus</a> - The status of
--   the transcription job. When the status is <tt>COMPLETED</tt>, use the
--   <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> operation to get the results of the
--   transcription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_startTime</a> - A timestamp that shows when
--   the job started processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocationType:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_outputLocationType</a> - Indicates the
--   location of the output of the transcription job.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>CUSTOMER_BUCKET</tt> then the location is the S3
--   bucket specified in the <tt>outputBucketName</tt> field when the
--   transcription job was started with the <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>SERVICE_BUCKET</tt> then the output is stored by
--   Amazon Transcribe and can be retrieved using the URI in the
--   <tt>GetTranscriptionJob</tt> response's <tt>TranscriptFileUri</tt>
--   field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelSettings:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_modelSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifiedLanguageScore:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_identifiedLanguageScore</a> - A value
--   between zero and one that Amazon Transcribe assigned to the language
--   it identified in the source audio. A higher score indicates that
--   Amazon Transcribe is more confident in the language it identified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:TranscriptionJobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>transcriptionJobSummary_failureReason</a> - If the
--   <tt>TranscriptionJobStatus</tt> field is <tt>FAILED</tt>, a
--   description of the error.
newTranscriptionJobSummary :: TranscriptionJobSummary

-- | Provides information about a vocabulary filter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVocabularyFilterInfo</a> smart constructor.
data VocabularyFilterInfo
VocabularyFilterInfo' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> VocabularyFilterInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>VocabularyFilterInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VocabularyFilterInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyFilterInfo_languageCode</a> - The language code of the
--   words in the vocabulary filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyFilterName:VocabularyFilterInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyFilterInfo_vocabularyFilterName</a> - The name of the
--   vocabulary filter. The name must be unique in the account that holds
--   the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:VocabularyFilterInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyFilterInfo_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time that
--   the vocabulary was last updated.
newVocabularyFilterInfo :: VocabularyFilterInfo

-- | Provides information about a custom vocabulary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVocabularyInfo</a> smart constructor.
data VocabularyInfo
VocabularyInfo' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VocabularyState -> VocabularyInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>VocabularyInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VocabularyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyInfo_languageCode</a> - The language code of the
--   vocabulary entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:VocabularyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyInfo_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time that the
--   vocabulary was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyName:VocabularyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyInfo_vocabularyName</a> - The name of the vocabulary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vocabularyState:VocabularyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>vocabularyInfo_vocabularyState</a> - The processing state of the
--   vocabulary. If the state is <tt>READY</tt> you can use the vocabulary
--   in a <tt>StartTranscriptionJob</tt> request.
newVocabularyInfo :: VocabularyInfo
